title: DAOTOOL101#6: Real-Time Financing with Superfluid
body:
### Table of Contents

* What is Superfluid?
* Importance of Superfluid
* How to wrap your Crypto?
* How to start a Stream?
* How to claim crypto as a receiver?
* How to cancel an active stream?
* Summary
* FAQ
* Useful links

## What is Superfluid?

Superfluid is a smart contract framework on Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) networks that allows for the easy, secure, and fast transfer of assets In real time based on pre-determined rules set forth in agreements. With only one on-chain transaction, the money will flow directly from your wallet to the receiver's in real time--no further transactions are necessary. Superfluid enables constant token flows on-chain with no capital lockups. Money streams will continue perpetually until cancellation or the sender's balance runs out. Money streams can also have their stream rate updated at any time for even more flexibility.

Super fluid was designed with simplicity and ease-of-use in mind. To get started, all you have to do is select a contributor and input instructions. Then, the protocol will automatically follow the instructions that have been set forth. This makes it easy for everyone to get on board and use the system without any trouble.

**Note**: 

It's important to wrap your crypto in order to streamline payment.

Be careful with how the Cancellation works:

Understand that you **have to cancel the stream before your balance reaches zero or else you will be liquidated and you will lose your buffer(FAQ).**

### Importance of Superfluid

Paying people quickly for their work can help improve productivity by ensuring that there are no delays in payments that could lead to a dip in productivity. In the past, we didn't have the ability to finance contributor compensation in real time, but now we do. This also helps with automation when it comes to making monthly, recurring, or one-time payments.

Even further, a DAO can use superfluid to DCA into investments, liquidity pool or any subscriptions etc in a single transaction, which means no multiple gas fees.

Entering a financial agreement with someone can be a daunting task. Humans are also prone to making mistakes and being dishonest sometimes which can cause financial loss for the other party. Superfluid helps users to transfer assets in a fair and transparent way. A smart contract is deployed by the receiver and the sender transfers assets to an address associated with that contract. The assets are then sent to the receiver according to the predefined rules of the contract. Superfluid takes care of execution and enforcement. It allows users to enjoy the speed of executing a trade while taking care of the complexities so they don't have to.

[https://twitter.com/Superfluid_HQ/status/1551642991214972938?s=20&t=udeOMGTxr6j53kW7deL2VQ](https://twitter.com/Superfluid_HQ/status/1551642991214972938?s=20&t=udeOMGTxr6j53kW7deL2VQ)

### How to wrap your Crypto?

1\. Login to your Gnosis safe account and Go to Apps section

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/56ox3Irkpte3yIUbILFx5.png?height=2304&width=4096&size=large)

2\. Search `Superfluid` and Select It

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/R_a6zlQ8EsL1_k_U2shsv.png?height=2304&width=4096&size=large)

3\. Before using a 3rd party app with gnosis, you must read and agree to the Disclaimers and other precautions. Click `Continue` to proceed.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/bYDTJIN6w7U7xOSrcmzXr.png?height=2304&width=4096&size=large)

4\. Click on `Continue`

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/iVhhueHWmEn_V-0R4FvyQ.png?height=2304&width=4096&size=large)

5\. You will be Logged in to the Superfluid Dashboard. Click on `Wrap` 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/fcrS2HcvvcubPIdYnkIpR.png?height=2304&width=4096&size=large)

6\. Choose the cryptocurrency you want to wrap and input the amount you want to convert. After that, click on `Upgrade to Super Token`.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/563MJ2XYuFuKxgNqLXaez.png?height=2304&width=4096&size=large)

7\. You will be prompted to submit the transaction. Click on `Submit`

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/tEHdKdh-9gdwGRhtD7Xuu.png?height=2304&width=4096&size=large)

8\. `Confirm` the Transaction

**Note:** A transaction will only execute if the required number of Multi sig signers approve it.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/js7hR36DOs-MofbWH82Uo.png?height=2304&width=4096&size=large)

9\. You have Successfully wrapped the Crypto!!

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/1CXKsA3LMiYnp-vLaZxly.png?height=2304&width=4096&size=large)

### How to start a Stream?

1\. To Start a Stream after you have wrapped the Crypto, go to the left-hand side of your screen and look for the tab labelled `Send Stream`.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/MSS62VT9xNsql4D5OWEhF.png?height=2304&width=4096&size=large)

2\. Input the details and parameters

Note: Be careful with how the Cancellation works

> I understand that if **I have to cancel the stream before my balance reaches zero or else I will be liquidated and lose my buffer.**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/PWkuh8ybzYKdQx4V2Ott5.png?height=2304&width=4096&size=large)

3\. Review and Click on `Send`

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/0JnrMiN_KS7ZZ8H5fo5La.png?height=2304&width=4096&size=large)

4\. You will be prompted to submit the transaction. Click on `Submit`

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/o7g3FYaB4mzFD4zyDZhmM.png?height=2304&width=4096&size=large)

5\. `Confirm` the Transaction

**Note:** A transaction will only execute if the required number of Multi sig signers approve it.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/JSs_N-nIE0uV6K5gX8CRM.png?height=2304&width=4096&size=large)

6\. You have Successfully Created the Stream!!

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/w77cWoBuuJ4V0w7mcfyNt.png?height=2304&width=4096&size=large)

### How to claim Crypto as a Receiver?

1\. Head over to the [Official site](https://www.superfluid.finance/home) and Click on `Get Started`

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/NDqJlrjF5zG8YiHa08Jnp.png?height=2304&width=4096&size=large)

2\. Click on `Go to dashboard`

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/QgxmYUMya0yn1rzvHnV_d.png?height=2304&width=4096&size=large)

3\. `Connect` your Wallet

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xWFVki9BeYd6K9HyOTjP6.png?height=2304&width=4096&size=large)

4\. Select your account and click on `Next`

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/eagBEbTdOvqlYh-8pcujv.png?height=2304&width=4096&size=large)

5\. Click on `Connect` only after double checking the site URL

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/RWtAqS9mfHkcQkjLma26j.png?height=2304&width=4096&size=large)

6\. You will be Logged Into Superfluid. Go to `Wrap/Unwrap` Section

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/DhJtXgfsVX-W7flQVp_qU.png?height=2304&width=4096&size=large)

7\. Go to `Unwrap` Section as the receiving Crypto is in Wrapped form(Super token)

Note: My current balance is 1.1212 MATIC

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/C8CeC2ajEmrrDBZusripi.png?height=2304&width=4096&size=large)

8\. Choose the Crypto you want to Unwrap, fill In the amount and then Click on `Downgrade`

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/rMnz6erne2dF4nVQyT6JJ.png?height=2304&width=4096&size=large)

9\. `Confirm` the Transaction

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/tVDQOK8cDvVkQ-FWFZM5z.png?height=2304&width=4096&size=large)

10\. You have successfully Unwrapped and Claimed the Crypto.

You can view It In your Activity History and Wallet

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xQO3_tgw6epAQMyLYmp_m.png?height=2304&width=4096&size=large)

### How to cancel an active stream?

1\. To cancel an active stream, select the Super Token In which streaming is happening.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/KAeqwgxkWkNa_TTZW_-fR.png?height=2304&width=4096&size=large)

 2. Select the stream you want to cancel and click on `Cancel Stream` 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/s1t79zPqD3_1w3uaHgWlm.png?height=2304&width=4096&size=large)

3\. You will be prompted to submit the transaction. Click on `Submit`

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/tTqKm9uLhpAcO7cp6UQTk.png?height=2304&width=4096&size=large)

4\. `Confirm` the Transaction

**Note:** A transaction will only execute if the required number of Multi sig signers approve it.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/3LklJ-JECiJap0ogUcyzg.png?height=2304&width=4096&size=large)

5\. You have successfully Cancelled the stream.

You can view It In your Activity History 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Evobe83ZsdfxwK8AP_bMO.png?height=2304&width=4096&size=large)

### Summary

Superfluid is a blockchain-based platform that makes it easy for DAOs to fund their contributors in a trustless, fast and transparent way. The platform has an easy to use front end that allows for real-time financing and payments using smart contracts.

**FAQ**

* **Which chains is Superfluid deployed to?** 

Deployed on L2s: Polygon, Gnosis chain, Arbitrum, Optimism and Avalanche.

* **What is the deposit when starting the stream?**

  It is an amount equivalent to 4-hours worth of your stream flow rate. It will be locked into the protocol and you will get it back when you close the stream before your wallet balance hits zero. Streams can‚Äôt stop themselves automatically, users need to stop them before their balance hits zero. If the user doesn‚Äôt stop their stream before their account balance hits zero, they lose the **deposit/buffer.**
* **Why did my stream get liquidated? Why did I lose my deposit?** 

  Streams can‚Äôt stop themselves automatically, users need to stop them before their balance hits zero. If the user doesn‚Äôt stop their stream before their account balance hits zero, they lose the deposit/buffer.
* **My stream got rejected or failed. What should I do?** 

  Try to follow the steps here: <https://help.superfluid.finance/en/articles/5852994-resolving-transaction-rejected-or-failed-errors> 
* **Can I choose any existing ERC-20 token for a Superfluid stream?** 

  Yes, superfluid is agnostic as to which token you use.

**Useful links**

[Website](https://www.superfluid.finance/home)

[GitHub](https://github.com/superfluid-finance)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/intent/follow?screen_name=Superfluid_HQ)

[Discord](https://discord.com/invite/XsK7nahanQ)

[DOC](https://docs.superfluid.finance/superfluid/)

title: How woke do you want it? A hot take on the Norton Anthology of American Literature's "Preface to the Tenth Edition"
body:
After going to print on the first of this month, the newest version of the Norton Anthology of American Literature was delivered to me by the exceptionally-rude DHL deliveryman today ‚Äî and, after reading the "Preface to the Tenth Edition," it is clear that this version of the quintessential doorstop promises to be (unsurprisingly) the wokest version yet.

"Diversity" is certainly the keyword, here ‚Äî given that it is repeated in place of synonyms throughout ‚Äî as the preface tries to do its job of justifying why you just dropped nearly a couple hundred United States dollars on the Tenth Edition when the Ninth Edition would‚Äôve almost certainly sufficed. 

Of the seventeen new writers included, it isn‚Äôt entirely clear from the onset if any of them are white males ‚Äî not that there is anything resembling an underrepresentation of this demographic in the Anthology ‚Äî but it is explicitly clear that most, if not all, are Black and/or women and/or Native American and/or Chinese and/or not Caucasian. **Of course, this isn‚Äôt inherently problematic!** In fact, it‚Äôs presumably more interesting to see the addition of "well-bred" colonial women‚Äôs writing in Volume A than more uptight white dudes, and the Modernist period is certainly ripe for today‚Äôs uber-woke discussions of identity politics.

Where the preface teeters on the border between the expected liberalism endemic to academia and full-blown wokeness, however, is in its not-so-subtle takes on racism in today‚Äôs American landscape. For example, it claims the Reconstruction‚Äôs legacy ‚Äúis still being felt in the national reckoning with racism and inequality‚Äù and separately addresses what it defines as ‚Äúthe renewed reckoning with anti-Black racism that began in 2014, arising from shootings of young black men‚Äîparticularly of Trayvon Martin in 2012 and Michael Brown in 2014.‚Äù I‚Äôm not saying these two quotes aren‚Äôt true or anything, but‚Ä¶

While I admittedly have not read these clusters (the books literally hit my doorstep today), it feels like a mild-to-moderate stretch to claim the United States of America in 2022 ‚Äî in the midst of Covid-response consequences, an energy crisis, potential food shortages, rapid inflation, a potential recession, a widening wealth gap, political discontent, etc. ‚Äî is still under any sort of noteworthy influence from 1877 America. (Many Americans probably don‚Äôt even know what the Reconstruction is.) 

Likewise, the President of the United States during the shootings of Trayvon Martin and Michael Brown was Barack Obama (not exactly Andrew Johnson), and one might argue that the larger issue at hand had more to do with systemic failings with the American police state/force and mainstream media fire-stoking ‚Äî themes which I assume are not discussed in Volume E, though I would be happy to be wrong ‚Äî than an organic resurgence in national racism.

**TL;DR racism certainly exists in today‚Äôs America, but it is not black-and-white ‚Äî there are many sociopolitical factors involved in a deeply complex and diverse country that should not be downplayed. (Maybe they aren‚Äôt, to be fair. I haven‚Äôt read it, yet.)**

That being said, nothing about the Tenth Edition‚Äôs changes is unexpected. They were very expected. It would have been sincerely shocking if the changes to the newest print were not intended to inject more diversity into the Anthology, but it is hard to not laugh at the preface‚Äôs somewhat-apologetic balancing by lengthening or adding high school favorites ‚Äî *The Turn of the Screw* and *The Great Gatsby*, for example ‚Äî to not "shortchange" the old white guys.

Nevertheless, I assume the trusty ol‚Äô Norton Anthology of American Literature isn‚Äôt any worse for wear though the addition of more diverse authors. In fact, I‚Äôm almost certain it is better off. What will be interesting, though, are the editorial discussions accompanying each cluster ‚Äî and whether or not they toe the line of objective study or inject wokeness when they‚Äôre explicitly not intended to impose interpretation upon the reader. Time will tell, but I‚Äôm betting on the latter.

title: Introducing The Game of Trust
body:
‚ÄúWhat happens if you lend to someone and they don‚Äôt pay you back?‚Äù

You don‚Äôt get your money back.

Lending is a game of trust. If you trust the wrong person, you lose.

You can paper it in contracts, take collateral, threaten to deduct points. But the primary game you are playing is one of ‚Äúshould I trust this person?‚Äù. All the rest are the mini-games you play after you‚Äôve lost to try and get one extra life.

Now, you might reasonably be thinking, isn‚Äôt trust counter to why we‚Äôre building DeFi?  Is trustlessness not a core tenet?

### maybe.

A trustless protocol removes the need to trust intermediaries. Which shouldn‚Äôt be conflated with the need to remove trust from relationships.

A trusted messaging protocol is handing a note to the student sitting behind you to pass to the new exchange student you have a crush on. You have to trust they‚Äôll pass on the message, not read it or modify it. A trustless protocol would be sliding a note in their locker.

‚ÄúWhat happens if you message someone and they don‚Äôt message back?‚Äù‚Ä¶ technology can‚Äôt solve that problem.

A credit protocol built to let anyone trust anyone, like [Union](https://union.finance), by nature can‚Äôt stop you from trusting someone. That‚Äôs the feature.

### Let the Games Begin

A much more interesting question is what happens if you trust someone and they do pay you back. What can we build on that?

We all go through life trusting people every day, and for the most part, it works out. This is optimistic but isn‚Äôt naivety. All human civilizations were built on a foundation of local inter-community credit first, with money and professional lenders pretty recent inventions.

A significant hurdle is that ‚Äúdeciding who is credit worthy‚Äù is seen as this complex divination, that only the most quantitative of bankers supported by an army of data collection can do with any measure of success.

And rather than try to convince you with fancy words, we built **[TrustFallGa.me ](https://TrustFallGa.me)**- an open world, multiplayer strategy game with competitive and cooperative modes, where you can try for yourself. 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Iq3Ya2VwhXkBMK5fpOZj1.png?height=516&width=1300)

### How to Play the Game:

1. Mint the NFT to signal you‚Äôre playing. (It‚Äôs 0.01 ETH to add a bit of friction for Sybil)
2. [Become a Union protocol member on Arbitrum](https://arbitrum.union.finance) if you‚Äôre not already
3. Each Round the Top 50 according to that rounds ‚ÄúGame‚Äù will get a vouch equal to the prize pool multiplied by their share of the points.
4. Round 1‚Äôs game is ‚ÄúConvince players who also have the game NFT to vouch for you.‚Äù  with a \[$2,000 prize pool\]. 
5. Round 2 is a surprise TBA  with the theme of ‚ÄúMoney‚Äù  \[$3,000\]
6. The Finale is also a surprise building on round 1 & 2 and will have the theme of Betrayal \[$5,000\]

**When does it begin?** 

* Round 1: July 29   ‚Üí August 12 
* Round 2: August 13 ‚Üí August 27
* Final Round: August 28 ‚Üí September 11 

All rounds begin and end at 1620 GMT. And if you‚Äôre reading this in the future not having done round 1, 2 or it‚Äôs halfway through. Dont worry, you can join in at any time. 

### How to win?

TLDR: Don‚Äôt lose.

At a high-level, points will be allocated based on a reasonably fair formula that takes each round‚Äôs game activity as input, and uses a similar algorithm to what Gitcoin uses for Quadratic funding to give reasonably fair scores.

The only real rules are  **1)**Don‚Äôt exploit bugs in the contracts (you‚Äôll make more $ reporting them) **2)**Points are tallied off-chain, and we reserve the right to remove any badly done Sybil attacks. **3)**Have fun with it!

Beyond that, there are no rules.  

\~written with ‚ô• by Trustfall.eth


---

### --Mini FAQ--

**How do I find other players?** To make it easier for players to find each other we set up a [token-gated telegram](https://guild.xyz/trustfall-players-lobby). If you have any questions, that‚Äôs also a good place to ask.

**How do I get people to trust(re:vouch) for me?** That is the question. [Ncase.me/trust](https://ncase.me/trust/) has a few good strategies. Bribery is always an option. 

**I‚Äôd like to report bugs or help improve the game, wheres the repo?** [unioncredit/trustfall](https://github.com/unioncredit/trustfall)

**I have questions about Union protocol or am having trouble becoming a member?** The best place to get Union specific questions answered is on the [Union community discord](https://discord.gg/DWF29rjRJH).

**Does this really count as a game?** There‚Äôs points, prizes, and potential for meta-games, what more could you want from a game.

**What‚Äôs the NFT token address?** 0xafb9E64d8B84C20E21299E0468d57FCC04F14Acd

**I‚Äôm a decentralized autonomous organism am i allowed to compete?** of course! DAO‚Äôs, contracts, humans, robots, lawyers, are all allowed.

title: How woke do you want it? A hot take on the Norton Anthology of American Literature's "Preface to the Tenth Edition"
body:
After going to print on the first of this month, the newest version of the Norton Anthology of American Literature was delivered to me by the exceptionally-rude DHL deliveryman today ‚Äî and, after reading the "Preface to the Tenth Edition," it is clear that this version of the quintessential doorstop promises to be (unsurprisingly) the wokest version yet.

"Diversity" is certainly the keyword, here ‚Äî given that it is repeated in place of synonyms throughout ‚Äî as the preface tries to do its job of justifying why you just dropped nearly a couple hundred United States dollars on the Tenth Edition when the Ninth Edition would‚Äôve almost certainly sufficed.

Of the seventeen new writers included, it isn‚Äôt entirely clear from the onset if any of them are white males ‚Äî not that there is anything resembling an underrepresentation of this demographic in the Anthology ‚Äî but it is explicitly clear that most, if not all, are Black and/or women and/or Native American and/or Chinese and/or not Caucasian. **Of course, this isn‚Äôt inherently problematic!** In fact, it‚Äôs presumably more interesting to see the addition of "well-bred" colonial women‚Äôs writing in Volume A than more uptight white dudes‚Äô, and the Modernist period is certainly ripe for today‚Äôs uber-woke discussions of identity politics.

Where the preface teeters on the border between the expected liberalism endemic to academia and full-blown wokeness, however, is in its not-so-subtle takes on racism in today‚Äôs American landscape. For example, it claims the Reconstruction‚Äôs legacy ‚Äúis still being felt in the national reckoning with racism and inequality‚Äù and separately addresses what it defines as ‚Äúthe renewed reckoning with anti-Black racism that began in 2014, arising from shootings of young black men‚Äîparticularly of Trayvon Martin in 2012 and Michael Brown in 2014.‚Äù I‚Äôm not saying these two quotes aren‚Äôt true or anything, but‚Ä¶

While I admittedly have not read these clusters (the books literally hit my doorstep today), it feels like a mild-to-moderate stretch to claim the United States of America in 2022 ‚Äî in the midst of Covid-response consequences, an energy crisis, potential food shortages, rapid inflation, a potential recession, a widening wealth gap, political discontent, etc. ‚Äî is still under any sort of noteworthy influence from 1877 America. (Many Americans probably don‚Äôt even know what the Reconstruction is.)

Likewise, the President of the United States during the shootings of Trayvon Martin and Michael Brown was Barack Obama (not exactly Andrew Johnson), and one might argue that the larger issue at hand had more to do with systemic failings with the American police state/force and mainstream media fire-stoking ‚Äî themes which I assume are not discussed in Volume E, though I would be happy to be wrong ‚Äî than an organic resurgence in national racism.

**TL;DR racism certainly exists in today‚Äôs America, but it is not black-and-white ‚Äî there are many sociopolitical factors involved in a deeply complex and diverse country that should not be downplayed. (Maybe they aren‚Äôt, to be fair. I haven‚Äôt read it, yet.)**

That being said, nothing about the Tenth Edition‚Äôs changes is unexpected. They were very expected. It would have been sincerely shocking if the changes to the newest print were not intended to inject more diversity into the Anthology, but it is hard to not laugh at the preface‚Äôs somewhat-apologetic balancing by lengthening or adding high school favorites ‚Äî *The Turn of the Screw* and *The Great Gatsby*, for example ‚Äî to not "shortchange" the old white guys.

Nevertheless, I assume the trusty ol‚Äô Norton Anthology of American Literature isn‚Äôt any worse for wear though the addition of more diverse authors. In fact, I‚Äôm almost certain it is better off. What will be interesting, though, are the editorial discussions accompanying each cluster ‚Äî and whether or not they toe the line of objective study or inject wokeness when they‚Äôre explicitly not intended to impose interpretation upon the reader. Time will tell, but I‚Äôm betting on the latter.

DeFiÂú®2020Âπ¥Â§èÂ§©È¶ñÊ¨°Â§ßÂπÖÁπÅËç£ÔºåÂΩìÊó∂Ê≤ªÁêÜ‰ª£Â∏ÅÂàõÊñ∞‰∏∫Áî®Êà∑Êèê‰æõ‰∫ÜÊú∫‰ºöÂíåÊøÄÂä±ÔºåÈÄöËøáÂú®‰ª•Â§™ÂùäÁΩëÁªú‰∏äÊñ∞Êé®Âá∫ÁöÑÂàÜÊï£ÂºèÂ∫îÁî®Á®ãÂ∫èÔºàdAppsÔºâ‰∏äÁßçÊ§ç‰∫ßÈáèÊù•ËµöÂèñË∂ÖÂ§ßÁöÑAPY„ÄÇ

Âú®‰ª•Â§™ÂùäÂèñÂæóÊàêÂäüÂêéÔºåÂá∫Áé∞‰∫ÜËÆ∏Â§öÈìæÂíåÊâ©ÂÆπÊñπÊ≥ïÔºå‰ª•Êª°Ë∂≥DeFiÂÜúÂú∫ÈúÄÊ±ÇÁöÑÊøÄÂ¢û„ÄÇÊØè‰∏™ÁîüÊÄÅÁ≥ªÁªüÁöÑÊàêÂäüÈÉΩÂèñÂÜ≥‰∫éÂú®ÂàÜÊï£„ÄÅÂÆâÂÖ®ÊÄßÂíåÂèØÊâ©Â±ïÊÄß‰πãÈó¥ÊâæÂØªÂπ≥Ë°°„ÄÇ

ÈöèÁùÄÁ´û‰∫âÁöÑDeFiÁîüÊÄÅÁ≥ªÁªüÈ¢ÜÂüü‰∏çÊñ≠Êâ©Â§ßÔºåÁî®Êà∑ÊâæÂà∞‰∫ÜË∑®Èìæ‰ª•ÂØªÊ±ÇÊõ¥Â§öËê•Êî∂ÁöÑÊñπÊ≥ï„ÄÇ

### Âª∫ÈÄ†Ê°•Ê¢ÅÔºåÁÉßÊéâÊ°•Ê¢Å

Âø´ËøõÂà∞2022Âπ¥„ÄÇ10Â§öÊù°ÈìæÁöÑ331‰∏™Êî∂ÁõäËÅöÂêàÂô®ÔºåTVLÊÄªËÆ°‰∏∫83‰∫øÁæéÂÖÉÔºåÂú®‰∫âÂ§∫Áî®Êà∑ÂíåÊµÅÂä®ÊÄß„ÄÇdAppsÂú®Âü∫Á°ÄËÆæÊñΩÊîØÁ¶ªÁ†¥Á¢éÁöÑÊñ∞Èìæ‰∏äÊøÄÂ¢ûÔºåÂºïÂèë‰∫ÜÁ¨¨‰∏Ä‰ª£Ë∑®ÈìæÊ°•Ê¢Å„ÄÇ

Ê°•Ê¢ÅËÆæËÆ°ÁöÑ‰∏ªË¶ÅÊñπÊ≥ïÂåÖÊã¨Â∞ÜÂéüÁîü‰ª£Â∏ÅÈîÅÂÆöÂú®ÈìæAÊã•ÊúâÁöÑÊô∫ËÉΩÂêàÁ∫¶‰∏≠ÔºåÂπ∂Âú®ÈìæB‰∏äÈì∏ÈÄ†Ê°•Êã•ÊúâÁöÑwrapped‰ª£Â∏ÅÔºåÁÑ∂ÂêéÂú®ÈìæB‰∏äÁáÉÁÉßwrapped‰ª£Â∏ÅÔºåÂπ∂Âú®ÈìæA‰∏äÂÖëÊç¢ÈîÅÂÆöÁöÑÂéüÁîü‰ª£Â∏Å„ÄÇ

ËÆæËÆ°‰∏äÔºåÁ¨¨‰∏Ä‰ª£Ê°•Ê¢ÅÂè™Ëß£ÂÜ≥‰∫ÜÊ°•Êé•‰∏âÈöæÂõ∞Â¢ÉÁöÑ‰∏â‰∏™ÂÖ≥ÈîÆÂ±ûÊÄß‰πã‰∏Ä‚Äî‚ÄîÊèê‰æõÁªü‰∏ÄÁöÑÊµÅÂä®ÊÄßÔºå‰ΩÜ‰∏çÊèê‰æõÂéüÁîüËµÑ‰∫ß‰∫§ÊòìÔºåÂπ∂Á´ãÂç≥‰øùËØÅÊúÄÁªàÊÄß„ÄÇÊ°•Êé•‰∏âÈöæÈ¢òÁî±‰∏â‰∏™Âü∫Êú¨ÁöÑÊ°•Êé•Â±ûÊÄßÁªÑÊàêÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûúÊ≤°ÊúâÊΩúÂú®ÁöÑÈÄöÁî®Ê∂àÊÅØÂ±ÇÔºåËøô‰∫õÂ±ûÊÄßÊòØÊó†Ê≥ïÂÆûÁé∞ÁöÑÔºö

ËÆæËÆ°‰∏äÔºåÁ¨¨‰∏Ä‰ª£Ê°•Ê¢ÅÂè™Ëß£ÂÜ≥‰∫ÜÊ°•Êé•‰∏âÈöæÂõ∞Â¢ÉÁöÑ‰∏â‰∏™ÂÖ≥ÈîÆÂ±ûÊÄß‰πã‰∏Ä‚Äî‚ÄîÊèê‰æõÁªü‰∏ÄÁöÑÊµÅÂä®ÊÄßÔºå‰ΩÜ‰∏çÊèê‰æõÂéüÁîüËµÑ‰∫ß‰∫§ÊòìÔºåÂπ∂Á´ãÂç≥‰øùËØÅÊúÄÁªàÊÄß„ÄÇÊ°•Êé•‰∏âÈöæÈ¢òÁî±‰∏â‰∏™Âü∫Êú¨ÁöÑÊ°•Êé•Â±ûÊÄßÁªÑÊàêÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûúÊ≤°ÊúâÊΩúÂú®ÁöÑÈÄöÁî®Ê∂àÊÅØÂ±ÇÔºåËøô‰∫õÂ±ûÊÄßÊòØÊó†Ê≥ïÂÆûÁé∞ÁöÑÔºö

**1.Âç≥Êó∂‰øùËØÅÊúÄÁªàÊÄßÔºö**‰∏∫‰ªéÊ∫êÈìæÂèëÈÄÅÁöÑ‰ªª‰Ωï‰∫§ÊòìÈ¢ÑÂÖà‰øùËØÅÁõÆÊ†áÈìæ‰∏äÊúâË∂≥Â§üÁöÑËµÑÈáë

**2.Áªü‰∏ÄÊµÅÂä®ÊÄßÔºö**ÊµÅÂä®ÊÄßÂàÜÂ∏ÉÂú®Â§ö‰∏™Èìæ‰∏äÔºå‰ªª‰ΩïdAppÊàñÁî®Êà∑ÈÉΩÂèØ‰ª•‰Ωú‰∏∫Âçï‰∏™ÊµÅÂä®ÊÄßÊ±†ËÆøÈóÆ

\*ÂØªÊ±ÇË∑®ÈìæÊúÄÁúÅËµÑÊú¨ÁöÑ‰∫íÊç¢ÈÄîÂæÑÁöÑËÆ¢ÂçïÁ∞øË∑ØÁî±

\*ËΩªÊùæÈáçÊñ∞Âπ≥Ë°°dAppsÁöÑÂÜÖÈÉ®Â∫ìÂ≠òÂíåÂ§ö‰∏™Èìæ‰∏äÁöÑÊµÅÂä®ÊÄß

\*‰ª•ËµÑ‰∫ß‰∏∫‰∏≠ÂøÉ„ÄÅÈìæÂºè‰∏çÂèØÁü•ËÆ∫ËÆæËÆ°ÂíåÁî®Êà∑ÁïåÈù¢ÁöÑÈí±ÂåÖ

\*Ë∑®ÈìæÊº´Ê∏∏ÂØªÊ±ÇLPÊúÄ‰Ω≥ÂõûÊä•ÁöÑÊî∂ÁõäËÅöÂêàÂô®

dAppsÊ≠£Âú®Á´ûÁõ∏Êàê‰∏∫‰ªñ‰ª¨‰∏≠ÁöÑÁ¨¨‰∏Ä‰∏™‰∏∫Áî®Êà∑Êèê‰æõ‰ΩøÁî®Âº∫Â§ßÁöÑ‚àÜÁÆóÊ≥ïÂú®ÊòüÈôÖ‰πãÈó®‰∏äÊûÑÂª∫ÁöÑÈ¢ùÂ§ñÂ•ΩÂ§Ñ„ÄÇÂÖ®ÈìæAMM„ÄÅÈí±ÂåÖ„ÄÅÊî∂ÁõäËÅöÂêàÂô®ÂíåÂÄüË¥∑dAppsÂ∞ÜÈ¶ñÂÖàÊèê‰æõÔºö

title: Introducing The Game of Trust
body:
‚ÄúWhat happens if you lend to someone and they don‚Äôt pay you back?‚Äù

You don‚Äôt get your money back.

Lending is a game of trust. If you trust the wrong person, you lose.

You can paper it in contracts, take collateral, threaten to deduct points. But the primary game you are playing is one of ‚Äúshould I trust this person?‚Äù. All the rest are the mini-games you play after you‚Äôve lost to try and get one extra life.

Now, you might reasonably be thinking, isn‚Äôt trust counter to why we‚Äôre building DeFi?  Is trustlessness not a core tenet?

### maybe.

A trustless protocol removes the need to trust intermediaries. Which shouldn‚Äôt be conflated with the need to remove trust from relationships.

A trusted messaging protocol is handing a note to the student sitting behind you to pass to the new exchange student you have a crush on. You have to trust they‚Äôll pass on the message, not read it or modify it. A trustless protocol would be sliding a note in their locker.

‚ÄúWhat happens if you message someone and they don‚Äôt message back?‚Äù‚Ä¶ technology can‚Äôt solve that problem.

A credit protocol built to let anyone trust anyone, like [Union](https://union.finance), by nature can‚Äôt stop you from trusting someone. That‚Äôs the feature.

### Let the Games Begin

A much more interesting question is what happens if you trust someone and they do pay you back. What can we build on that?

We all go through life trusting people every day, and for the most part, it works out. This is optimistic but isn‚Äôt naivety. All human civilizations were built on a foundation of local inter-community credit first, with money and professional lenders pretty recent inventions.

A significant hurdle is that ‚Äúdeciding who is credit worthy‚Äù is seen as this complex divination, that only the most quantitative of bankers supported by an army of data collection can do with any measure of success.

And rather than try to convince you with fancy words, we built **[TrustFallGa.me](https://TrustFallGa.me)** - an open world, multiplayer strategy game with competitive and cooperative modes, where you can try for yourself.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Iq3Ya2VwhXkBMK5fpOZj1.png?height=516&width=1300)

### How to Play the Game:

1. [Mint the NFT](https://trustfallga.me) to signal you‚Äôre playing. (It‚Äôs 0.01 ETH to add a bit of friction for Sybil)
2. [Become a Union protocol member on Arbitrum](https://arbitrum.union.finance) if you‚Äôre not already
3. Each round has a specific *activity* you can do to collect points. At the end of the round, point are tallied and the Top 50 will get a vouch proportional to their share of the points.
4. Round 1‚Äôs game is ‚ÄúConvince players who also have the game NFT to vouch for you.‚Äù  with a \[$2,000 prize pool\]. Seems straightforward, until you ask why would my competition vouch for me?!
5. Round 2‚Äôs game is a surprise with the theme of ‚ÄúMoney‚Äù  \[$3,000\]
6. The Finale is also a surprise building on round 1 & 2 and will have the theme of Betrayal \[$5,000\]

**When does it begin?**

* Round 1: July 29   ‚Üí August 12
* Round 2: August 13 ‚Üí August 27
* Final Round: August 28 ‚Üí September 11

All rounds begin and end at 1620 GMT. And if you‚Äôre reading this in the future not having done round 1, 2 or it‚Äôs halfway through. Dont worry, you can join in at any time.

### How to win?

TLDR: Don‚Äôt lose.

At a high-level, points will be allocated based on a reasonably fair formula that takes each round‚Äôs game activity as input, and uses a similar algorithm to what Gitcoin uses for Quadratic funding to give reasonably fair scores.

The only real rules are  **1.** Don‚Äôt exploit bugs in the contracts (you‚Äôll make more $ reporting them) **2.** Points are tallied off-chain, and we reserve the right to remove any badly done Sybil attacks. **3.** Have fun with it!

Beyond that, there are no rules.

\~written with ‚ô• by Trustfall.eth


---

### --Mini FAQ--

**How do I find other players?** To make it easier for players to find each other we set up a [token-gated telegram](https://guild.xyz/trustfall-players-lobby). If you have any questions, that‚Äôs also a good place to ask.

**How do I get people to trust(re:vouch) for me?** That is the question. [Ncase.me/trust](https://ncase.me/trust/) has a few good strategies. Bribery is always an option.

**I‚Äôd like to report bugs or help improve the game, wheres the repo?** [unioncredit/trustfall](https://github.com/unioncredit/trustfall)

**I have questions about Union protocol or am having trouble becoming a member?** The best place to get Union specific questions answered is on the [Union community discord](https://discord.gg/DWF29rjRJH).

**Does this really count as a game?** There‚Äôs points, prizes, and potential for meta-games, what more could you want from a game.

**What‚Äôs the NFT token address?** 0xafb9E64d8B84C20E21299E0468d57FCC04F14Acd

**I‚Äôm a decentralized autonomous organism am i allowed to compete?** of course! DAO‚Äôs, contracts, humans, robots, lawyers, are all allowed.

title: Introducing The Game of Trust
body:
‚ÄúWhat happens if you lend to someone and they don‚Äôt pay you back?‚Äù

You don‚Äôt get your money back.

Lending is a game of trust. If you trust the wrong person, you lose.

You can paper it in contracts, take collateral, threaten to deduct points. But the primary game you are playing is one of ‚Äúshould I trust this person?‚Äù. All the rest are the mini-games you play after you‚Äôve lost to try and get one extra life.

Now, you might reasonably be thinking, isn‚Äôt trust counter to why we‚Äôre building DeFi?  Is trustlessness not a core tenet?

### maybe.

A trustless protocol removes the need to trust intermediaries. Which shouldn‚Äôt be conflated with the need to remove trust from relationships.

A trusted messaging protocol is handing a note to the student sitting behind you to pass to the new exchange student you have a crush on. You have to trust they‚Äôll pass on the message, not read it or modify it. A trustless protocol would be sliding a note in their locker.

‚ÄúWhat happens if you message someone and they don‚Äôt message back?‚Äù‚Ä¶ technology can‚Äôt solve that problem.

A credit protocol built to let anyone trust anyone, like [Union](https://union.finance), by nature can‚Äôt stop you from trusting someone. That‚Äôs the feature.

### Let the Games Begin

A much more interesting question is what happens if you trust someone and they do pay you back. What can we build on that?

We all go through life trusting people every day, and for the most part, it works out. This is optimistic but isn‚Äôt naivety. All human civilizations were built on a foundation of local inter-community credit first, with money and professional lenders pretty recent inventions.

A significant hurdle is that ‚Äúdeciding who is credit worthy‚Äù is seen as this complex divination, that only the most quantitative of bankers supported by an army of data collection can do with any measure of success.

And rather than try to convince you with fancy words, we built **[TrustFallGa.me](https://TrustFallGa.me)** - an open world, multiplayer strategy game with competitive and cooperative modes, where you can try for yourself.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Iq3Ya2VwhXkBMK5fpOZj1.png?height=516&width=1300)

### How to Play the Game:

1. [Mint the NFT](https://trustfallga.me) to signal you‚Äôre playing. (It‚Äôs 0.01 ETH to add a bit of friction for Sybil)
2. [Become a Union protocol member on Arbitrum](https://arbitrum.union.finance) if you‚Äôre not already
3. Each round has a specific *activity* you can do to collect points. At the end of the round, point are tallied and the Top 50 will get a vouch proportional to their share of the points.
4. Round 1‚Äôs game is ‚ÄúConvince players who also have the game NFT to vouch for you.‚Äù  with a \[$2,000 prize pool\]. Seems straightforward, until you ask why would my competition vouch for me?!
5. Round 2‚Äôs game is a surprise with the theme of ‚ÄúMoney‚Äù  \[$3,000\]
6. The Finale is also a surprise building on round 1 & 2 and will have the theme of Betrayal \[$5,000\]

**When does it begin?**

* Round 1: July 29   ‚Üí August 12
* Round 2: August 13 ‚Üí August 27
* Final Round: August 28 ‚Üí September 11

All rounds begin and end at 1620 GMT. And if you‚Äôre reading this in the future not having done round 1, 2 or it‚Äôs halfway through. Dont worry, you can join in at any time.

### How to win?

TLDR: Don‚Äôt lose.

At a high-level, points will be allocated based on a reasonably fair formula that takes each round‚Äôs game activity as input, and uses a similar algorithm to what Gitcoin uses for Quadratic funding to give reasonably fair scores.

The only real rules are  **1.** Don‚Äôt exploit bugs in the contracts (you‚Äôll make more $ reporting them) **2.** Points are tallied off-chain, and we reserve the right to remove any badly done Sybil attacks. **3.** Have fun with it!

Beyond that, there are no rules.

title: Bestie‚Ä¶ y blockchain tho?
body:
A blockchain simply allows us to store and record information in a way that cannot be altered.

Think about the technology we use today. We are in a Web2 world where developers can create a software/code that allows for users (you and me) to use it (think Facebook, IG, Youtube). The people who own the code can dictate how information is stored. They have the ability (if they wanted to) to delete, edit, allow certain values.

**\*\*\* HOT TAKE \*\*\*** (maybe not, but don‚Äôt cancel me plz)

Here is a prime example in our recent history: Remember when Donald Trump had a Twitter and he was tweeting things that people didn‚Äôt really like? And then Twitter deleted his tweets and banned him from the platform???? This exactly shows how developers can influence the way information is shared. They were able to go into their site, find his account, ban him and delete his stuff. I say hot take because I believe in freedom of speech. I don‚Äôt care if it‚Äôs from Trump or whoever else. Everyone has the right to say what they want. Twitter doesn‚Äôt have a right to suppress it. If they can stop Trump, what other info are people suppressing from us? ...Like GIVE ME ALL THE INFO!! I don‚Äôt care if I agree or disagree with it. Let me see it all and make my own informed decision, THANK YOU VERY MUCH. If Twitter was on a blockchain, Trump‚Äôs tweet could never be erased.

Blockchain allows for transparency. One cool feature that comes with blockchain is the ability to be a **‚Äútrustless‚Äù** network.

![‚Ä¶. But wuttttt, wut do u MEAN TRUSTLESS?! üò©](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/8mncDN9dh5Ss_14evMX6K.jpeg?height=1164&width=1280)

I‚Äôm not talking trustless like our ex boyfriends‚Ä¶ as in lacking trust. Trustless as in *not requiring trust* but... we still know they‚Äôre faithful.

![EhEhhhhh](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/QNw2rkphlSamBH4ul_-xK.jpeg?height=365&width=650)

So let‚Äôs slow down.

For example, Fred wants to send Bob $1000. So he goes to his handy dandy Bank of America app, and uses Zelle to try and send his friend $1000. The *bank* is being *TRUSTED* to verify, confirm, and facilitate the sending of $1000 from Fred‚Äôs account to Bob‚Äôs account. The bank is a central entity that fulfills the ‚Äútrust role‚Äù. When you send your money, you‚Äôre 100% sure that the bank isn‚Äôt going to rug you and that they verified that Bob and you are legit.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/LXfqH7iVF7y6AiBB1yINr.jpeg?height=720&width=1060)

In a blockchain though, there is no person or entity who verifies the validity of a transaction. Because there is a network of computers who all hold the SAME ledger (transaction list‚Ä¶ ‚Äúpublic bank statement‚Äù), *TRUST* is not needed.. it is trust*LESS*. An **intermediary** is basically rendered obsolete (aheh bye bye bank). The mechanisms behind that which runs blockchains allow for you to transact with someone‚Ä¶ without knowing them‚Ä¶ with no third party.. and no all mighty ruler reigning above. Just a bro to another bro with 100% faith in the legitimacy of it all still (faithful af).

![Not like him though‚Ä¶](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/V_eD5TJGIL-GiZ_VwST1c.jpeg?height=1338&width=2388)

Think about it like this‚Ä¶. You meet up with a friend to give him some cash. You trust your friend will receive your money because well, he‚Äôs right in front of your face. Blockchain allows for this type of ‚Äúpeer to peer‚Äù transaction but you‚Äôre in America and your friend who you‚Äôre sending money to, is in Australia... and he‚Äôs not even a friend!!! In fact, you don‚Äôt even know who he is at all. He‚Äôs just some dude who wanted to buy your JPEG. But you‚Äôre able to transact with him like you would if you met up in person - with trust and legitimacy.

Since there are multiple copies of the ledger spread out over a network of computers, this means the system has the potential to be decentralized. Meaning not one entity‚Ä¶ or big tech company (cough cough) has control over the data. NO ONE CONTROLS THE DATA. This means no more shady business happening behind the scenes that consumers don‚Äôt know about. This means full transparency is a GIV üëè EN üëè. You cannot hide anything on a blockchain. Blockchain technology also means we get to cut out the middlemen and streamline transactions.

Now I say ‚Äúhas the potential to be decentralized‚Äù because not all protocols are equal. Some are decentralized with no humans in the mix operating solely from a computer and an algorithm (aka **DEX**- it‚Äôs kind of like an ‚Äúif then‚Äù statement where functions only execute when criteria are met). However, some like Binance and Coinbase are centralized, we call these **CEXs** (centralized exchange). They are still using blockchain technology with an immutable ledger. But if they wanted to, they can go in and pull your transaction for you or locate your funds. As they say with CEXs, ‚Äú*Not your keys, not your coins*‚Äù.

![A centralized network is characterized by one entity having more weight over others. It is essentially the government.. controlling and watching over data. It has the ability to manipulate, hide, alter, or pull whatever they see fit (and they don't need to tell you about it)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/CYWzVlxNA-tiviivfIB_r.png?height=720&width=1060)

![A decentralized network where all circles are equal wooohooo. No one has weight over anyone else. Data/value is transferred to whoever, whenever, wherever and cannot be hidden or altered. All done with validity and trust too? That's blockchain for u bayyybeeee](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/5Xqzyt39Us0sVQjCUQW19.png?height=720&width=1060)

Remember that whole ordeal with GME and how Robinhood halted the trading on it that one time.... yeah kind of like that. Like YOU bought GME but it really wasn‚Äôt yours because Robinhood told you you couldn‚Äôt sell it. ¬Ø\\*_(„ÉÑ)*_/¬Ø Same applies for CEXs. You buy the asset.. but then again.. not really LOL.

If you look at the centralized graphic up above and replaced the ‚Äúcentralized entity‚Äù with Robinhood.. Facebook‚Ä¶ TikTok‚Ä¶ Twitter‚Ä¶ then perhaps you might get a better understanding.

Blockchain is the backbone for all of crypto structures. But it has uses outside of cryptocurrency as well. It is so so so so SO SO SO sooooo very important and such a breakthrough technology in my opinion. It has the potential to disrupt so many of our current systems/industries in the best way possible (wink wink\* there is a reason why there is so much push against it). I wish more people took the time to learn about it instead of just jumping ahead and calling crypto a scam. With the way society is right now... the world.. our leaders... a change is necessary and I truly believe change lies within the adoption of blockchain technology.

Think about our banking industry.. If we utilized blockchain technology, banks would be.. useless. You wouldn‚Äôt have to wait to go to the bank Mon-Fri from 8AM-5PM. You wouldn‚Äôt need to wait 4 days to wire funds... you wouldn‚Äôt be giving your money freely to the banks to lend out to god knows who. Instead, *you* can lend your own money out.. you can BE YOUR OWN BANK. You can borrow, lend, stake, and make your money work for you (this is called **DeFi** AKA decentralized finance) Traditionally, this was something only doable by rich people with cash flow and big connections.

I don‚Äôt want to make this too long and hard to digest so that‚Äôs it for now. I think I‚Äôll write about some different use cases of blockchain in a later article, so stay tuned for that.

I hope this was a little helpful. I‚Äôm not an expert. This is all from my understanding, do take it with a grain of salt and **DYOR** (DO YOUR OWN RESEARCH). If you have any questions... comments.. gripes.. feel free to reach out to me on Twitter ([@theblockchainb](https://twitter.com/theblockchainb))

LUV,

the bb ‚ù§Ô∏è

**TERMS TO KNOW**

Trustless

Ledger

Intermediary

DEX

CEX

DeFi

DYOR

title: Random fact
body:
Since I've been living in Paris, I've never seen so many transformations. There is a good transformation and a bad transformation. The city of Paris has been dirty and under construction for more than 10 years. I have also never seen so many disappointed tourists in Paris.

![March 2022, near Op√©ra, Paris.](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/yezEUl9FVl4CBKDV-B-6L.jpg?height=3889&width=5834&size=large)

This state has existed since the election of Anne Hidalgo as mayor of Paris. In a few months, 50,000 Internet users have also published thousands of #saccageparis posts, often supporting photos, denouncing in turn the filth, the transformation policy of Anne Hidalgo.

One thing to say: stop the carnage.

title: Top 15 P2E NFT Games to Follow in 2022 - Coinmonks - Medium
body:
The booming P2E market is a trend hard to ignore today. Thousands of players join the lucrative P2E industry every day to combine the pleasure of exciting gameplay and earning opportunities. This combination of thrilling gaming activities and a chance to earn monetizable rewards have made the P2E market grow in leaps in the past year, and the pace of growth is expected to rise.

People‚Äôs love for P2E entertainment is overwhelming. According to DappRadar, more than 52% of active crypto wallets existing to date are linked to one of the numerous P2E games, suggesting enormous gamer activity. By the end of 2021, in-game NFT asset sales volume exceeded $2.32 billion, which is more than 20% of the entire NFT trading volume. Thus, P2E games are here to stay, given the amount of interest and user activity they enjoy.

![Top 15 P2E NFT Games to Follow in 2022](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/0\*Nfda3irjlSFQvOPb.jpg)

**So, which NFT game to play?**

Modern gamers are spoilt for choice, with hundreds of P2E games already available and dozens more released each day. We‚Äôve searched deep and wide to help you choose. Here is the list of top 15 P2E games worth picking as your next favorite activity. Good luck!

## #1 Thetan Arena

*   Blockchain: Kardia Blockchain
*   Score *9/10 based on 37 reviews.*
*   Website link: [**Thetan Arena**](https://coincodecap.com/go/thetanarena)
*   Telegram group: <https://t.me/thetanarenalinks>

Another hit in the P2E videogaming, Thetan Arena has been a success after its release in autumn of 2021. The game offers exciting gameplay in the MOBA genre and is powered by the BNB blockchain. Thetan Arena welcomes players to pick a hero (get a free one upon registration or buy a warrior with more advanced skills at the in-game NFT marketplace).

Fans of exciting battles will enjoy the variety of game modes, fighting as solo warriors of making teams. Thetan Arena also has the challenge modes, like Tower Siege, Super Star, and Deathmatch, where the strongest player gets THC rewards. The most exciting is the Custom Battle mode where players can organize the battlefield how they please, inviting others for an epic battle on their terms.

The game has two tokens ‚Äî THC and THG. The latter is used to pay the commissions and conduct in-game transactions; the former can be earned by winning battles and completing challenges. The players should also collect PP (Power Points) in the process of playing to boost their skills and earn an advantage over their counterparts. PPs are not tradable outside the game.

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*0Xq6nz-b2EZwohfBy7SVjw.png)

## #2 World of Defish

*   Blockchain: Binance Smart Chain
*   Score *10/10 based on 58 reviews.*
*   Website link: [**World of Defish**](https://coincodecap.com/go/worldofdefish)
*   Telegram group: <https://t.me/worldofdefish>

World of Defish has taken the crypto gaming world by storm upon its release in 2022. It is an appealing game inviting P2E fans to an exciting fishing adventure full of lucrative P2E opportunities. The fish NFTs and fishing equipment possess monetary value and can be traded on the in-game NFT marketplace.

The game‚Äôs P2E mechanics are engaging, giving users several earning options. First, you can mine the WOD token in any area on the game‚Äôs map. Players can also get passive income by earning a commission from other fishermen, buying lands (NFT zones) and charging fees from those coming to fish in their territories. The equipment selection also plays a vital role in the P2E potential, with better tools yielding a greater number of WOD tokens during mining. Finally, the earned WOD tokens can be placed into the game‚Äôs liquidity pool, earning their owners passive income.

World of Defish is 14 on the list of the best games, running on BSC and has already won the hearts of over 200,000 fans. The team continues to surprise with their bold innovations and plans like off-chain, guilds, stacks, tournaments, gaming Metaverse, etc.

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*k-LPxhxgLEIGKZUC_BYIhg.png)

## #3 Splinterlands

*   Blockchain: Hive Blockchain
*   Score *8/10 based on 58 reviews.*
*   Website link: [**Splinterlands**](https://coincodecap.com/go/splinterlands)
*   Telegram group: <https://t.me/splinterlandsHQ>

Splinterlands was released in 2018 and quickly gained popularity among avid P2E gamers because of its fun gameplay, exciting storyline and characters, and numerous earning opportunities. It‚Äôs a collectible card game in fantasy style. Players need to collect a squad for battles and challenge other players, contending for tradable cards.

The game‚Äôs style is reminiscent of Dota Auto Chess or Magic the Gathering. To join the community and start playing/earning, you need to register on the official website and acquire Summoner‚Äôs Spellbook for $10. The spellbook unlocks daily quests, an opportunity to earn in-game tokens and receive seasonal rewards. Newbies receive startup cards that they cannot exchange or trade, using them only on the battlefield.

The player‚Äôs competitive advantage in a battle is determined by their card‚Äôs rating. The game‚Äôs tokenomics is powered by three tokens: Credits, DEC, and SPS. If your cards leave much to be desired, then buy better ones in the NFT marketplace or spend a couple of bucks on card rental.

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*car25aiB2mrU-1OT4jTHBw.png)

## #4 Decentraland

*   Blockchain: Ethereum blockchain
*   Score: Score *8/10 based on 53 reviews*
*   Website link: [**Decentraland**](https://coincodecap.com/go/decentraland)
*   Telegram group: <https://t.me/DecentralandTG>

Those looking for a whole new metaverse to live a second life and earn crypto rewards will definitely enjoy Decentraland. It is a virtual world where you can be a regular player or a business owner, monetizing your digital business. Did you dream of opening a bakery house? No need to do it in reality ‚Äî you can earn real money by selling bread to digital people in the Decentraland universe.

The game works on the Ethereum blockchain, allowing users to experience and create digital content in the virtual land, personalizing their worlds the way they see it. The builders have a huge set of tools to customize their land parcels. The in-game token is MANA, which players use to conduct in-game transactions, buy food and clothing, travel, play P2E games within the metaverse, and do other activities to live an exciting crypto life.

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*Qo84F0JZMTV-S9SJ_zvNVQ.png)

## #5 The Sandbox

*   Blockchain: Ethereum Blockchain
*   Score Score *8/10 based on 55 reviews*
*   Website link: [**Sandbox**](https://coincodecap.com/go/sandbox)
*   Telegram group: <https://t.me/sandboxgame>

The Sandbox is a blockchain adaptation of the popular Sandbox game released by Pixowl in 2012. The game provides feature-rich tools to create, sell, and apply VR NFTs in the in-game economy. It allows gamers to monetize their gaming experience in many ways by building their own metaverse reality and projects.

The Sandbox utilizes the SAND token as its in-game reward to players. SAND is the native currency gamers can use to transact with in-game assets. For example, if you produce unique NFTs and other users see utility in them, they can purchase the NFTs for SAND from you. The in-game production tool is VoxEdit ‚Äî the 3D voxel modeling and NFT minting software package bringing a set of voxels to life in the form of humans, animals, vehicles, etc. Other ways of earning SAND include in-game campaigns and competitions.

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*QQZA02pILZPP4DOrHMWbFg.png)

## #6 Silks

*   Blockchain: Ethereum Blockchain
*   Score: Score *7/10 based on 35 reviews*
*   Website link: [**Silks**](https://coincodecap.com/go/silks-io)
*   Twitter: <https://twitter.com/gameofsilks>

Are you a fan of racing? Even those who have no chance to establish a horse racing or breeding business in real life have received that opportunity in the Silks P2E game. Thousands of players rave about this game because it serves as a genuine bridge between reality and a metaverse of the equestrian business.

By joining the Silks game, you‚Äôre introduced to the world of professional horse racing. You can go through the entire experience of horse breeding and training, breed your own horse with a unique bloodline, and participate in the competition with unique digital horses serving as valuable NFTs. If your horse is good enough, you can earn a fortune on it.

And the most exciting thing about Silks is that digital horse NFTs are linked to real-world pedigreed horses. If your horse wins in the real world, its NFT‚Äôs owner gets STT tokens as rewards. Players can also organize competitions in the Silks blockchain, trade horses in the NFT marketplace, stake Bitcoins, and earn STT on horse rearing.

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*B2FdOqhkcWEcOTP2-Y8ldQ.png)

## #7 Gods Unchained

*   Blockchain: Ethereum Blockchain
*   Score Score *7/10 based on 42 reviews*
*   Website link: [**GodsUnchained**](https://coincodecap.com/go/godsunchained)
*   Telegram channel: <https://t.me/GodsAnnouncements>

Gods Unchained is another popular game in the NFT P2E market, operating on the Ethereum blockchain. It has captivating gameplay involving gamers in battles between their god avatars and those of the opponents. The game follows the trading card format ‚Äî a popular one in the modern P2E market, as other successful examples of Splinterlands, Hearthstone, and Magic: The Gathering prove.

The cards used by players in Gods Unchained are NFTs that one can buy, sell, or exchange in the in-game marketplace. Every card you get is unique, and it gives a unique position in the battle to its owner. Newbies get three free card packs upon joining the game and win stronger cards on the battlefield.

The game‚Äôs cards have 4 rarity types, each having a distinct value. A card‚Äôs cost ranges from $0.1 to $50,000 in the NFT marketplace, giving users a chance to raise their status and competitive advantage in the battle for in-game rewards.

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*q4GuFyzruSNSoZjfYi-DSA.png)

## #8 Alien Worlds

*   Blockchain: Ethereum, WAX and BNB Chain** (BSC)** blockchains
*   Score: Score *7/10 based on 31 reviews*
*   Website link: [**Alien Worlds**](https://coincodecap.com/go/alienworlds)
*   Telegram channel: <https://t.me/AlienWorldsOffical>

Fans of space themes in gaming will be happy to join the Aliens Worlds community. This game has all a P2E product should provide ‚Äî catchy graphics, an exciting plot, and a set of earning opportunities. The game encourages users to search for NFTs in the space locations, connecting with other players and mastering the universe‚Äôs governance via the in-game token, Trilium. Its accumulation gives the gamers voting power in the Planet DAOs, which is also a source of exciting action in the game.

Other game features include sensing missions across the metaverse on the leased spaceships to find the hidden NFTs, teleporting across blockchains, and NFT drop building with other player groups.

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*uqM87T8fn4J2AGrAmXGr5Q.png)

## #9 Olympus Game

*   Blockchain: Binance Smart Chain
*   Score: Score *7/10 based on 17 reviews*
*   Website link: [**Olympus Game**](https://coincodecap.com/go/olympus-game)
*   Telegram channel: <https://t.me/olympusgame>

Olympus Game is a new exciting offer backed by BD Multimedia, taking you to the world of Ancient Greece and offering you an adventure of tower conquest. Players get NFT cards that they can upgrade using the in-game token and win battles against other gamers, destroying their towers and moving up the leaderboard. It comes in the web and mobile versions, ensuring flexibility and convenience on the go. The project began its journey at the beginning of 2022 and is quickly gaining a loyal fanbase.

The game uses the internal $OLYMP coin for internal transactions. Its dedicated fans and investors can become part of the holder pool during the game‚Äôs public ICO scheduled for Q3 of 2022

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*xY7kCgp9uN7TI8ntF8AGKA.jpeg)

## #10 Skyweaver

*   Blockchain: Ethereum Blockchain
*   Score: Score *6/10 based on 30 reviews*
*   Website link: [**Skyweaver**](https://coincodecap.com/go/skyweaver)
*   Telegram channel: <https://t.me/skyweaverchat>

Skyweaver is considered one of the most promising games in the P2E collectible card game niche. It is done in the best tradition of collectible card hits, such as Magic: The Gathering and Hearthstone. It‚Äôs a visually engaging game with a unique style and approach that won‚Äôt leave anyone indifferent.

This game runs on Polygon and Ethereum and is available in iOS, Android, and PC versions. There is no native token in this game, with all transactions and purchases made in USDC. Users will be pleased with appealing graphics and animation, competitive game modes, and leaderboards. The P2E mechanics of the game is pretty simple: players receive silver and gold NFT cards as rewards for the won battles. These cards are tradable for USDC and can be withdrawn to the Sequence wallet.

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*GPTwZEUJoKf_hRDCLHw0Ew.png)

## #11 Axie Infinity

*   Blockchain: Ronin Network
*   Score *10/10 based on 42 reviews.*
*   Website link: [**Axie Infinity**](https://coincodecap.com/go/axie-infinity)
*   Telegram group: <https://t.me/axieinfinity>

When talking about P2E games, one can hardly challenge the leadership of Axie Infinity in this area. It was produced by a Vietnamese company Sly Mavis and released in 2018. Ethereum and Ronin blockchains power the game and create a fun, exciting gaming experience for users raising their Pokemon-like Axies to win rewards for their owners.

The P2E mechanics of the game is simple: users need to earn SLPs (Smooth Love Potions) and AXS (Axie Infinity Shards), which possess monetary value and can be traded for ETH or other currencies. To earn these rewards, players should maintain their regular activity in the game, log in every day, complete the assigned challenges, and win PvP battles. Axie breeding is also lucrative, as a capable and skilled Axie can be traded for a fair sum of money in the NFT marketplace.

## #12 Parallel

*   Blockchain: Binance Smart Chain
*   Score: Score *6/10 based on 28 reviews*
*   Website link: [**Parallel**](https://coincodecap.com/go/theparallel)
*   Twitter: <https://twitter.com/theparallel_com>

Imagine the distant future world, a post-apocalyptic landscape, and a massive exodus of humans from the Earth. Parallel is one of the games that are still in the process of fine-tuning. Yet, interested P2E fans can already try it out and test its core features.

This Ethereum-based P2E product went through the alpha sale round in March 2021, raising $1.3 million for its further development. The card drop round occurred in August 2021, yielding an additional $1.3 million from card sales.

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*qIpMwYJPtY7wNb_c-MNC5Q.png)

**Why is Parallel so popular?**

It‚Äôs all about the team and the concept art behind it. It‚Äôs well-known that the P2E market is still lagging far behind the mainstream gaming market in terms of graphics and animation. A beautifully designed artistic concept is a rare gem in the P2E industry. So, you‚Äôll be thrilled to know that artists who worked on the visual concepts of Blizzard, EA, and Ubisoft are behind the Parallel concept art.

Parallel‚Äôs cards are performed in the best sci-fi tradition, reminiscent of Interstellar images. Besides, the game offers an unusual tokenomic model, relying on the NFTs alone, without using tokens.

## #13 My Neighbor Alice

*   Blockchain: Ethereum Blockchain
*   Score: Score *6/10 based on 27 reviews*
*   Website link: [**My Neighbor Alice**](https://coincodecap.com/go/myneighboralice)
*   Telegram channel: <https://t.me/MyNeighborAlice>

This game is a relatively new offering in the NFT P2E game market. It was released in January 2022 but quickly gained popularity among the masses. Its fun, appealing graphics, and a metaverse idea attract thousands of avid gamers wishing to build their new virtual homes and earn crypto assets.

My Neighbor Alice‚Äôs popularity is partly explained by the fact that it welcomes even NFT rookies. It means that even if the crypto world, blockchain, and NFT terms mean nothing to you, you can still play and succeed. All you need is to buy some land and start engaging in farming, fishing, and beekeeping to collect rewards in the in-game token ALICE. Those who collect enough ALICE can stake it to earn passive income.

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*sBAhlvmBKhsdPW1hnverfQ.png)

## #14 RaceFi

*   Blockchain: Solana Blockchain
*   Score: Score *6/10 based on 26 reviews*
*   Website link: [**RaceFi**](https://coincodecap.com/go/racefi)
*   Telegram channel: <https://t.me/racefi_io>

Car racing has been an unpopular theme in P2E gaming thus far. But things are changing, and RaceFi is a good example that even car competitions can be adapted for exciting P2E gameplay. This game operates on a Solana ecosystem and is a one-of-a-kind game with AI/ML features.

The game‚Äôs graphics are breathtaking, meeting the high standard of traditional car racing animation. The in-game P2E opportunities are also diverse; gamers can win crypto tokens by competing with other players on the racetracks, own garages and gas stations, and even buy land within the game for further rental. The in-game token is RACEFI.

## #15 Guild of Guardians

*   Blockchain: Ethereum Blockchain
*   Score: Score *6/10 based on 25 reviews*
*   Website link: [**Guild of Guardians**](https://coincodecap.com/go/guildofguardians)
*   Twitter: <https://twitter.com/GuildofGuardian>

Gamers love RPG games, and Guild of Guardians is one of the most awaited projects in the P2E market in this category so far. It has already collected over 130,000 active players on the waitlist, meaning its release will be hype.

The in-game transactions can be done with the help of the GOG token. The storyline is a mystery to a large degree; all we know is that players will be invited to create guilds of fantasy guardians and compete for epic rewards in the game‚Äôs virtual world.

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*7aSXnaBBxbQjh01FbxNB6w.png)

## Is P2E Gaming Better than Traditional Gaming?

As you can see, the NFT P2E market is rising quickly, with thousands of new players joining the community. The outbreak of COVID-19 and related social restrictions also contributed to the spread of P2E gaming, with millions of people locked in their homes and limited in their work opportunities. However, this gaming sector is yet to become mainstream; traditional mobile and desktop gaming still rule this #1 entertainment industry globally. With the gaming market expected to double from $200 billion to $400+ billion by 2030, P2E games are sure to contribute to that growth to a large degree. So, enjoy the trend, pick one of the games we‚Äôve just discussed, and have a good time!

title: Keunggulan M88 yang Mesti Kalian Ketahui
body:
M88 adalah situs betting yang akan memberikan pengalaman menarik serta keuntungan yang luar biasa bagi para penggunanya. Sebagai ajang judi online, M88 menyediakan berbagai penawaran yang menyenangkan mulai dari hadiah yang melimpah, cashback yang sangat besar, dan tentunya win rate yang tinggi.

## Link Alternatif Login M88 Terbaru

Semenjak diblokirnya domain utama M88 yakni m88.com di Indonesia, maka para pelanggan tidak dapat mengakses menu login maupun memainkan semua jenis permainannya. Oleh sebab itu, M88 menyediakan link alternatif login M88 terbaru yakni di wc88888.com.

Apabila terjadi pemblokiran lagi, maka kalian bisa mengakses daftar link alternatif M88 yang tersedia di halaman berikut ini: 18mbet88.com. Nantinya, kalian dapat login, daftar, ataupun memainkan beragam jenis permainan dari situs alternatif tersebut.

## Keunggulan M88 yang Mesti Kalian Ketahui

Seperti yang kita tahu, saat ini kompetisi persaingan di dunia judi online sangatlah ketat. Tak ayal, para bandar judi berlomba-lomba untuk memberikan banyak manfaat bagi para penggunanya. Termasuk juga M88 yang memberikan banyak kelebihan seperti berikut ini:

### Tersedia Beragam Jenis Ajang Taruhan

Sebagai platform judi dengan standar pelayanan yang tinggi, M88 tentunya menyediakan ajang taruhan yang beraneka ragam. Semua jenis ajang taruhan tersebut bisa kalian nikmati juga di seluruh afiliasi resmi M88. Misalnya adalah M88Asia.

Berikut beberapa jenis ajang taruhan yang tersedia di M88 yang perlu kalian ketahui apabila tertarik ingin mencobanya:

‚Ä¢   **Slot online:** sebagai permainan judi terpopuler di Indonesia, tentu slot online tersedia di M88. Dengan bekerja sama terhadap beberapa provider ternama, maka kalian tak perlu khawatir lagi terhadap keamanan dan kejujuran permainannya. Dengan modal kecil, kalian bisa berpotensi mendapatkan keuntungan yang sangat besar melalui slot.
‚Ä¢   **e-Sport dan Sport:** e-Sport dan Sport merupakan ajang taruhan yang menggunakan konsep ‚Äútaruhan olahraga‚Äù. Jadi, nantinya para pemain dapat mengikuti berbagai turnamen populer yang digelar di seluruh dunia. Baik itu dari tingkat lokal, regional, nasional, global, hingga piala dunia pun tersedia secara lengkap di sini.
‚Ä¢   **Keno & Lotto:** di Indonesia, memang  permainan ini kurang populer. Namun, jika kalian tertarik dengan jenis permainan yang berbasis angka, maka keno dan lotto merupakan pilihan terbaik yang dapat kalian gunakan. Seringkali, para pemain bisa mendapatkan jackpot gila-gilaan hingga ratusan juta hanya dengan langkah sederhana.
‚Ä¢   **Live Kasino:** salah satu ajang perjudian yang menggunakan beragam jenis permainan khas kasino layaknya roulette, blackjack, baccarat, dan masih banyak lagi. Setiap permainan dilakukan dengan lawan manusia asli sehingga kalian bisa berinteraksi secara sungguhan.
‚Ä¢   **Permainan Lainnya:** permainan lain seperti tembak ikan, sic bo, dragon tiger dan sebagainya pun tersedia di M88. Semua permainan tersebut pun mendukung akses multi platform mulai dari akses mobile, dekstop, bahkan termasuk akses WAP.

### Deposit dan Withdraw secara Mudah dan Cepat

Selanjutnya, kalian bisa bermain beragam jenis taruhan dengan deposit dan withdraw yang mudah melalui beragam channel pembayaran.

Pembayaran dilakukan secara cepat, mudah, dan tentunya 100% aman. Semua transaksi akan melibatkan mata uang rupiah yang nantinya akan lebih memudahkan dalam berbagai transaksi.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/NUatlBxkDhVzmT6qEpt57.png?height=508&width=936)

### Dukungan 24/7 bagi Semua Pelanggan

Saat terjadi masalah, maka kalian tak perlu khawatir. Saat ini M88 telah dibekali dengan fitur dukungan pelanggan yang beroperasi setiap saat selama 24/7.

Staf dukungan pelanggan pun telah berpengalaman dan terdidik dengan baik sehingga dapat melayani setiap pelanggan secara profesional. Bahkan, kalian pun akan diberi solusi terbaik saat mendapatkan masalah khusus.

Dukungan yang tersedia pun menggunakan bahasa Indonesia. Nantinya, kalian bisa menghubunginya via beberapa layanan seperti:

‚Ä¢   Live chat di situs website
‚Ä¢   Email I di [indo_cs@m88.com](mailto:indo_cs@m88.com)
‚Ä¢   Email II di [csmanager@m88.com](mailto:csmanager@m88.com)

Untuk layanan lebih cepat, kalian bisa menghubunginya via live chat. Namun, bila ingin menghubungi dengan melampirkan beragam jenis dokumen secara lengkap, kalian bisa mencobanya via email. Namun, butuh waktu lebih lama untuk meresponsnya yakni sekitar 4 jam apabila via email.

### Bonus yang Berlimpah Ruah

Yang ditunggu-tunggu para pelanggan yakni ‚Äúbonus melimpah‚Äù tentunya disediakan oleh M88. Sebagai pelanggan, kalian bisa mendapatkan beragam jenis hadiah yang besar dan tentunya banyak variasinya.

Diantara banyak bonus yang disediakan oleh M88, berikut beberapa jenis bonus yang akan kalian dapatkan apabila menjadi pelanggan setia M88:

‚Ä¢   Bonus new member (bonus sambutan) sebanyak 100% di permainan sport dan e-sport.
‚Ä¢   Rebate harian sebesar 0,8% tanpa ada batasan
‚Ä¢   Summer bonus hingga total maksimum Rp 50 ribu.
‚Ä¢   Rebate harian keno & lotto hingga 1% tanpa ada batasan.
‚Ä¢   Bonus reload kasino sebesar 15% hingga 5,6 ribu.

### Banyak Jaringan Sponsorship

Untuk menunjukkan komitmennya sebagai situs judi terbaik di Indonesia, M88 juga bekerja sama dengan berbagai jaringan sponsorship di berbagai dunia.

Dengan begitu, kalian tak perlu mengkhawatirkan lagi keamanan dan kejujuran saat bermain berbagai jenis permainan di M88. Berikut beberapa partner sponsorship M88 yang perlu kalian ketahui:

‚Ä¢   Mitra regional resmi LaLiga
‚Ä¢   Global Title Sponsor Tylon
‚Ä¢   Mitra taruhan resmi BWF
‚Ä¢   Manny Packquiao ‚Äì M88 Ambassador
‚Ä¢   Mitra taruhan resmi triton poker
‚Ä¢   M88 Celebrity partner Maria Kogawa

## Cara Bermain dan Bertaruh di M88

Bagi kalian yang ingin mendapatkan keuntungan dengan modal yang relatif kecil, silakan untuk memainkannya di M88. Namun, sebelum kalian bisa memainkannya maka pertama-tama harus mendaftarnya terlebih dahulu. Setelah itu baru deposit dan segera memainkannya.

**Berikut langkah-langkah yang perlu kalian lakukan untuk mendaftar M88:**

1. Kunjungi situs resmi M88 baik via link alternatif ataupun asli.
2. Klik tombol ‚ÄúDaftar Sekarang‚Äù yang terletak di bagian atas sebelah kanan.
3. Pada formulir pendaftaran yang muncul, silakan isi semua data secara lengkap.
4. Terakhir, klik tombol ‚ÄúPendaftaran Selesai‚Äù.

Setelah kalian melakukan pendaftaran dan akun sudah terverifikasi, maka silakan bermain dan pasang taruhan dengan langkah-langkah sebagai berikut:

1. Login ke akun yang telah kalian buat tadi.
2. Pilih jenis permainan yang tersedia.
3. Tentukan ajang spesifik yang ingin kalian ikuti.
4. Pilih model taruhan yang ingin kalian ikuti.
5. Pasang modal taruhan sesuai keinginan.
6. Klik tombol ‚ÄúPlace Bet‚Äù untuk menempatkan taruhan.
7. Jika menang, maka hadiah akan langsung masuk ke saldo.
8. Penarikan bisa dilakukan via bank atau pembayaran lainnya.
9. Selesai!

Êàë‰∏æ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÁÆÄÂçïÁöÑ‰æãÂ≠êÔºö1973Âπ¥ÔºåÂçéÁõõÈ°øÈÇÆÊä•ÂÖ¨Âè∏ÊÄªÂ∏ÇÂÄº‰∏∫8,000‰∏áÁæéÂÖÉÔºåÈÇ£Êó∂‰ªª‰Ωï‰∏ÄÂ§©‰Ω†ÈÉΩÂèØ‰ª•Â∞ÜÂÖ∂ËµÑ‰∫ßÂçñÁªôÂçÅ‰Ωç‰π∞ÂÆ∂‰∏≠ÁöÑ‰ªª‰Ωï‰∏Ä‰ΩçÔºåËÄå‰∏î‰ª∑Ê†º‰∏ç‰ºö‰Ωé‰∫é4‰∫øÁæéÂÖÉÔºåÁîöËá≥Ëøò‰ºöÊõ¥È´ò„ÄÇËØ•ÂÖ¨Âè∏Êã•Êúâ„ÄäÂçéÁõõÈ°øÈÇÆÊä•„Äã„ÄÅ„ÄäÊñ∞ÈóªÂë®Âàä„Äã‰ª•ÂèäÂá†ÂÆ∂Â∏ÇÂú∫Âú∞‰Ωç‰∏æË∂≥ËΩªÈáçÁöÑÁîµËßÜÂè∞ÔºåËøô‰∫õËµÑ‰∫ßÁõÆÂâçÁöÑÂ∏ÇÂú∫‰ª∑ÂÄºÈ´òËææ20‰∫øÁæéÂÖÉ„ÄÇÂõ†Ê≠§ÔºåÊÑøÊÑèÊîØ‰ªò4‰∫øÁæéÂÖÉÁöÑ‰π∞ÂÆ∂Âπ∂ÈùûÁñØÁãÇ‰πã‰∏æ„ÄÇ

Áé∞Âú®ËÇ°‰ª∑Â¶ÇÊûúÁªßÁª≠‰∏ãË∑åÔºåÂÖ¨Âè∏Â∏ÇÂÄº‰ªé8,000‰∏áÁæéÂÖÉË∑åÂà∞4,000‰∏áÁæéÂÖÉÔºåÂÖ∂BetaÂÄº‰πü‰ºöÁõ∏Â∫îÂú∞‰∏äÂçá„ÄÇÂØπ‰∫éÁî®BetaÂÄºË°°ÈáèÈ£éÈô©ÁöÑ‰∫∫Êù•ËØ¥Ôºå‰ª∑Ê†ºË∑åÂæóË∂ä‰ΩéÔºåÊÑèÂë≥ÁùÄÈ£éÈô©ÂèòÂæóË∂äÂ§ß„ÄÇËøôÁúüÊòØÁà±Ëéâ‰∏ù‰ªôÂ¢É‰∏ÄËà¨ÁöÑ‰∫∫Èó¥Á•ûËØùÔºåÊàëÊ∞∏ËøúÊó†Ê≥ï‰∫ÜËß£‰∏∫‰ªÄ‰πàÁî®4,000‰∏áÁæéÂÖÉ‰ºöÊØîÁî®8,000‰∏áÁæéÂÖÉË¥≠‰π∞‰ª∑ÂÄº4‰∫øÁæéÂÖÉÁöÑÈ£éÈô©Êõ¥È´ò„ÄÇ‰∫ãÂÆû‰∏äÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûú‰Ω†ËÉΩÂ§ü‰π∞ËøõÂ•ΩÂá†Âè™‰ª∑ÂÄºË¢´‰∏•Èáç‰Ωé‰º∞ÁöÑËÇ°Á•®ÔºåËÄå‰∏îÁ≤æÈÄöÂÖ¨Âè∏‰º∞ÂÄºÔºåÈÇ£‰πàÔºå‰ª•8,000‰∏áÁæéÂÖÉ‰π∞ÂÖ•‰ª∑ÂÄº4‰∫øÁæéÂÖÉÁöÑËµÑ‰∫ßÔºåÁâπÂà´ÊòØÂàÜÂà´‰ª•800‰∏áÁæéÂÖÉÁöÑ‰ª∑Ê†ºÔºå‰π∞Ëøõ10Áßç‰ª∑ÂÄº4,000‰∏áÁæéÂÖÉÁöÑËµÑ‰∫ßÔºåÂü∫Êú¨‰∏äÊòØÊØ´Êó†È£éÈô©ÁöÑ„ÄÇÂõ†‰∏∫‰Ω†Êú¨‰∫∫Êó†Ê≥ï‰∫≤Ëá™ÁÆ°ÁêÜ4‰∫øÁæéÂÖÉÁöÑËµÑ‰∫ßÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•Ôºå‰Ω†Â∏åÊúõÂπ∂Á°Æ‰ø°ËÉΩÂ§üÊâæÂà∞ËØöÂÆûÂπ∂‰∏îËÉΩÂπ≤ÁöÑÁÆ°ÁêÜËÄÖÂÖ±ÂêåÊù•ÁÆ°ÁêÜÂÖ¨Âè∏ÔºåËøôÂπ∂Èùû‰∏Ä‰ª∂Âõ∞Èöæ‰πã‰∫ã„ÄÇ

## ‰∫î„ÄÅ‰ª∑ÂÄºÊäïËµÑÂ∞ÜÁªßÁª≠ÈïøÊúüÊàòËÉúÂ∏ÇÂú∫

‰Ω†‰ª¨ÂΩì‰∏≠ÁöÑ‰πüËÆ∏ÊòØÈÇ£‰∫õÂïÜ‰∏öÂ§¥ËÑëÊØîËæÉÂèëËææÁöÑ‰∫∫‰ºöÊÄÄÁñëÊàëËøôÁï™È´òË∞àÈòîËÆ∫ÁöÑÂä®Êú∫‰ΩïÂú®ÔºåËÆ©Êõ¥Â§öÁöÑ‰∫∫ËΩ¨Âêë‰ª∑ÂÄºÊäïËµÑÂøÖÁÑ∂‰ºö‰Ωø‰ª∑Ê†º‰∏é‰ª∑ÂÄºÁöÑÂ∑ÆË∑ùÊõ¥Â∞èÔºåËøô‰∏çÊòØ‰ºöËÆ©ÊàëËá™Â∑±ÁöÑÊäïËµÑËé∑ÂæóÁöÑÊú∫‰ºöÊõ¥Â∞ëÂêóÔºü

ÊàëÂè™ËÉΩÂëäËØâ‰Ω†ÔºåÊó©Âú®50Âπ¥ÂâçÊú¨¬∑Ê†ºÈõ∑ÂéÑÂßÜ‰∏éÂ§öÂæ∑ÂÜôÂá∫„ÄäËØÅÂà∏ÂàÜÊûê„Äã‰∏Ä‰π¶Êó∂Ôºå‰ª∑ÂÄºÊäïËµÑÁ≠ñÁï•Â∞±ÂÖ¨‰πã‰∫é‰ºó‰∫Ü„ÄÇÊàëÂÆûË∑µ‰ª∑ÂÄºÊäïËµÑÈïøËææ35Âπ¥ÔºåÂç¥‰ªéÊ≤°ÊúâÂèëÁé∞Êúâ‰ªª‰ΩïÂ§ß‰ºóËΩ¨Âêë‰ª∑ÂÄºÊäïËµÑÁöÑË∂ãÂäøÔºå‰ºº‰πé‰∫∫Á±ªÊúâÊüêÁßçÊääÊú¨Êù•ÁÆÄÂçïÁöÑ‰∫ãÊÉÖÂèòÂæóÊõ¥Âä†Â§çÊùÇÁöÑÈ°ΩÂõ∫Êú¨ÊÄß„ÄÇ

ËàπËà∂Â∞ÜÊ∞∏ËøúÁéØÁªïÂú∞ÁêÉËà™Ë°åÔºå‰ΩÜÁõ∏‰ø°Âú∞ÁêÉÊòØÂπ≥ÁöÑ‰∫∫‰ªçÊóßÂæàÂ§ö„ÄÇÂú®ËÇ°Á•®Â∏ÇÂú∫‰∏≠Ôºå‰ª∑Ê†º‰∏é‰ª∑ÂÄº‰πãÈó¥‰ªçÂ∞ÜÁªßÁª≠‰øùÊåÅÁùÄÂæàÂ§ßÁöÑÂ∑ÆË∑ùÔºåÈÇ£‰∫õ‰ø°Â•âÊ†ºÈõ∑ÂéÑÂßÜ‰∏éÂ§öÂæ∑‰ª∑ÂÄºÊäïËµÑÁ≠ñÁï•ÁöÑÊäïËµÑ‰∫∫‰ªçÂ∞ÜÁªßÁª≠ÂèñÂæóÂ∑®Â§ßÁöÑÊàêÂäü„ÄÇ
