title: ETH Strikes Back
body:
Dear Bankless Nation,

Welcome to the weekly recap of the biggest crypto news for the second week of July.

Is the bear market over already?
ETH is up 31% this week at \~1.5K, leading the market in the first substantial rally in many months after a 69% drawdown from its peak of \~4.8K this March.

Macro indicators are still bleak and bleaker. The ECB announced it‚Äôs getting in on rate hikes for the first time in over a decade. Over in the US, there are rumblings of a 100 basis point raise for July‚Äôs Fed meeting.

What explains the recent price rally? Is the impending Merge being priced in? Or just another bull trap?

Have crypto prices bottomed out yet? Join the discussion on this week‚Äôs Bankless open thread. üí≠

Incoming zkEVM
It‚Äôs ETH CC week, and the biggest piece of news sweeping crypto is the launch of zkEVMs.

‚Ä¶So what are these bad boys?

EVM-compatibility (Ethereum Virtual Machine) allows any Web3 project to plug into Ethereum‚Äôs established infrastructure and user base.

Then zk-rollups (zero knowledge) are a major Layer 2 scaling boon. Vitalik himself said they were the end game.

zkEVMs combines them both.

Devs like it because they can deploy smart contracts and integrate Ethereum tools in the same way they would on Ethereum, yet with faster speeds and lower cost.

Ok so, zkEVMs are great. That means there‚Äôs big competition for optimistic rollups. A total of three zkEVM projects are coming out the bull gate this week by the Scroll team, zkSync and Polygon. They‚Äôre all in pre-alpha phases at the moment. It‚Äôs a sign of big things coming for Ethereum.

Twitter avatar for @SocketDotTechSocket @SocketDotTech
@0xPolygon @0xPolygonHermez @zksync @Scroll_ZKP ‚ú® Battle of the zkEVMs Here is how the 3 zkEVMs stack up against each other: @Scroll_ZKP has EVM equivalence at the op-code level @0xPolygon has EVM equivalence with modified op-code @zksync achieves EVM compatibility with a custom compiler
Image
July 21st 2022

19 Retweets51 Likes
For more complete details, check out Bankless articles published this week: William Peaster‚Äôs coverage of zkEVMs and Ben Giove on under-the-radar L2s that are poised for growth.

Three Arrows Capital troubles, continued
I wrote last week in ‚ÄúDeFi Will Never Die‚Äù that the ongoing problems with centralized crypto banks isn‚Äôt one of risky trades per se, but rather how the rules of the system poorly deal with that risk.

DeFi mitigates that risk inherently through built-in transparency on the blockchain because protocols are forced to air their dirty laundry in public, and quickly start paying those loans if that laundry begins to pile up. David Hoffman calls this ‚ÄúThe New Supreme Court‚Äù:

‚ÄúThe legal courts overseeing the Celsius and 3AC cases are subordinate to the court of the EVM; the code that enforces the smart contracts that power the DeFi lending applications. The EVM is the most superior court in the world. The legal contract system of nation-state courts is junior to Ethereum and the EVM.

When markets break down, they revert back to a system of lawyers and courts, and we are currently witnessing that in the cases of 3AC and Celcius. Long-drawn-out court proceedings are beginning; meanwhile, DeFi is still chugging away and onto the next thing. And no DeFi lenders lost a dime.‚Äù

Crypto banks, though, are opaque and prone to risky leveraging calls. In this case, that risk bubbled into a public health epidemic of sorts.

A thousand page legal document revealed this week that Three Arrows Capital owed 27 crypto companies a total of $3.5B, of which the largest chunk belongs to crypto lender Genesis that made an undercollaterized loan of $2.36B. In second place is Voyager with a loan of \~$685M, who filed bankruptcy two weeks ago.

Genesis‚Äô loans were collateralized by 17.4M shares of Grayscale Bitcoin Trust, 447K of Grayscale Ethereum Trust; 2,7M AVAX, and 13,5M of NEAR ‚Äî all of which are down bad in the past quarter.

While Genesis made the mistake of making a loan to the overleveraged 3AC, it had the good risk management sense to liquidate losses relatively early, thanks to a margin requirement of at least 80%.

Twitter avatar for @michaelmoroMichael Moro @michaelmoro
1/ As part of our goal in providing transparency to the market, I wanted to share the latest update at @GenesisTrading.
July 6th 2022

70 Retweets406 Likes
Celsius, on the other hand, is suffering a shortfall of at least $1.2B based on a new filing, with  $5.5B in liabilities and $4.3B in assets.

Web3 News Roundup
Aave and Balancer strategic partnership
A huge governance proposal proposed back in March was unanimously passed this week that saw both DAOs swapping 16,908 AAVE ($1.63M) for 200,000 BAL ($1.13M) to create more synergy within their ecosystems and diversify each other‚Äôs treasuries.

The strategy: This enables BAL tokens to be paired in Aave‚Äôs BAL:ETH pool on Balancer, which is then locked for a year to receive veBAL tokens that in turn can be used to vote for more BAL rewards on Aave-supported pools. More liquidity and better yields for Aave.

Twitter avatar for @llamaLlama @llama
The Aave <> Balancer token swap proposal passed unanimously and has been executed! This is one of the larger strategic partnerships between two DeFi OGs and it's only the beginning of what's to come. cc @AaveAave @BalancerLabs [etherscan.io/tx/0xae1eae7db‚Ä¶](http://etherscan.io/tx/0xae1eae7db%E2%80%A6) https%3A%2F%2Fbucketeer-e05bbc84-baa3-43
Aave - Open Source Liquidity ProtocolAave is an Open Source Protocol to create Non-Custodial Liquidity Markets to earn interest on supplying and borrowing assets with a variable or stable interest rate. The protocol is designed for easy integration into your products and [services.app.aave.com](http://services.app.aave.com)
July 19th 2022

10 Retweets54 Likes
Minecraft bans NFTs
In Minecraft‚Äôs official release:

Each of these uses of NFTs and other blockchain technologies creates digital ownership based on scarcity and exclusion, which does not align with Minecraft values of creative inclusion and playing together. NFTs are not inclusive of all our community and create a scenario of the haves and the have-nots. The speculative pricing and investment mentality around NFTs takes the focus away from playing the game and encourages profiteering, which we think is inconsistent with the long-term joy and success of our players.

I think this is all wrong. An old piece I wrote for Bankless argued that gamers shouldn‚Äôt reject, but embrace NFTs. The introduction of a profit motive into NFTs is what will make video gaming better, not worse:

The non-fungible-tokenization of third-party skins, maps, and patches opens a lucrative door for the thousands of Skyrim, Half-Life, and Minecraft gaming modders and creators of user-generated content to distribute their creations for free while getting paid for it by their ‚Äú100 true fans‚Äù.

It‚Äôs also particularly rich for Microsoft to lambast NFTs for chasing a ‚Äúprofit motive,‚Äù when the company itself takes a cut from user-generated content:

For many years, Microsoft enforced intellectual property laws that allowed Minecraft users to modify and create user-generated content, but prohibited them from selling officially licensed code for profit, effectively maintaining a gray economy of passionate fans that lived to serve them.

In other words, Microsoft is saying: Profit for me and not for thee.

title: PUSHing Web3 Forward: What is EPNS and why should you care?
body:
Hey friends üëã

If you‚Äôve read much of my content, you‚Äôll know that I love to dig deep and look at the inner workings of various technologies üî¨  After all, a lot of very deliberate choices have to be made for things to work in a way that feels seamless.

Take for example the push notifications you receive all day long on your phone. They can be a bit overwhelming at times, but have you ever thought about what it would be like if they just didn‚Äôt exist at all? Let‚Äôs really consider this for a moment üßê

Imagine having to refresh your text messages constantly to see if you‚Äôd received a response you were awaiting. Or if your phone never told you the battery was getting low, but just suddenly died üò∞  Time sensitive alerts like reminders or multi-factor authentication would all be far less useful than they are today, if they even worked at all.

You see, push notifications are really just a frontend UX for *push technology*, one of the foundational pieces of the internet as we know it, where rather than a user having to initiate a *pull request* for content, that transaction is issued by the publisher or central server instead ‚ú®

Let‚Äôs look at this through an entirely analog example: A push message is like having the newspaper delivered to your door every day, whereas a pull request is like you having to go to the newsstand yourself every day to get the paper üóû  If what you want is the news delivered in a timely manner, push seems the more compelling option.

The *push notification*, which **[originated on Blackberry](https://thenextweb.com/news/evolution-of-phones-notifications)** but was brought to the mainstream by Apple with their Apple Push Notification Service (APNS) on iOS3, is the little message that is sent to the user interface (smartphone screen) to elicit a response from the user üîî

Putting aside any critiques of the ways push notifications can be used to manipulate users into over-using social media or their devices in general, this is undoubtedly one of the most important pieces of modern computing infrastructure, and one of the factors that helped drive mainstream adoption.

Despite this fact, we hardly give much thought to this humble technology. That is, until it‚Äôs not there üîç

You see the way push notifications work on smartphones (or web browsers) is that the push message is sent from one centralized server to another centralized server and then translated to a notification which is then pushed to the user (you).

This can work well enough, but it suffers from a particular fault: centralization. If you remove either the app developers central database or Apple/Google from the stack, there‚Äôs no longer an easy way to receive a notification. And since Web3 is predicated on removing these middlemen, we need a solution üëÄ

Enter EPNS.

## What is EPNS?

The **[Ethereum Push Notification Service (EPNS)](https://epns.io/)** is a decentralized push system that allows wallets to subscribe directly to notification channels. As I alluded to above, Web3 is built to be permissionless and non-custodial and thus, by design, user data is not stored on centralized servers or linked to email accounts. This is great for user privacy, security, and censorship resistance, but it effectively removes the endpoints needed for traditional push notifications üîå

Until now.

What EPNS does is introduce a novel system of decentralized middleware. *A communications layer for Web3* üò≤  Users can subscribe to channels for communication which opens the doors to a whole range of use cases from minor insights to critical alerts üö®

Here are some examples of uses that help illuminate the value being created here:

* Nearing liquidation warning (lending and borrowing)
* Staking rewards available to claim (staking)
* Price alerts (trading)
* Stablecoin peg slippage (arbitrage)
* Low gas alert
* Governance Updates
* Airdrops

These are just some of the potential opportunities unlocked by EPNS. But like all technologies, it‚Äôs hard to even imagine the things that power users will eventually create in the future üîÆ

Speaking of technology‚Ä¶

## How does it work?

EPNS is a decentralized protocol that allows dApps and other sources to create channels to which users can subscribe. Once a user is subscribed to a channel, they will receive push notifications which can come in the form of *broadcasts* sent out to all subscribers, messages to subsets of subscribers, or even targeted messages to an individual wallet address. üì¨

## Sending

By staking a small amount of PUSH tokens (formerly DAI), users can create a channel, which allows for the sending of messages.

> *Businesses, dapps, and even individuals can all be channels; they can program notifications to be sent in response to on-chain information, and/or send notifications manually for off-chain activities*

Source: **[EPNS Blog](https://medium.com/ethereum-push-notification-service/getting-started-with-epns-ca2dd7f43329)**

Message data can be sent via the EPNS Communicator contract which can be deployed on any EVM compatible blockchain, and eventually even non-EVM compatible chains. This data is picked up by the Push Nodes which are always listening to the Communicator contracts ü¶ª  The Push Nodes connect to the EPNS Core smart contract for validation (basically confirming that the sender is an existing channel and is not spamming) and then they dispatch those messages to the front-end infrastructure üì≤  EPNS provides apps for iOS, Android, and Web that can read and display these notifications to users, but in the future, this will be integrated into your wallet of choice.

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*op8Az6jrBGBnftwWWKT78w.png)

## Receiving

As I mentioned above, subscribers are users who have opted in to receive notifications from a specific channel. That‚Äôs a very straightforward process. Just open the **[EPNS app](https://app.epns.io/)** and connect your wallet. From the *channels* tab, you can easily subscribe to your preferred channels, whether you want to be notified of liquidation risk on Compound or Aave, receive updates about governance on the projects you follow, or simply get notifications about the current Ethereum gas price ‚õΩÔ∏è  And even more services are coming as more and more protocols decide to implement EPNS notifications.

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*fKBAJD4kGhsQXNZ-qY4qTA.png)

From the app, you can also check your inbox to see all the messages you‚Äôve received and opt out of channels you no longer want to follow.

## Looking Forward

There‚Äôs a lot of upgrades coming to the protocol that will add greater functionality and further increase decentralization. For example, one of the most exciting features in the **[2022 roadmap](https://medium.com/ethereum-push-notification-service/epns-roadmap-2022-2698ab153c1a)** is wallet to wallet communication. This will open up new opportunities like decentralized chat apps and will pave the way for something much bigger: smart contract to smart contract communication. That is something that is particularly exciting, as it could allow for incredible automation opportunities ü§ñ

Imagine for example that when your loan is at risk of liquidation, Aave could just send a push notification to a smart contract that you‚Äôd filled with additional collateral, triggering a top up and avoiding liquidation without you having to lift a finger. This sort of approach is hypothetically possible using these technologies. And that‚Äôs really just the tip of the iceberg üßä

## Node Decentralization

An important next step in EPNS‚Äô progressive decentralization of the protocol is to decentralize nodes. This is going to be done through a system of permissionless participation based on game theory. The nodes themselves don‚Äôt require any hardware as they are essentially software server nodes that store relevant data on IPFS. The key feature is a focus on incentivizing participation with staking rewards and penalizing bad behaviour via slashing ü§∫

The EPNS Core and Comm(unicator) smart contracts have been **[audited by ChainSafe](https://ethereum-push-notification.gitbook.io/epns-smart-contracts/security-audits)**, so the next step is to ensure that push nodes are ready to support all the new features, especially the multi-chain support, and then to decentralize further from there üåê

## Governance

EPNS is governed by PUSH token holders and in keeping with the push (no pun intended) towards progressive decentralization, EPNS is working hard to get the tokens into the hands of active contributors and stewards of the protocol. This is intended to be accomplished through the newly launched grants program (of which I was a recipient), the weekly Rockstar of EPNS awards for participation (with winners selected by Snapshot vote), and meta-governance through DAO to DAO partnerships. Other tools for rewarding active community members, like **[Coordinape](https://coordinape.com/)** are being discussed as well üí¨

If you‚Äôre reading this and think EPNS sounds interesting, I encourage you to **[join the discord](https://discord.gg/NT3scMBZUy)**, ask questions and get involved in whatever way you can. Also check out the **[website](https://epns.io/)**, **[blog](https://medium.com/ethereum-push-notification-service)**, and **[twitter](https://twitter.com/epnsproject)**.

The future of the web is being built as we speak and, like everything that came before it, it‚Äôs the underlying technologies that have the biggest impact. I started this post by discussing push notifications, those ubiquitous pop-ups that we probably never think about unless they‚Äôre either driving us mad or saving our hides. But ask any app developer, this is an absolutely crucial piece of the user experience and it‚Äôs been missing from Web3.

Until now üîî


---

This post is brought to you thanks to a grant from EPNS‚Äô Push Grants program ü§ù  As always the opinions expressed are my own, I do not work with projects I don‚Äôt believe in, and I implore you to do your own research before investing.

To learn more about the Ethereum Push Notification Service, visit **[epns.io](https://epns.io/)**


---

ApolloFiÁöÑÂ•ñÂä±ÊòØÊ∫êÊ∫ê‰∏çÊñ≠ÁöÑÔºå‰∏îÂú®‰∏ÄÂºÄÂßãÂÆòÊñπÂ∞±Ë°®Êòé‰∫ÜÂÖ∂Á´ãÊÑèÔºöÊàê‰∏∫Web2ËøõÂÖ•Web3‰∏ñÁïåÁöÑËøûÊé•Ê°•„ÄÇApolloFiÊØèÂë®ÊåâÁÖßË¥°ÁåÆÂÄºÂèëÊîæÂ•ñÂä±ÔºåËøôÊó¢‰∏çÊòØÂçïÁ∫ØËé∑Âæó‰ª£Â∏ÅÂ•ñÂä±ËÄå‰∏çËÉΩ‰∫§ÊòìÁöÑ‚ÄúÁîªÂ§ßÈ•º‚ÄùÔºå‰πü‰∏çÊòØ‰∏∫‰∫ÜÁ©∫ÊäïÂ•ñÂä±Ê≥®ÂÖ•Â§ßÈáèËµÑÈáëËøõË°åÁöÑ‰∫§‰∫íÂ∞ùËØïÔºåÁõ∏ÊØî‰πã‰∏ãÔºåAPOÊòØ‰ºóÂ§öÂÖ∏ËåÉ‰∏≠ÁöÑËØöÊÑè‰πã‰ΩúÔºÅ

title: Tropaeolum Majus Release
body:
This release focuses on minor bug fixes, package updates, and better market data available within the Kwenta UI. This release officially moves Kwenta to version 3.0.0  and out of BETA!

### Lazy Load implementation for Trading History

Traders were previously limited to only being able to view the last 50 global trade entries routed through a selected assets contract. With lazy load implemented, traders can review an infinite amount of recent trades.

![Global Trade History Lookback Period Increased](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/kjV3ZJfp_spKwjyCkkub2.png?height=311&width=319)

### Market Skew Data on Mobile

The skew bar on the desktop implementation of Kwenta visually displays open interest on either side of the market and conveniently sits directly on top of the trading history. Our mobile implementation omitted any reference to skew data. In this release, skew data is now visible to traders on mobile, on a selected markets stats page.

![Market Skew Data on Mobile](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/pFPbudFltU9Hcg3dkYKTA.png?height=2255&width=1284)

## Additional Minor Changes This Release:

* Bump eslint from 7.12.0 to 7.32.0
* Fix tx error handling
* Fix: reject the TXN may crash the app
* Release tx error fix
* Feat/lazy load
* Bump axios from 0.21.2 to 0.27.2
* Bug: Futures positions table
* Added the missing commodity price
* remove obsolete imagemin-\* packages
* fix skew bar border on light theme
* Bump react-slick from 0.28.1 to 0.29.0
* Remove react-countdown
* Bump eslint-plugin-prettier from 3.1.4 to 4.2.1
* Bump various synthetix packages to 2.74.\*
* Add Skew data in the mobile market stats tab
* Bump eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y from 6.4.1 to 6.6.1
* Bump @svgr/webpack from 6.2.1 to 6.3.1
* Futures Positions Table bug fixes and refactor
* Release v3.0.0

## Join the Kwenta Community

If you haven't already, join the Kwenta community on [Discord](https://discord.gg/6Q96RM2CJA).

To learn more about how you can acquire a DAO role as a developer, marketer, governance contributor, or professional trader, visit our [Documentation](https://docs.kwenta.io/dao/dao-roles).

To be the first to learn about new updates to Kwenta, follow us on [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kwenta_io).

title: Tropaeolum Majus Release
body:
This release focuses on minor bug fixes, package updates, and better market data available within the Kwenta UI. This release officially moves Kwenta to version 3.0.0  and out of BETA! This release is called [Tropaeolum majus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tropaeolum_majus), also known as garden nasturtium. All of the above-ground parts of the plant are edible, making for an especially ornamental salad ingredient. Upcoming Kwenta releases might be named after edible plants.

### Lazy Load implementation for Trading History

Traders were previously limited to only being able to view the last 50 global trade entries routed through a selected assets contract. With lazy load implemented, traders can review an infinite amount of recent trades.

![Global Trade History Lookback Period Increased](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/kjV3ZJfp_spKwjyCkkub2.png?height=311&width=319)

### Market Skew Data on Mobile

The skew bar on the desktop implementation of Kwenta visually displays open interest on either side of the market and conveniently sits directly on top of the trading history. Our mobile implementation omitted any reference to skew data. In this release, skew data is now visible to traders on mobile, on a selected markets stats page.

![Market Skew Data on Mobile](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/pFPbudFltU9Hcg3dkYKTA.png?height=2255&width=1284)

## Additional Minor Changes This Release:

* Bump eslint from 7.12.0 to 7.32.0
* Fix tx error handling
* Fix: reject the TXN may crash the app
* Release tx error fix
* Feat/lazy load
* Bump axios from 0.21.2 to 0.27.2
* Bug: Futures positions table
* Added the missing commodity price
* remove obsolete imagemin-\* packages
* fix skew bar border on light theme
* Bump react-slick from 0.28.1 to 0.29.0
* Remove react-countdown
* Bump eslint-plugin-prettier from 3.1.4 to 4.2.1
* Bump various synthetix packages to 2.74.\*
* Add Skew data in the mobile market stats tab
* Bump eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y from 6.4.1 to 6.6.1
* Bump @svgr/webpack from 6.2.1 to 6.3.1
* Futures Positions Table bug fixes and refactor
* Release v3.0.0

## Join the Kwenta Community

If you haven't already, join the Kwenta community on [Discord](https://discord.gg/6Q96RM2CJA).

To learn more about how you can acquire a DAO role as a developer, marketer, governance contributor, or professional trader, visit our [Documentation](https://docs.kwenta.io/dao/dao-roles).

To be the first to learn about new updates to Kwenta, follow us on [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kwenta_io).

title: Tropaeolum Majus Release
body:
This release focuses on minor bug fixes, package updates, and better market data available within the Kwenta UI. This release officially moves Kwenta to version 3.0.0  and out of BETA! This release is called [Tropaeolum majus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tropaeolum_majus), also known as garden nasturtium. All of the above-ground parts of the plant are edible, making for an especially ornamental salad ingredient. Upcoming Kwenta releases might be named after edible plants.

### Lazy Load implementation for Trading History

Traders were previously limited to only being able to view the last 50 global trade entries routed through a selected assets contract. With lazy load implemented, traders can review an infinite amount of recent trades.

title: Greetings from Optimism: PoolTogether Makes the Jump to Layer 2
body:
Hey friends üëã

In spite of all the chaos in the world, I still fancy myself an optimist. I love how the combination of human coordination and technology can seemingly solve almost any problem ü§ù

Take for example the issues the Ethereum network has faced in recent years. As a robust and secure smart contract blockchain, it has become the dominant platform for settlements, decentralized finance, and NFTs. But Ethereum‚Äôs base layer is built to put security above all else and, as such, opts for relatively small blocks üß±

Small blocks help maintain decentralization because the nodes that store history don‚Äôt need to add massive data dumps several times per minute. This means average people, with reasonably average computers can run them. The trade-off however is, understandably, throughput.

A common visualization of this problem is that of a highway. As traffic increases, more cars (usually containing very few passengers) begin to use the road. Soon, it‚Äôs congested üöóüöôüöó

A lot of people make the assumption that simply adding more lanes will solve the problem, but more lanes use more land, and ultimately, those lanes too fill up. Eventually you have to add more and more lanes (aka bigger and bigger blocks) until the land required is no longer feasible‚Ä¶ then what? üßê

We don‚Äôt see many 24 lane highways being constructed because there is a far better solution available, and it‚Äôs one that can actually solve the issue and scale without consuming the entirety of our landscape (or in the case of blockchains, our hard-drive space)‚Ä¶

## Mass Transit

![Timelapse of Busses in Panama City by¬†Luis Quintero](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*UfOKixfaQWdT3dtwEes1xw.jpeg)

I know what you‚Äôre thinking: ‚Äúwhat is this? Infrastructure Week?‚Äù ü§®

My friend, when it comes to designing systems, every week is infrastructure week.

So let‚Äôs go back to the analogy of highways. Let‚Äôs say that on a hypothetical strip of road, each lane can hold 100 cars, and let‚Äôs say that we have 3 lanes. Well then, we have 300 cars cruising along. But as this route becomes more popular, many more cars come, and congestion causes unbearable slowdowns, or worse, accidents üòì

We could double the lanes, yes. But then we‚Äôre only good until we hit 600 cars. Imagine if we instead put more people in each vehicle üöå A city transit bus can hold on average 60+ passengers in about the space of two or three cars.

If each two cars in our hypothetical scenario above was replaced with a bus containing even half of its capacity, we‚Äôd have 150 busses of 30 people each. That‚Äôs 4500 people in the same space as about 300 (most cars travel with a single passenger, but could hypothetically hold up to 4 or 5; even then, that would still be only 1200 to 1500 people) üß†

Now, *rugged individualism*, fuel subsidies, and a multi-decade campaign of influence by the Koch Brothers has prevented this optimization from hitting the real highways, but fortunately the information highways operate in more logical ways. You see people want to use a secure network like Ethereum but they also want fast and affordable transactions ‚öñÔ∏è

## Look Who Just Rolled Up

Layer 2 solutions are not a new concept. Bitcoin‚Äôs lightning network was proposed in a 2015 whitepaper and launched officially in 2018. To this day, if you want to transact on Bitcoin, this is the most cost-efficient way to do so‚Ä¶ if that‚Äôs something people want to do‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm skeptical it is üòâ

I‚Äôve touched on the different kinds of Layer 2 scaling solutions in other posts, so I won‚Äôt go too much into the technical differences between state-channels like Lightning and rollups, but for the curious, I definitely recommend **[this post](https://vitalik.ca/general/2021/01/05/rollup.html)** by Ethereum co-founder and lead researcher, Vitalik Buterin.

For simplicities sake, let‚Äôs say that the goal of any Layer2 is to allow transactions to be batched off-chain and settled on chain. Think of this like a trust-minimized version of what Visa or Mastercard do üí≥

A rollup, as the name suggests, allows transactions to be rolled up and settled as a little bundle of data to the Ethereum mainnet. There are two main variations of this technology: optimistic rollups and zk-rollups.

Zk-rollups are very interesting and certainly a subject we‚Äôll get into in a future post but today I want to focus on the *optimistic rollup*s as they are currently the most popular scaling solution **[by far](https://l2beat.com/)**.

![L2 Beat shows the current TVL of all major scaling solutions](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*-EvynpFs6-diltyYNJZwEQ.png)

## The OGs of OP

Optimism is, as the name alludes, an optimistic rollup. It was built by a team of Ethereum developers with a rather impressive track record. Karl Floersh, the chief technology officer of the non-profit Optimism Foundation which designed the network, previously helped develop Plasma, which serves as the technological base of the popular Polygon PoS Chain. He also worked on Casper, the consensus mechanism employed on the Ethereum Proof-of-Stake network üëª

Together with fellow Plasma Group teammates, Jinglan Wang and Ben Jones, Karl co-founded Optimism. Plasma and Optimism settle transactions in a similar way, by trusting that validated transactions are correct, but providing a window of time where they can be contested before finalizing them to the Ethereum mainnet. When the results are contested, the original code is run again on the Layer 1 to confirm correctness, at which time they become final.

This assumption of correctness is the reason for the name optimistic rollups and a big part of why the team chose the name Optimism. The other reason for the name is summarized in the official docs:

> ‚Ä¶none of this would be possible without a sense of optimism. Our optimism about the Ethereum vision keeps this project moving forward. We believe in an optimistic future for Ethereum, a future where we get to redesign our relationships to the institutions that coordinate our lives.

If you watch interviews with Karl or read any of his writing, you will immediately recognize that this is not just marketing speak, but a peak into the ideology that underlies the Optimism Foundation‚Äôs design decisions.

## An Increasingly Optimistic Outlook

By design, rollups are more centralized than so-called Layer 1s, but their use of Ethereum for finality removes the majority of the negative externalities from this. Because the data is available and the code can be run again‚Äîand this is especially true for Optimism which is EVM equivalent and moving towards complete Ethereum equivalency in terms of code execution‚Äîeven a single validator sequencing transactions could do very little in terms of censorship.

But that‚Äôs not to say the protocol is truly decentralized. And the team at Optimism knows this, which is why they‚Äôve begun the process of progressive decentralization üó≥

But then, you already knew that didn‚Äôt you?

## Airdrop #1

You probably knew about Optimism before you even clicked on this article. Not for the reasons I‚Äôve mentioned above but because recently, there was an airdrop ü™Ç

That‚Äôs right, back at the end of April, the OP token was officially announced after months of speculation, and the airdrop of tokens became available (by the way, if you haven‚Äôt already, **[check if you‚Äôre eligible](https://app.optimism.io/airdrop/check)**!) üëÄ

That airdrop accounted for just 5% of the total token supply, a little over 1/4 of the 19% being allocated to all airdrops. So my advice to airdrop farmers is to use the network as much as you can‚Äîrelative to your needs and financial capacity of course.

The airdrops are not the whole story though for those looking to acquire tokens. Whether to become stewards of the platform or to benefit financially, those looking to score some free OP will also like this little detail from the official docs:

> 25% of initial OP token supply is allocated for Proactive Project Funding. This will be distributed via community governance, KPI-driven incentives, grants programs, and other mechanisms.

This brings me to the whole reason I‚Äôm writing this article‚Ä¶

## PoolTogether is Live on Optimism

I like grants. In fact, I‚Äôve received multiple grants from PoolTogether‚Äôs PoolGrants program that have helped me make content like this üôè

If you‚Äôre unfamiliar with PoolTogether, check out my posts **[The New Wave of DeFi](https://mirror.xyz/thumbsupfinance.eth/dCWR2LJ07dA1JwqgBzSXZjWCDx0Ptq9x7sL_GZR5Hks)**, **[I Joined a DAO and I Like It](https://mirror.xyz/thumbsupfinance.eth/ybaeK-aJHVQAAa6thusVsOQU_F3NUQ6lRRFhhv7ADco)**[,](https://mirror.xyz/thumbsupfinance.eth/ybaeK-aJHVQAAa6thusVsOQU_F3NUQ6lRRFhhv7ADco) and **[Sharing is Caring](https://mirror.xyz/thumbsupfinance.eth/t8bEdFTbi-WqU65n-lSz7w1afMuMk5nKpF5ARXrzO9Q)** for more on what makes this crypto prize-savings protocol so special üíú

PoolTogether also likes grants. In fact, as they prepared to launch the protocol to be on its first rollup, they submitted an application for OP incentives. And the proposal was accepted! üéâ

So, what does that mean?

PoolTogether received 450,000 OP tokens to distribute to users of the protocol (people who deposit USDC into the prize-savings dApp at **[PoolTogether.com](https://app.pooltogether.com/deposit?network=polygon)**) on Optimism during the campaign.

According to the official announcement from PoolTogether, Phase 1 of the distribution will take place over the four weeks beginning‚Ä¶

> ‚Ä¶Tuesday, July 26th at 7 pm GMT.
>
> Rewards are accrued in real-time and claimable in weekly epochs. For example, the first rewards will be claimable on August 4th at 7 pm GMT.
>
> OP tokens will be distributed at a rate of 25,000 per week.

Throughout the campaign, the PoolTogether DAO will discuss how to operate Phase 2 of the distribution. Expect an update to this post, as more information becomes available.

In the meantime you may be wondering‚Ä¶

## How to Deposit into PoolTogether on Optimism

For those of you who are new to Optimism, PoolTogether, or both, I‚Äôve got something special just for you: a tutorial for how to get funds onto Optimism and deposit into PoolTogether üë®‚Äçüè´

And, because I know that after 1500 words about everything from highways to progressive decentralization, you‚Äôre probably sick of reading‚Ä¶

I made a video. Enjoy!

[https://youtu.be/aSNQXcM6Heg](https://youtu.be/aSNQXcM6Heg)

And until next time üëã
Thumbs Up


---

This post is brought to you thanks to a grant from PoolTogether

As always the opinions expressed are my own, I do not work with projects I don‚Äôt believe in, and I implore you to do your own research before investing.

If you want to support more content, you can buy my new Patronage NFT available on **[Ethereum](https://create.zora.co/editions/0xd3792944c863550a2ee2e8eae3de56012fbaa71f)** and **[Polygon](https://opensea.io/assets/matic/0x2953399124f0cbb46d2cbacd8a89cf0599974963/35064660268014310305097040281838965545784364408214639743877374906138829521896/)**. More info **[here](https://mirror.xyz/thumbsupfinance.eth/PB23-YDjgeG7At-QJCP5tS1f3TNjJO_L1x_1fNFffRA)**. This post itself can also be collected as an NFT on, you guessed it: Optimism!

title: 3 Bitcoin trading behaviors hint that BTC‚Äôs rebound to $24K is a ‚Äòfakeout‚Äô
body:
Bitcoin ([BTC](https://cointelegraph.com/bitcoin-price)) price rallied toward $24,200 on July 28 after a near-10.5% surge that began a day earlier.

The gains appeared after Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell signaled intentions to slow down the Fed's prevailing tightening spree. This prompted some Bitcoin analysts to predict short-term upside continuation, with pseudonymous analyst CryptoHamster seeing BTC at $26,000 next.

But BTC's potential to recover entirely from its ongoing bearish slumber appears low for at least three key reasons.

## Bitcoin bulls have been duped before

Bitcoin established its record high of $69,000 in November 2022. Since then, the cryptocurrency has declined by more than 60% while undergoing several mini pumps on its way down.¬†

On the daily chart, Bitcoin has rebounded at least five times since November 2021, securing 23%-to-40% gains on each recovery. Nonetheless, it has continued its correction every time after forming a local price top around its exponential moving averages (EMA) and then falling to new yearly lows.

*BTC/USD daily price chart featuring 'fakeouts.' Source: TradingView*

This time looks no different, with Bitcoin facing a bullish rejection in June and recovering nearly 17% a month later.¬†Notably, BTC price faces interim resistance in its 50-day EMA (the red wave) at around $23,150, with a breakout clearing its way toward $27,000, coinciding with the 100-day EMA (black).

At $27,000, the price would still form a lower high compared to the previous local tops. So, that technically raises the possibility of another bearish continuation move.

## High selling, low buying volume

Interestingly, the volume behavior during the ongoing Bitcoin correction shows a greater interest in selling the coin at local tops.

The daily chart below illustrates this by highlighting the volume readings during downtrends and uptrends since November 2021. For instance, the last two big price declines in May and June coincided with a sharp increase in selling volumes.

*BTC/USD daily price chart. Source: TradingView*

In comparison, the follow-up rebounds to those price declines accompanied modest to lower trading volumes. The ongoing volume behavior looks the same, peaking during the downtrend and dropping as the price recovers.

This suggests a weakening upside momentum, which may lead to another price correction.

## BTC to equities correlation flips back to positive

Bitcoin is once again tailing stock market trends despite briefly decoupling from them in early July.

For instance, on July 28, the day-to-day correlation coefficient between Bitcoin and the tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite stood near 0.66. That includes declines in both markets after the U.S. gross domestic product (GDP) plunged¬†for a second consecutive quarter.

*BTC/USD and NDAQ daily correlation coefficient. Source: TradingView*

That officially confirms that the U.S. has entered a ‚Äútechnical recession,‚Äù which could weigh negatively on the stock market. Therefore, Bitcoin's downside prospects appear high if its positive correlation with the stock market continues.

title: ÂçóÊµ∑‰∏ªÊùÉ‰∫âÁ´ØÁöÑÊù•ÈæôÂéªËÑâ
body:
1   È¢ÜÊµ∑Âà∞Âì™Èáå

È¶ñÂÖàËØ¥‰∏™ÊÆµÂ≠ê„ÄÇ

Êúâ‰∫∫Áü•ÈÅìÊàë‰ª¨ÁöÑÈ¢ÜÊµ∑ÊòØÊÄé‰πàÂõû‰∫ã‰πàÔºü

ÊúâÊúãÂèãËØ¥ÔºåÈÇ£Êúâ‰ΩïÈöæÔºü12Êµ∑ÈáåÈ¢ÜÊµ∑+12Êµ∑ÈáåÊØóÈÇªÂå∫+176Êµ∑Èáå‰∏ìÂ±ûÁªèÊµéÂå∫ÂòõÔºåÊÄªÂÖ±Âä†Ëµ∑Êù•‰πüÂ∞±ÊòØ200Êµ∑Èáå„ÄÇ

ÈÇ£‰πàÔºåÊàë‰ª¨ÁöÑÈ¢ÜÊµ∑ÊòØ‰ªéÂì™ÈáåËµ∑ÁÆóÂêëÂ§ñÊé®12Êµ∑ÈáåÁöÑÂë¢Ôºü‰πüÂ∞±ÊòØËØ¥ÔºåÈ¢ÜÊµ∑Âü∫Á∫øÂú®ÈÇ£ÈáåÂë¢Ôºü

1958Âπ¥Ôºå‰∏≠Âçé‰∫∫Ê∞ëÂÖ±ÂíåÂõΩÂõΩÂä°Èô¢ÂèëË°®Â£∞ÊòéÔºåÊàëÂõΩÈááÁî®12Êµ∑ÈáåÈ¢ÜÊµ∑„ÄÇ‰∏ÄÁü≥ÊøÄËµ∑‚Äú‰∏â‚ÄùÂ±ÇÊµ™ÔºåÂõ†‰∏∫Â£∞ÊòéËØ≠ÁÑâ‰∏çËØ¶ÔºåÂç∞Â∞ºÔºåÁæéÂõΩÁ≠âÂõΩÂÆ∂ÈÉΩÁ∫∑Á∫∑Êù•ÊâìÂê¨Ôºå‰Ω†‰ª¨ÁöÑÈ¢ÜÊµ∑Âà∞Â∫ïÂà∞Âì™ÈáåÂïäÔºü

ËøôÂèØ‰∏çÊòØÂ∞è‰∫ãÔºå‰∫ãÊ∂â‰∏ªÊùÉÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûú‰Ω†ÂÆ£Â∏ÉÁöÑËåÉÂõ¥‰∏é‰ªñ‰ª¨ÁöÑÂÜ≤Á™ÅÔºåÂØπÊñπËá™ÁÑ∂Ë¶ÅÊèêÊäóËÆÆÔºõ‰∫ãÊÉÖ‰πüÊ∂âÂèäÂïÜ‰∏öÔºå‰∫∫ÂÆ∂ÁöÑË¥ßËΩÆÂ¶ÇÊûúÈÅáÈöæÊàñËÄÖË¢´Êä¢Ôºå‰πüÁü•ÈÅìËØ•ÊâæË∞ÅÂ∏ÆÂøôÊïëÂä©„ÄÇÂèØÊòØÔºåÊàë‰ª¨‰∏≠ÂõΩÂ∞±ÊòØ‰∏çÂê≠Â£∞Ôºå‰∏çËÇØÂèëË°®ÂøÖÈ°ªÈôÑ‰∏äÁöÑÊµ∑Âõæ„ÄÇ

Áé∞Âú®ÂõûÊÉ≥Ëµ∑Êù•Ôºå‰πüÁúüÊòØËã¶‰∫ÜÂë®ÊÄªÁêÜ‰∏∫È¶ñÁöÑÂ§ñ‰∫§Á≥ªÁªüÔºåË¶ÅÊòØÈÇ£‰∏™Êó∂ÂÄôÂ∞±ÂÆ£Â∏É‰∫ÜÊµ∑ÂõæÔºåË∑üÂç∞Â∞º„ÄÅËè≤„ÄÅÈ©¨„ÄÅË∂ä„ÄÅÊó•„ÄÅÈü©ÁöÑÂÖ≥Á≥ªÊîπÂñÑËÇØÂÆöÊòØÂπ≥Ê∑ªÈöæÂ∫¶‰∫ÜÔºå‰∏çÂèëË°®Â£∞ÊòéÂèà‰∏çË°åÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•Êêû‰∫Ü‰∏ÄÂá∫ÊúâÂ§¥Êó†Â∞æÁöÑÊàè„ÄÇ

‰∏≠ÂõΩ‰∏çÈÄèÂ∫ïÔºåÂë®ËæπÂõΩÂÆ∂‰πüÂ∞±ÊêÅÁΩÆ‰∫ÜËøô‰ª∂‰∫ãÔºåÂèçÊ≠£‰Ω†ËøòÊ≤°ÂÆ£Â∏ÉËæπÁïåÂòõÔºåÁ≠âÂÆ£Â∏É‰∫ÜÂÜçÊäóËÆÆ‰πüÊù•ÂæóÂèä„ÄÇÂè™ÊúâÁæéÂõΩÊêÅÁΩÆ‰∏ç‰∫ÜÔºåÂ§©Â§©Êù•ÊâìÂê¨ÔºåÂøÉÈáåÊÄ•Âïä„ÄÇ

ÁæéÂõΩÊòØÊµ∑Ê¥ãÂ§ßÂõΩÔºåÂèàÂ§©Â§©Âú®ËøôËæπÊôÉÔºåÂèàÊÄïËé´ÂêçÂÖ∂Â¶ôÂèëÁîüÂÜ≤Á™ÅÔºåÈÄöËøáÂ•ΩÂ§öÊ∏†ÈÅìÊù•ÊâìÂê¨ËøáÔºåÂÖ∂‰∏≠ÂåÖÊã¨Ê≥¢ÂÖ∞Ê∏†ÈÅìÔºå‰∏≠ÂõΩÂ∞±ÊòØ‰∏çÂëäËØâ‰ªñ„ÄÇ12Êµ∑ÈáåÈ¢ÜÊµ∑‰∫ë‰∫ëÔºåÊú¨Êù•Â∞±ÊòØÂØπ‰ªò‰Ω†ÁöÑÂòõÔºå‰Ω†ÊÄ•ÔºåÊ≠£Â•Ω„ÄÇ

ËØ¥Ëµ∑Êù•ÔºåÊúâÈí±‰∫∫Â∞±ÊòØÊúâÂäûÊ≥ïÔºåÁæéÂõΩ‰∫∫‰∏çÂÉèÊàë‰ª¨Êúâ‰∫îÂçÉÂπ¥‰∏é‰∫∫ÊñóÁöÑÊô∫ÊÖßÔºåÂèØ‰ªñ‰ª¨ÊòØÁßëÂ≠¶Â§ßÂõΩÂïäÔºåÂà´ÁöÑ‰∏ç‰ºöÔºåÂÅöËØïÈ™åÊúâÁöÑÊòØÁªèË¥πÔºåÂáÜÂ§áÂÅúÂΩìÔºåËøôÂ∞±ÂÅöÂºÄ‰∫ÜËØïÈ™å„ÄÇ

‰ªéÈÇ£Âπ¥ÂºÄÂßãÔºå‰Ω†ÂéªÁúãÁúã„Ää‰∫∫Ê∞ëÊó•Êä•„ÄãÔºåÈöîÂá†Â§©Â∞±Êúâ‰∏ÄÁØáÂ£∞ÊòéÔºö‚ÄúÁæéÂõΩÊÇçÁÑ∂ÂÖ•‰æµÊàëÂõΩÈ¢ÜÊµ∑ÔºåÂº∫ÁÉàÊäóËÆÆ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚ÄùÁæéÂõΩ‰πüÂæàÊªëÁ®ΩÔºåÁÖß‰æãÊòØ‰∏ÄÁØáÂõûÂ§çÔºö‚Äú‰Ω†Ê≤°ÂÖ¨Â∏É‰Ω†ÁöÑÈ¢ÜÊµ∑ËæπÁïåÔºåÊàëÊòØËØØÂÖ•‚Äù„ÄÇ

‰Ω†Êù•ÊàëÂæÄÔºåÂèåÊñπÈÉΩÂæàÊúâËÄêÂøÉÔºåÁî®‰∫ÜÂá†Âπ¥ÁöÑÊó∂Èó¥ÔºåÁæéÂõΩÊµ∑Á©∫ÂÜõÂÖ±ËÆ°ÂÖ•‰æµÊàëÂõΩÈ¢ÜÊµ∑È¢ÜÁ©∫500‰ΩôÊ¨°Ôºà‰∏ÄËØ¥ÊòØ900‰ΩôÊ¨°ÔºâÔºåÊ≠§ÂêéÂ∞±‰∏çÊù•‰∫Ü„ÄÇ

90Âπ¥‰ª£ÂàùÔºåÊàëÂõΩ„ÄäÈ¢ÜÊµ∑Ê≥ï„ÄãÈ¢ÅÂ∏ÉÔºåÂÆ£Â∏ÉÈ¢ÜÊµ∑Âü∫Á∫øÁöÑÊó∂ÂÄôÔºåÁæéÂõΩÊèê‰æõ‰∫Ü‰∏ÄÂº†ÂõæÔºå‰∏éÊàëÂõΩËá™ÂÆöÁöÑËæπÁïå‰∏ÄËá¥„ÄÇËøôÂº†ÂõæÊÄé‰πàÊù•ÁöÑÂë¢Ôºü

Â∞±ÊòØÁæéÂõΩÊêû‰∫Ü500Ê¨°ÂÖ•‰æµÔºå‰ªéÂ§ñÊµ∑ÂæÄÈáåÊã±ÂïäÊã±ÂïäÔºåÁõ¥Âà∞‰∏≠ÂõΩÊäóËÆÆÔºåËµ∂Á¥ßÈÄÄÂá∫ÂéªÔºåÂú®Êµ∑Âõæ‰∏ä‰Ωú‰∏™Ê†áËÆ∞ÔºåËøôÂ∞±ÊòØ‰∏≠ÂõΩÈ¢ÜÊµ∑‰∫ÜÔºå500‰∏™ÁÇπÁÇπ‰∏ãÊù•Ôºå‰∫íÁõ∏‰∏ÄËøûÔºå‰∏≠ÂõΩÁöÑÈ¢ÜÊµ∑Á∫øÂ∞±Ê∏ÖÊ•ö‰∫Ü„ÄÇ‰Ω†ËØ¥‰∏∫‰∫ÜËøôÊ†πÁ∫øÔºåÁæéÂõΩ‰∫∫Ëä±‰∫ÜÂ§öÂ∞ëÈí±Âïä„ÄÇ

ÂÆïÂºÄ‰∏ÄÁ¨îÔºåÁæéÂõΩ‰Ωú‰∏∫Êµ∑‰∏äÈú∏‰∏ªÔºåÊúÄÂèçÂØπÂà´‰∫∫ÊêûÂÆΩÈ¢ÜÊµ∑‰∫ÜÔºå‰ΩÜÂêéÊù•Ëá™Â∑±‰πüÈöèÂ§ßÊµÅÔºå‰∏∫‰ªÄ‰πàÂë¢Ôºü‰∏îÂê¨‰∏ãÂõûÂàÜËß£„ÄÇ

2  ËÅîÂêàÂõΩÊµ∑Ê¥ãÊ≥ïÂÖ¨Á∫¶ÁöÑÁ¨ëËØù

Êú¨ÊúùËá™ÂÆ£Â∏É12Êµ∑ÈáåÈ¢ÜÊµ∑‰ª•Êù•ÔºåÈïøËææ‰∏âÂçÅ‰ΩôÂπ¥‰∏çÂêë‰∏ñÁïåÂÖ¨Â∏ÉÈ¢ÜÊµ∑ËæπÁïåÔºåÂàõÈÄ†‰∫ÜÂõΩÈôÖÊ≥ï‰∏äÁöÑÂ•áËßÇ„ÄÇ

ËøôÊù°ËæπÁïåÁ∫øÔºåÂ∞±Êó¢ÁªôÊàë‰ª¨Â∏¶Êù•ËøáÂà©ÁõäÔºå‰πüÂ§öÂ∞ëÊúâ‰∫õÂ∞¥Â∞¨„ÄÇ

Â∏¶Êù•Âà©ÁõäÁöÑ‰æãÂ≠êÔºåÊâìÊçûÈòøÊ≥¢‰∏∏Â∞±ÊòØ‰∏Ä‰ª∂ÔºåÊúâÁêÜÊúâÂà©ÔºåËøòÊå∫‰ªÅ‰πâÔºõÂ∏¶Êù•Á•∏ÂÆ≥ÁöÑ‰æãÂ≠êÔºåÊó†Ëøá‰∫éÂ∏åËÖäË¥ßËΩÆ‰∫ã‰ª∂„ÄÇ

1973Âπ¥ÔºåÂ∏åËÖäÁ±ç‚ÄúÊ≥¢ÁΩóÁöÑÊµ∑ÂÖãÈáåÂ§´‚ÄùÂè∑Ë¥ßËΩÆÂú®Âè∞ÊπæÊµ∑Â≥°ÂèóÂº∫Âè∞È£éË¢≠ÂáªÈÅáÈô©ÔºåË¶ÅÊ±ÇÊïëÂä©ÔºåÂú∞ÁÇπÂú®Âé¶Èó®Ê∏ØÂ§ñ‰∏çÂà∞50Êµ∑Èáå„ÄÇÂè∞ÊπæÔºåÂ§ßÈôÜÔºåÈ¶ôÊ∏ØÈÉΩÊî∂Âà∞‰∫ÜÊ±ÇÊïë‰ø°Âè∑Ôºå‰πüÈÉΩË°®Á§∫Ë¶ÅÂâçÂéªÊïëÊè¥„ÄÇ

ËøôËàπÁöÑËàπÈïøÂÖàÁîüÂ§ßÊ¶ÇÊòØ‰∏™Â≠¶ÂõΩÈôÖÊ≥ïÁöÑÔºåËÉåÂæó‚Äú‰∏ñÁïå‰∏äÂè™Êúâ‰∏Ä‰∏™‰∏≠ÂõΩÔºå‰∏≠Âçé‰∫∫Ê∞ëÂÖ±ÂíåÂõΩÊòØÂÖ®‰∏≠ÂõΩÂîØ‰∏ÄÂêàÊ≥ïÊîøÂ∫ú‚ÄùËøôÂè•ËØùÔºåÂÜçÂä†‰∏äÁ¶ªÂ§ßÈôÜÁ°ÆÂÆûËøëÔºåÂ∞±ÊãíÁªù‰∫ÜÂè∞ÊπæÁöÑÊïëÊè¥Ôºå‰∏ìÂøÉÁ≠âÂæÖ‚ÄúÂîØ‰∏ÄÂêàÊ≥ïÊîøÂ∫ú‚ÄùÊïëÊè¥„ÄÇ

ÁªìÊûúÂé¶Èó®Ê†πÊú¨Ê≤°ÊúâËÉΩÂ§üÂú®ËøôÁßçÈ£éÊµ™‰∏ãÂá∫Êµ∑ÁöÑËàπÔºåÊó†Ê≥ïÂá∫Êµ∑Êä¢Êïë„ÄÇÈöæËàπÂú®È£éÊµ™‰∏≠Êå£ÊâéËææÂçÅÂ§ö‰∏™Â∞èÊó∂ÔºåÁªà‰∫éÊ≤âÊ≤°‰∫éÂé¶Èó®Ê∏ØÂ§ñÔºåËàπ‰∏ä20ÂêçËàπÂëòÊ≠ª‰∫Ü14‰∏™Ôºå6‰∫∫Ë¢´Ëµ∂Êù•ÁöÑÊñ∞Âä†Âù°ÂïÜËàπÊïëËµ∑„ÄÇ

Ëøô‰ª∂‰∫ã‰πãÂêéÔºåÊçÆËØ¥Âë®ÊÄªÁêÜÂ§ßÂèëÈõ∑ÈúÜÔºåÁ´ãÂç≥Êã®Ê¨æÂéªÊó•Êú¨‰π∞‰∫ÜÂ§ßÂûã‰∏ì‰∏öÊïëÊçûËàπÔºåÂ∞±ÊòØËëóÂêçÁöÑ‚ÄúÊ≤™Êïë101‚ÄùÔºåÊàêÁ´ã‰∫ÜÂπøÂ∑ûÂíåÁÉüÂè∞ÊïëÊçûÂ±Ä„ÄÇ

ËøôÊù°ËàπÊàëÊòØÊú™ËßÅÂÖ∂ÁîüÔºåÊúâÂπ∏ËßÅÂÖ∂Ê≠ª„ÄÇ

90Âπ¥‰ª£ÂàùÔºåËøôÊù°Ëàπ‰ªéÊó•Êú¨ÂõûÊù•ÔºåÂø´Ë¶ÅËøõÂÖ•ÁÉüÂè∞Ê∏Ø‰∫ÜÔºå‰∏çÁü•ÈÅìÊòØÈ´òÂéãÊ≤πÁÆ°Á†¥Ë£ÇËøòÊòØÊÄé‰πàÁöÑÔºåÊú∫Ëà±Á™ÅÁÑ∂Ëµ∑ÁÅ´ÔºåËàπÂëòÈóªË≠¶ËÄåÂä®Ôºå‰∏çÂéªÊïëÁÅ´ÔºåËÄåÊòØÊä±‰∏ä‰ªéÊó•Êú¨‰π∞ÂõûÊù•ÁöÑÁªÜËΩØÔºåÁ∫∑Á∫∑ÊîæÊïëÁîüËâáÈÄÉËµ∞ÔºåÁªìÊûú‰∏ÄÊù°Â∑≤ÁªèÂõûÂà∞ÂÆ∂ÁöÑÂ§ßÂûã‰∏ì‰∏öÊïëÊçûËàπÂú®ÈîöÂú∞ÁÉßÂæóÂè™Ââ©‰∫Ü‰∏™Â£≥„ÄÇ

ÂõûÂà∞Ê≠£È¢òÔºåÂ∏åËÖäË¥ßËΩÆÁöÑ‰æãÂ≠êÂëäËØâÊàë‰ª¨ÔºåÈ¢ÜÊµ∑ÁöÑÊùÉÁõä‰∏ç‰ªÖ‰ªÖÊòØÂà©ÁõäÔºåÂÆÉËøòÊÑèÂë≥ÁùÄË¥£‰ªª„ÄÇ

ÂõΩÂúüÊòØ‰Ω†ÁöÑÔºå‰Ω†‰∏ÄÂÆöÊúâ‰πâÂä°Ë¶ÅÁÆ°Â•ΩÔºåÂê¶ÂàôÔºå‰Ω†ÂæàÂèØËÉΩÂØπÂÖ®‰∫∫Á±ªÁäØ‰∏ã‰∫ÜÁΩ™Ë°å„ÄÇÁ†¥ÂùèÊú¨ÂõΩÁöÑÁîüÊÄÅÂíå‰øùÊä§Êú¨ÂõΩÁöÑÁîüÊÄÅÔºåÊÑè‰πâ‰πüÊòØÂ¶ÇÊ≠§„ÄÇÁæéÂõΩ‰∏∫‰∫ÜËÆ©Âà´‰∫∫Áº©Á™ÑÈ¢ÜÊµ∑ÔºåÊèêÂá∫ÁßçÁßçÁêÜÁî±ÔºåÂè™ÊúâËøô‰∏ÄÊù°ÊàëÊå∫ËÆ§Âêå„ÄÇ

Êú¨Êù•ÂòõÔºåÈÇ£‰∫õËá™Â∑±ËßÑÂÆö‰∫Ü200Êµ∑ÈáåÈ¢ÜÊµ∑ÁöÑÂõΩÂÆ∂ÔºåÊ†πÊú¨Â∞±Ê≤°ÊúâÁª¥ÊåÅÁß©Â∫èÂíåÊè¥Âä©Âà´‰∫∫ÁöÑËÉΩÂäõÔºåÂèà‰æùÊ≥ï‰∏çËÆ∏Âà´‰∫∫ÁÆ°ÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûúÂí±‰ª¨Âú®ÈÇ£ÁâáÊµ∑ÂüüÈáåÂá∫‰∫Ü‰∫ãÔºåÂ≤Ç‰∏çÊòØÊô¶Ê∞îÂà∞ÂÆ∂‰∫ÜÔºü

‰∏∫‰∫ÜÂØπ‰ªòÁæéÂõΩÁöÑÊµ∑‰∏äÈú∏ÊùÉÔºåËÅîÂêàÂõΩÈáåÁöÑ‰∏ÄÂ∏ÆÁ©∑Âì•‰ª¨ÂáëËµ∑Êù•ÔºåÂº†ÁΩóÁùÄÊêû‰∏Ä‰∏™„ÄäËÅîÂêàÂõΩÊµ∑Ê¥ãÊ≥ïÂÖ¨Á∫¶„ÄãÔºåÂØπÊµ∑Ê¥ãÊùÉÁõäÁöÑÂêÑ‰∏™ÊñπÈù¢ÈÄê‰∏ÄÂÆö‰πâ„ÄÇ

* ÊØîÁâπÂ∏ÅÂ¶Ç‰Ωï‰∫§ÊòìÔºü

title: Â•≥Â∞ÜÊù®Â≠£Ëã±
body:
Âí∏‰∏∞ÂÖ≠Âπ¥ÔºåÂ§™Âπ≥ÂÜõÊîªÁ†¥Ê±üÂçóÂ§ßËê•ÔºåËøõÂÖ•ÂÖ®ÁõõÊó∂Êúü„ÄÇÊòØÂπ¥Â§™Âπ≥ÈÉΩÂüéÂ§©‰∫¨ÂèëÁîüÂèò‰π±ÔºåÂ§©ÁéãËá™Áõ∏ÊÆãÊùÄÔºåÊù®ÁßÄÊ∏ÖÂ∏ê‰∏ãÂ•≥Â∞ÜÊù®Â≠£Ëã±‰∫éÂ§©‰∫¨Â§ñÈ©ªÂÆàÊó∂ÂæóÁü•ÁªüÂ∏ÖÊù®ÁßÄÊ∏ÖË¢´ÊùÄÔºåËá™Áü•Âú®Âä´ÈöæÈÄÉÔºåÊÄùËôëÂÜç‰∏âÔºåÊúÄÁªàÁéá‰∫≤‰ø°ÈÉ®‰∏ãÂÖ´ÁôæÂ§ö‰∫∫ÂèõÊäïÊ∏ÖÂª∑ÔºåÈô∑ÂÖ•Âõ∞Â¢ÉÁöÑÊ∏ÖÂª∑ËØßÂºÇ‰∫éÊù®Â≠£Ëã±Ê≠§Êó∂Êù•ÊäïÔºåÈóÆÊòéÂéüÂõ†ÂêéÂ§ßÂñúÔºåÁ´ãÂç≥ÂéöËµèÊù®Â≠£Ëã±ÔºåÁºñÂÖ•ÊπòÂÜõÔºå‰ªç‰ªªÂ∞ÜÈ¢ÜËÅåÂä°ÔºåÊúõÂÖ∂Âä©ÊúùÂª∑Êó©Êó•Âπ≥ÂèõÈÄÜË¥ºÔºåÊù®Â≠£Ëã±Ê∑±ÊÑüÊúùÂª∑ÊÅ©ËµèÔºåÂ±°Á´ãÊàòÂäüÔºåÂú®ÂÜõ‰∏≠Â£∞ÊúõÊ∏êËµ∑ÔºåÊù®Â≠£Ëã±ÈïøÁõ∏Ë≤åÁæéÔºåÈ£éÂßøÁª∞Á∫¶Ôºå‰ΩìÊÄÅ‰∏∞ËÖ¥ÂáπÂá∏ÊúâËá¥Ôºå‰∏∫ÂÜõ‰∏≠Ê∑ª‰∏ä‰∏ÄÁ¨îÈùì‰∏ΩÈ£éÊôØÔºåÂºïËµ∑‰∏çÂ∞ë‰∫∫‰ª∞ÊÖï„ÄÇ

‰ΩÜÂÖ∂ÂÆûÊ∏ÖÊúùÂª∑ÂØπÊù®Â≠£Ëã±Âπ∂‰∏çÊîæÂøÉÔºåÂéöËµèÂ∞ÅÂ∞Ü‰πüÂè™ÊòØ‰∏∫‰∫ÜÊò≠Á§∫ÊúùÂª∑ÁöÑÂÆΩÂÆπÂ§ßÂ∫¶Ôºå‰ª•‰æøÊó•ÂêéÊãõÈôç„ÄÇË¢´ÁºñÂÖ•ÊπòÂÜõÊó∂Êù®Â≠£Ëã±Ë∫´ËæπÂÖ´ÁôæÂ§ö‰∫∫ÈÉΩË¢´ÊâìÊï£ÁºñÂÖ•ÂÖ∂ÂÆÉÂÜõÈòüÔºåÁïôÂú®Êù®Â≠£Ëã±Ë∫´ËæπÁöÑÂè™ÊúâÂå∫Âå∫‰∫åÂçÅÂ§öÂêçÂ•≥ÈÉ®ÔºåÂÖ∂Â∏ê‰∏ãÂ£´Âçí‰πü‰∏çËøá‰∏âÂõõÁôæ‰∫∫„ÄÇ‰ªªËÅå‰ª•Êù•ÔºåÊù®Â≠£Ëã±ËôΩÁÑ∂ÊàòÂäüÂçìË∂äÔºå‰ΩÜËÅå‰ΩçÂç¥ËøüËøüÈöæ‰ª•È´òÂçáÔºåÂßãÁªàÂú®‰∏≠‰ΩéÂ∞ÜÈ¢ÜÈó¥ÂæòÂæäÔºå‰∏çËøáÊù®Â≠£Ëã±ÂÄíÊ≤°ÊúâÊÄ®Ë®ÄÔºåÊØïÁ´üËá™Â∑±Êõæ‰ª•ÂèõË¥ºË∫´‰ªΩÊù•ÈôçÊúùÂª∑ÔºåÊúùÂª∑ËÉΩ‰∏çËÆ°ÂâçÂ´å‰ªªÁî®Ëá™Â∑±‰æøÂ∑≤ÂçÅÂàÜÊÑüÊøÄÔºåÊÄªÁöÑÊù•ËØ¥Êù®Â≠£Ëã±Âú®ÂÜõ‰∏≠ÁöÑÂæÖÈÅáËøòÁÆó‰∏çÈîô„ÄÇ‰∏çËøáÂ•ΩÊó•Â≠êÂæàÂø´Â∞±Âà∞Â§¥‰∫Ü„ÄÇÁî±‰∫éÊπòÂÜõ‰πÖÊîªÂÆâÂ∫Ü‰∏çÂÖãÔºåÊúùÂª∑Êõ¥Êç¢‰∫ÜÈÉΩÁªüÔºåÊñ∞ÈÉΩÁªüÂº†Âª∑ËåÉÁîüÊÄßÈò¥ÊçüÊØíËæ£ÔºåÂØπÊúùÂª∑Â•ñËµèÂ§™Âπ≥ÈôçÂ∞Ü‰ª•ÊãõÂÆâÁöÑÊîøÁ≠ñÂæà‰∏çÊª°ÔºåËá™ÁÑ∂ÂØπÊù®Â≠£Ëã±ÊòØÂ§ÑÂ§ÑÂàÅÈöæ„ÄÇ

Êù®Â≠£Ëã±‰º∏Âá∫ÂèåÊâãÊé∞ÂºÄËá™Â∑±ÁöÑ‰∏§Áì£ËÇ•ËáÄÔºåÂíåÂæ∑ÂÖâ‰ªé‰æçÂç´ÊâãÈáåÊé•ËøáÈìÅÂã∫ÔºåÈáåÈù¢ÊòØÊªöÁÉ´ÁöÑËú°Ê≤πÔºåÂíåÂæ∑ÂÖâ‰∏æËµ∑ÈìÅÂã∫ÔºåÂ∞ÜÈáåÈù¢ÁöÑËú°Ê≤πÂÖ®ÈÉ®ÂÄíÂú®Êù®Â≠£Ëã±ÂêéÂ∫≠‚Ä¶‚Ä¶

‚ÄúÂïäÔºÅÔºÅÔºÅ‚ÄùÊù®Â≠£Ëã±‰∏ÄÂ£∞ÊÉ®Âè´ÔºåÂèåÊâã‰∏ÄÊùæÔºå‰∏§Áì£Â±ÅËÇ°ÂØπÊíûÂèëÂá∫‚ÄòÂï™‚ÄôÁöÑ‰∏ÄÂ£∞ÔºåËáÄÊ≤üÈáåÊª°ÊòØÊªöÁÉ´ÁöÑËú°Ê≤πÔºåÊù®Â≠£Ëã±ÊÑüËßâÂêéÂ∫≠Âø´Ë¶ÅÁÜü‰∫Ü‰∏ÄËà¨ÔºåÂèàÂº†ÂºÄËáÄÊ≤üÔºåÂÉèËÆ©Ëú°Ê≤πÂáâÂø´‰∏Ä‰∫õÔºåÂèØÊÉúÁÅ´ÊºÜËú°Á≤òÊÄß‰πüÊØîËæÉÂ•ΩÔºåÊ≠ªÊ≠ªÁ≤òÂú®Êù®Â≠£Ëã±ËÇâ‰∏äÔºåÊåÅÁª≠ÁÅºÁÉ´ÁùÄËáÄËÇâ„ÄÇ

Ëøá‰∫ÜÂ•Ω‰∏Ä‰ºöÂÑøÔºåËú°Ê≤πÊâçÊÖ¢ÊÖ¢ÂèòÊàêÊ≥•Áä∂ÔºåÂíåÂæ∑ÂÖâÊääËú°Ê≤πÊâ£‰∏ãÔºåÊù®Â≠£Ëã±ÁöÑÂ±Å.ÁúºËæπÁºòÁöÑË§∂Áö±Â∑≤Áªè‰∏çËßÅÔºåËÇâÂ≠î‰∏äÁîüÂá∫Ê∞¥Ê≥°ÔºåËáÄÊ≤ü‰∏§‰æßÁöÑËÇâ‰πüËµ∑‰∫ÜÂ•ΩÂá†‰∏™Ê≥°ÔºåËáÄÊ≤üÈáåÁöÑËÇâÁî±Á∫¢Ê≥õÁôΩ......Êé•‰∏ãÊù•ÁöÑÊï∞Êó•Êù®Â≠£Ëã±ËøòË¶ÅÊäºËß£Á≤ÆËçâÔºåÊÅêÊÄï‰ºöËã¶‰∏çÂ†™Ë®Ä„ÄÇ

‚ÄúÊÅ≠ÂñúÊù®Â∞ÜÂÜõÂèóÂÆå‰∫ÜÂàëÔºåÊàëÊï¨Êù®Â∞ÜÂÜõ‰∏ÄÊùØÔºÅ‚ÄùÂíåÂæ∑ÂÖâÊäìËµ∑ÈÖíÊùØ‰∏ÄÈ•ÆËÄåÂ∞Ω„ÄÇÊù®Â≠£Ëã±Êé•Ëøá‰∏ÄÊùØÈÖíÔºå‰∏çÁ¶ÅËã¶Á¨ë‰∏ÄÂ£∞Ôºå‰πü‰∏ÄÈ•ÆËÄåÂ∞Ω„ÄÇÊ≠§Êó∂ÁöÑÊù®Â≠£Ëã±Âíå‰∏Ä‰∏™Êó∂Ëæ∞ÂâçÁÆÄÁõ¥Âà§Ëã•‰∏§‰∫∫ÔºåÂ±ÅËÇ°ÁöÆÂºÄËÇâÁªΩ‰∏çËØ¥ÔºåÁæûÂ§Ñ„ÄÅÂ±Å.ÁúºÂÖ®ÈÉΩ‰º§ÁóïÁ¥ØÁ¥ØÔºåÊó©Áü•ÈÅì‰ªäÊó•Ë¶ÅÂèóÊ≠§Â§ßÁΩ™ÔºåÊù®Â≠£Ëã±ËØ¥‰ªÄ‰πà‰πü‰∏ç‰ºöÈÄûËÉΩÁïô‰∏ãÊù•ÂèóÁΩöÔºåÁßãÈ£éÂêπËøáÔºåÊù®Â≠£Ëã±ÁöÑÂøÉÈáåÊòØ‰∏áËà¨ÂßîÂ±à„ÄÇ

Â§™Èò≥‰πüÂø´‰∏ãÂ±±‰∫ÜÔºåÊù®Â≠£Ëã±Á©ø‰∏äË°£ÊúçÊ≠£ÊÉ≥Á¶ªÂºÄÔºåÊ≤°ÊÉ≥Âà∞ÂíåÂæ∑ÂÖâËøòË¶ÅÊãâÂ•πÈô™ÈÖíÔºåÊó†Â•àÂè™Â•ΩÂú®ÊΩòÂ∫úÁ®ç‰ΩúÊ≤ªÁñóÔºåÂ∞±Êç¢‰∏ä‰∫ÜÊΩòÂ§´‰∫∫ÁöÑÁª∏ÁºéÔºåÁªßÁª≠Èô™ÂíåÂæ∑ÂÖâÂêÉÊôö‰∏äÁöÑÈÖíÂ∏≠„ÄÇ ÊôöÂÆ¥ÊêÅÂú®‰∫ÜÊΩòÂ∫úÂ†ÇÈáåÔºåÂ±ãÂÜÖÁÅØÁÅ´ÈÄöÊòéÔºå‰∏ÄÈÅìÈÅìÁæéÂë≥‰Ω≥ËÇ¥ÊëÜ‰∏äÊ°åÔºåËøòÊúâ‰∏â‰Ωç‰Ω≥‰∫∫‰Ωú‰º¥ÔºåÂíåÂæ∑ÂÖâÈ´òÂÖ¥ÊûÅ‰∫ÜÔºåÊù®Â≠£Ëã±ÁöÑÂ±ÅËÇ°‰∏ç‰∏Ä‰ºöÂÑøÂèàÊ∏óÂá∫Ë°ÄÊù•ÔºåÊääÊΩòÂ§´‰∫∫ÁöÑÁª∏ÁºéÊüìÈÄèÔºåÊΩòÂéø‰ª§ÂæàÊòØË±™ÁàΩÔºåÁõ¥Êé•ÊääË°£ÊúçÈÄÅÁªôÊù®Â≠£Ëã±ÔºåÂíåÂæ∑ÂÖâËøòËÆ©Êù®Â≠£Ëã±Ëµ∑Ë∫´ÔºåÊéÄÂºÄÂ•πÁöÑÁª∏ÁºéÂìÅÈâ¥‰∫Ü‰∏ÄÁï™ÔºåÂá†‰∫∫Ë∞àÁ¨ëÈ£éÁîüÔºåÊù®Â≠£Ëã±ÂøçÁóõÈô™Á¨ëÈô™ÈÖíÔºåÈ¢ùÂ§¥‰∏äÁöÑÊ±óÊì¶‰∫Ü‰∏ÄÈòµÂèàÂÜíÂá∫Êù•‰∏ÄÈòµÔºåÂ•πËØ¥‰ªÄ‰πà‰πü‰∏çËÉΩËæúË¥ü‰ªäÂ§©ÁöÑÁâ∫Áâ≤„ÄÇ ‚ÄúÊàëËØ¥ËøôÊ∑´ËáÄ‰∫îÂàëÁúüÊòØ‰∏™Â•Ω‰∏úË•øÔºåÊù®Â∞ÜÂÜõ‰ª•ÂêéËøòÊï¢‰∏çÊï¢ÊîæÁ∫µÊ∑´‰ΩìÂïäÔºü‚Äù ‚Äú‰∏çÊï¢‰∫Ü‚Ä¶Êú´Â∞ÜÂÜç‰πü‰∏çÊï¢‰∫Ü„ÄÇ‚Äù ‚ÄúÂìàÂìàÂìàÂ•ΩÔºåÊù®Â∞ÜÂÜõÁü•ÈîôËÉΩÊîπÔºåÊù•Êù•Êù•ÂÜçÂñù‰∏ÄÊùØ‚Äù' ÊûóÂ©âÂÑøÂíåÁß¶ÂÜ∞Âá§ÁúãËßÅÊù®Â≠£Ëã±Â¶ÇÊ≠§‰ΩéÂ£∞‰∏ãÊ∞îÔºå‰πüÈÉΩÂÄçÂä†Âä™ÂäõÁöÑ‰æçÂÄôÊôöÂÆ¥ÔºåÊÄïÂùè‰∫ÜÊù®Â∞ÜÂÜõÁöÑËÆ°Âàí„ÄÇÂíåÂæ∑ÂÖâÈùûÂ∏∏Êª°ÊÑèÔºåËøòÁâπÂú∞Ëµè‰∫ÜÂ±ãÈáåÂ±ãÂ§ñÂøôÊ¥ªÁöÑ‰∏´È¨üÔºåÁªôÂ•π‰ª¨‰πüË¶Å‰∫Ü‰∏ÄÊ°åÈÖíÂ∏≠ÔºåÂú®Â§ñÂ±ãÂêÉÔºåÂ§úÊôöÁöÑÊΩòÂ∫úÈöæÂæóÂ¶ÇÊ≠§ÁÉ≠ÈóπÔºåÂ±ãÈáåÂ±ãÂ§ñÈÉΩÂÖÖÊª°‰∫ÜÊ¨¢Â£∞Á¨ëËØ≠„ÄÇ

**ËØùÈ¢ò‰∏ÄÔºö‰Ω†Âú®Ëâ∫ÊúØÈ¢ÜÂüüÁöÑÁªèÂéÜÔºåÂØπÂæÖËâ∫ÊúØÁ±ªNFTÁöÑÊÄÅÂ∫¶ÂíåÊäïËµÑÈÄªËæëÊòØ‰ªÄ‰πàÔºü**

**Red_Phoenix**ÔºöÊàë‰ª¨‰∏ÄËØ¥Âà∞Ëâ∫ÊúØÔºåÂ§ßÂÆ∂ËÑëÊµ∑ÂΩì‰∏≠ÊµÆÁé∞ÁöÑÁîªÈù¢ÂèØËÉΩÊòØËÆ∏Â§öÈÉÅÈÉÅ‰∏çÂæóÂøóÁöÑÈùíÂπ¥ÁîªÂÆ∂Âú®Ë°óÂ§¥Êé®ÈîÄËá™Â∑±ÁöÑËâ∫ÊúØ‰ΩúÂìÅ„ÄÇÊàñËÄÖÊòØÊúâÁùÄÂéÜÂè≤ÊÇ†‰πÖÁöÑÂêçÂÆ∂Â§ß‰ΩúÔºåÊëÜÂú®ÂçöÁâ©È¶ÜÈáåÈù¢ËøõË°åÂ±ïËßàÔºåÊØè‰∏™‰∫∫ÂøÉ‰∏≠ÈÉΩÊúâËá™Â∑±ÂñúÊ¨¢ËÄå‰∏îÊé®Â¥áÁöÑËâ∫ÊúØÈ£éÊ†ºÔºåËÄå‰∏îËâ∫ÊúØÂæÄÂæÄ‰πüÁ¶ª‰∏çÂºÄ‰ª∑ÂÄºËøô‰∏™ËØçÊ±áÔºåÈÇ£Âú®NFTËØùÈ¢òÁÉ≠Â∫¶ÊÑàÂä†ÈºéÁõõÁöÑÂΩì‰∏ãÔºåÊàë‰ª¨ÊÉ≥ÊúâËØ∑ÂêÑ‰ΩçÂòâÂÆæËÅä‰∏Ä‰∏ãËá™Â∑±ÂíåËâ∫ÊúØÈ¢ÜÂüüÁõ∏ÂÖ≥ÁöÑË∂£‰∫ãÊàñËÄÖË°ÄÊ≥™Âè≤Ôºå‰ª•ÂèäËÅäËÅä‰Ω†‰ª¨ÊòØÊÄé‰πàÁúãÂæÖËâ∫ÊúØÁ±ªNFT‰πãÂêéÁöÑÂèëÂ±ïÂèØËÉΩÊÄßÁöÑÔºü

¬†

**James**ÔºöËÆ§‰∏∫ÁîµÂΩ±ÊòØÊå∫ÁâπÂà´ÁöÑ‰∏Ä‰∏™ËΩΩ‰ΩìÔºåÂæàÂÆπÊòìÂ∞±ËÉΩÂ§üË∑üÊàë‰ª¨ÊØè‰∏™ËßÇ‰ºó‰∫ßÁîü‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂøÉÂ∫ïÈáåÁöÑÂÖ±È∏£„ÄÇ‰∏Ä‰∫õ‰ºòÁßÄÁöÑ‰ΩúÂìÅÁªèÂ∏∏ËÉΩËÆ©Êàë‰ª¨ÂæàÂÆπÊòìÂ∞±Â∏¶ÂÖ•ÂâßÊÉÖÈáåÈù¢„ÄÇÊâÄ‰ª•ËØ¥Âú®ÁîµÂΩ±Èô¢ÁúãÁîµÂΩ±ÁöÑÊó∂ÂÄôÁªèÂ∏∏ÈÉΩ‰ºöÊúâÂê¨Âà∞ÂêÑÁßçÂè´Á¨ëÂ£∞Âì≠Â£∞‰πãÁ±ªÁöÑ„ÄÇËßâÂæóÁîµÂΩ±ÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™Âú®ÂÖ±ÊÉÖÂíåÂÖ±È∏£‰∏äÁâπÂà´Â•ΩÁöÑ‰∏Ä‰∏™ËΩΩ‰Ωì„ÄÇÊÑüËßâNFTËΩΩ‰ΩìÔºå‰∏ªË¶ÅÊòØËâ∫ÊúØÁ±ªÁöÑNFTÊØîËæÉÂ§ö‰∫∫ÂéªÊîØÊåÅÔºåÂèçËÄåÁîµÂΩ±NFTÊàñËÄÖÊòØÂΩ±ËßÜ‰ΩúÂìÅNFTÊöÇÊó∂Ê≤°Êúâ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÁàÜÂèëÁöÑÈÇ£‰∏™Èò∂ÊÆµ„ÄÇËÆ§‰∏∫Web3ÊòØ‰∏ÄÁßçÊñáÂåñÔºåÊòØÊé®Âä®ÂÖ±ÂàõÁöÑ‰∏ÄÁßçÊñáÂåñ„ÄÇËøô‰∏™ÊñáÂåñ‰∏ç‰ªÖ‰ªÖÊòØËØ¥ÔºåËøòÊòØÂÉè‰ª•Ââç‰∏ÄÊ†∑„ÄÇÊúâ‰∏ÄÂ∞èÊíÆ‰∫∫ÔºåËá™Â∑±ÂüãÂ§¥Ëã¶Âπ≤Ôºå‰ªé‰ΩúÂìÅÂà∞ÂâßÊú¨ÁöÑÊâìÁ£®Âà∞ÊãçÊëÑÁîöËá≥Âà∞‰∏äÊò†„ÄÇÊï¥‰∏™Âë®ÊúüÊØîËæÉÈïøÔºåËßÇ‰ºó‰∏ç‰∏ÄÂÆöËÉΩÂ§üÂèÇ‰∏éÂà∞Âú®ÈáåÈù¢„ÄÇÂ∏åÊúõÂú®Êú™Êù•ÔºåÊúâÂêÑÁßçÂêÑÊ†∑Á±ªÂûãÁöÑÂèÇ‰∏éËÄÖÔºå‰∏çÁÆ°ÊòØËßÇ‰ºó‰πüÂ•ΩÊàñËÄÖÂàõ‰ΩúËÄÖ‰πüÂ•ΩÔºåÈÉΩËÉΩÂ§üÂú®‰ΩúÂìÅÂú®Âàõ‰ΩúÁöÑËøáÁ®ãÂΩì‰∏≠Â∑≤ÁªèÂºÄÂßãÂèÇ‰∏éËøõÊù•ÔºåÂ§ßÂÆ∂Êõ¥Êó©Â∞±ÂºÄÂßãËøõÂéª‰∫ÜÔºåÊõ¥ËÉΩÂ§üË∑üËøô‰∏™‰ΩúÂìÅÊúâ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂÖ±È∏£„ÄÇÁÑ∂ÂêéËøòÁü•ÈÅì‰ªñÁöÑ‰ªéÂ§¥Âà∞Â∞æÁ©∂Á´üÊòØÊÄé‰πàÊ†∑ÁöÑ‰∏Ä‰ª∂‰∫ãÊÉÖÔºåÁîöËá≥‰πéÂ∞ÜÊù•ÊòØ‰ªñ‰ª¨‰πüÊòØÈÇ£‰∏™‰ΩúÂìÅÁöÑÊã•ÊúâËÄÖ‰πã‰∏Ä„ÄÇËÆ§‰∏∫ËøôÁÇπÊú¨Ë∫´ÊòØÁâπÂà´ÊúâÊÑèÊÄùÁöÑ‰∏Ä‰ª∂‰∫ãÊÉÖ„ÄÇ

**RIVA**ÔºöÊÉ≥Ëµ∑‰ªéÂæàÂ∞èÁöÑÊó∂ÂÄôÂÖ∂ÂÆûÂ∞±Â∑≤ÁªèÂºÄÂßãÊî∂ÈõÜËøôÁ±ªÂç°ÁâáÔºåÂΩìÊó∂ÈÇ£ÁßçÂç°‰πüÊòØÂæàÂ§ö‰∫∫ÈÉΩ‰ºöÊî∂ÈõÜÔºåÁÑ∂ÂêéÂæàÂ§ö‰∫∫ÂõûÂéªÂçñ„ÄÇ‰ΩÜÂÖ∂ÂÆûÊàëÂ•ΩÂÉèÊî∂‰∫Ü‰πãÂêéÔºåÊàë‰πüÊ≤°ÊúâÁâπÂà´ÂéªÂçñÔºåÂÖ∂ÂÆûÊàëÂ∞±ËßâÂæóÊàëÂ∞±Ê¨£Ëµè‰ªñ„ÄÇÁÑ∂ÂêéÊàëËßâÂæóÊî∂ÈõÜÂÆÉÊòØ‰∏Ä‰ª∂ÂæàÂºÄÂøÉÁöÑ‰∏Ä‰ª∂‰∫ãÊÉÖÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•Êàë‰ªäÂ§©Á™ÅÁÑ∂ÂèëÁé∞Ëøô‰ª∂‰∫ãÊÉÖÔºåÊàëÊâçÂèëÁé∞ÔºåÂìéÔºåÂÖ∂ÂÆûÊàë‰πüÊòØÂ∞èÊó∂ÂÄôÂ∞±ÂºÄÂßãÂÅöËøô‰ª∂‰∫ãÊÉÖ„ÄÇÁé∞Âú®Âú®NFTÂ∏ÇÂú∫ÈáåÔºå‰πü‰æùÁÑ∂‰ºöÂØªÊâæÊÑüËßâÊúâÊÑèÊÄùÁöÑÔºåÂæàÂñúÊ¨¢ÂæàÊ¨£ËµèÁöÑÈÇ£ÁßçÁ±ªÂûãÔºåÂéªÈôÜÈôÜÁª≠Áª≠Êî∂ÈõÜ‰∏Ä‰∫õNFT„ÄÇ‰πüÈÉΩÊòØholdÁùÄÔºå‰πü‰∏ç‰ºöÁâπÂà´ÊÉ≥Âçñ„ÄÇ ÁõÆÂâç‰∏ÄÁõ¥Âú®ËØó‰∫∫Ë∑üÂïÜ‰∫∫‰πãÈó¥Á∫†ÁªìÔºåÂ∞±ÊòØËØ¥‰Ω†ÂÖ∂ÂÆûÂæàÊÉ≥Ë¶ÅÂÅö‰∏Ä‰∏™ËØó‰∫∫ÔºåÂÅö‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂæàÊºÇ‰∫ÆÁöÑÈ°πÁõÆÔºå‰ΩÜÊòØÊØïÁ´üNFTÂèàÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊäïËµÑÂïÜÂìÅÔºåÂ§ßÂÆ∂ÂÖ∂ÂÆûÂ∞±ÊòØË¶ÅÊù•ËµöÈí±ÁöÑÔºå‰∏çÂèØ‰ª•ÈÅøÂÖçÔºå‰∏çÁü•ÈÅìËØ•ÊÄé‰πàËØ¥ÔºåÊÉ≥Âê¨Âê¨Â§ßÂÆ∂ÁöÑÊÉ≥Ê≥ï„ÄÇ

**ËØùÈ¢ò‰∏ÄÔºö‰Ω†Âú®Ëâ∫ÊúØÈ¢ÜÂüüÁöÑÁªèÂéÜÔºåÂØπÂæÖËâ∫ÊúØÁ±ªNFTÁöÑÊÄÅÂ∫¶ÂíåÊäïËµÑÈÄªËæëÊòØ‰ªÄ‰πàÔºü**

**Red_Phoenix**ÔºöÊàë‰ª¨‰∏ÄËØ¥Âà∞Ëâ∫ÊúØÔºåÂ§ßÂÆ∂ËÑëÊµ∑ÂΩì‰∏≠ÊµÆÁé∞ÁöÑÁîªÈù¢ÂèØËÉΩÊòØËÆ∏Â§öÈÉÅÈÉÅ‰∏çÂæóÂøóÁöÑÈùíÂπ¥ÁîªÂÆ∂Âú®Ë°óÂ§¥Êé®ÈîÄËá™Â∑±ÁöÑËâ∫ÊúØ‰ΩúÂìÅ„ÄÇÊàñËÄÖÊòØÊúâÁùÄÂéÜÂè≤ÊÇ†‰πÖÁöÑÂêçÂÆ∂Â§ß‰ΩúÔºåÊëÜÂú®ÂçöÁâ©È¶ÜÈáåÈù¢ËøõË°åÂ±ïËßàÔºåÊØè‰∏™‰∫∫ÂøÉ‰∏≠ÈÉΩÊúâËá™Â∑±ÂñúÊ¨¢ËÄå‰∏îÊé®Â¥áÁöÑËâ∫ÊúØÈ£éÊ†ºÔºåËÄå‰∏îËâ∫ÊúØÂæÄÂæÄ‰πüÁ¶ª‰∏çÂºÄ‰ª∑ÂÄºËøô‰∏™ËØçÊ±áÔºåÈÇ£Âú®NFTËØùÈ¢òÁÉ≠Â∫¶ÊÑàÂä†ÈºéÁõõÁöÑÂΩì‰∏ãÔºåÊàë‰ª¨ÊÉ≥ÊúâËØ∑ÂêÑ‰ΩçÂòâÂÆæËÅä‰∏Ä‰∏ãËá™Â∑±ÂíåËâ∫ÊúØÈ¢ÜÂüüÁõ∏ÂÖ≥ÁöÑË∂£‰∫ãÊàñËÄÖË°ÄÊ≥™Âè≤Ôºå‰ª•ÂèäËÅäËÅä‰Ω†‰ª¨ÊòØÊÄé‰πàÁúãÂæÖËâ∫ÊúØÁ±ªNFT‰πãÂêéÁöÑÂèëÂ±ïÂèØËÉΩÊÄßÁöÑÔºü

**James**ÔºöËÆ§‰∏∫ÁîµÂΩ±ÊòØÊå∫ÁâπÂà´ÁöÑ‰∏Ä‰∏™ËΩΩ‰ΩìÔºåÂæàÂÆπÊòìÂ∞±ËÉΩÂ§üË∑üÊàë‰ª¨ÊØè‰∏™ËßÇ‰ºó‰∫ßÁîü‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂøÉÂ∫ïÈáåÁöÑÂÖ±È∏£„ÄÇ‰∏Ä‰∫õ‰ºòÁßÄÁöÑ‰ΩúÂìÅÁªèÂ∏∏ËÉΩËÆ©Êàë‰ª¨ÂæàÂÆπÊòìÂ∞±Â∏¶ÂÖ•ÂâßÊÉÖÈáåÈù¢„ÄÇÊâÄ‰ª•ËØ¥Âú®ÁîµÂΩ±Èô¢ÁúãÁîµÂΩ±ÁöÑÊó∂ÂÄôÁªèÂ∏∏ÈÉΩ‰ºöÊúâÂê¨Âà∞ÂêÑÁßçÂè´Á¨ëÂ£∞Âì≠Â£∞‰πãÁ±ªÁöÑ„ÄÇËßâÂæóÁîµÂΩ±ÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™Âú®ÂÖ±ÊÉÖÂíåÂÖ±È∏£‰∏äÁâπÂà´Â•ΩÁöÑ‰∏Ä‰∏™ËΩΩ‰Ωì„ÄÇÊÑüËßâNFTËΩΩ‰ΩìÔºå‰∏ªË¶ÅÊòØËâ∫ÊúØÁ±ªÁöÑNFTÊØîËæÉÂ§ö‰∫∫ÂéªÊîØÊåÅÔºåÂèçËÄåÁîµÂΩ±NFTÊàñËÄÖÊòØÂΩ±ËßÜ‰ΩúÂìÅNFTÊöÇÊó∂Ê≤°Êúâ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÁàÜÂèëÁöÑÈÇ£‰∏™Èò∂ÊÆµ„ÄÇËÆ§‰∏∫Web3ÊòØ‰∏ÄÁßçÊñáÂåñÔºåÊòØÊé®Âä®ÂÖ±ÂàõÁöÑ‰∏ÄÁßçÊñáÂåñ„ÄÇËøô‰∏™ÊñáÂåñ‰∏ç‰ªÖ‰ªÖÊòØËØ¥ÔºåËøòÊòØÂÉè‰ª•Ââç‰∏ÄÊ†∑„ÄÇÊúâ‰∏ÄÂ∞èÊíÆ‰∫∫ÔºåËá™Â∑±ÂüãÂ§¥Ëã¶Âπ≤Ôºå‰ªé‰ΩúÂìÅÂà∞ÂâßÊú¨ÁöÑÊâìÁ£®Âà∞ÊãçÊëÑÁîöËá≥Âà∞‰∏äÊò†„ÄÇÊï¥‰∏™Âë®ÊúüÊØîËæÉÈïøÔºåËßÇ‰ºó‰∏ç‰∏ÄÂÆöËÉΩÂ§üÂèÇ‰∏éÂà∞Âú®ÈáåÈù¢„ÄÇÂ∏åÊúõÂú®Êú™Êù•ÔºåÊúâÂêÑÁßçÂêÑÊ†∑Á±ªÂûãÁöÑÂèÇ‰∏éËÄÖÔºå‰∏çÁÆ°ÊòØËßÇ‰ºó‰πüÂ•ΩÊàñËÄÖÂàõ‰ΩúËÄÖ‰πüÂ•ΩÔºåÈÉΩËÉΩÂ§üÂú®‰ΩúÂìÅÂú®Âàõ‰ΩúÁöÑËøáÁ®ãÂΩì‰∏≠Â∑≤ÁªèÂºÄÂßãÂèÇ‰∏éËøõÊù•ÔºåÂ§ßÂÆ∂Êõ¥Êó©Â∞±ÂºÄÂßãËøõÂéª‰∫ÜÔºåÊõ¥ËÉΩÂ§üË∑üËøô‰∏™‰ΩúÂìÅÊúâ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂÖ±È∏£„ÄÇÁÑ∂ÂêéËøòÁü•ÈÅì‰ªñÁöÑ‰ªéÂ§¥Âà∞Â∞æÁ©∂Á´üÊòØÊÄé‰πàÊ†∑ÁöÑ‰∏Ä‰ª∂‰∫ãÊÉÖÔºåÁîöËá≥‰πéÂ∞ÜÊù•ÊòØ‰ªñ‰ª¨‰πüÊòØÈÇ£‰∏™‰ΩúÂìÅÁöÑÊã•ÊúâËÄÖ‰πã‰∏Ä„ÄÇËÆ§‰∏∫ËøôÁÇπÊú¨Ë∫´ÊòØÁâπÂà´ÊúâÊÑèÊÄùÁöÑ‰∏Ä‰ª∂‰∫ãÊÉÖ„ÄÇ

**RIVA**ÔºöÊÉ≥Ëµ∑‰ªéÂæàÂ∞èÁöÑÊó∂ÂÄôÂÖ∂ÂÆûÂ∞±Â∑≤ÁªèÂºÄÂßãÊî∂ÈõÜËøôÁ±ªÂç°ÁâáÔºåÂΩìÊó∂ÈÇ£ÁßçÂç°‰πüÊòØÂæàÂ§ö‰∫∫ÈÉΩ‰ºöÊî∂ÈõÜÔºåÁÑ∂ÂêéÂæàÂ§ö‰∫∫ÂõûÂéªÂçñ„ÄÇ‰ΩÜÂÖ∂ÂÆûÊàëÂ•ΩÂÉèÊî∂‰∫Ü‰πãÂêéÔºåÊàë‰πüÊ≤°ÊúâÁâπÂà´ÂéªÂçñÔºåÂÖ∂ÂÆûÊàëÂ∞±ËßâÂæóÊàëÂ∞±Ê¨£Ëµè‰ªñ„ÄÇÁÑ∂ÂêéÊàëËßâÂæóÊî∂ÈõÜÂÆÉÊòØ‰∏Ä‰ª∂ÂæàÂºÄÂøÉÁöÑ‰∏Ä‰ª∂‰∫ãÊÉÖÔºåÊâÄ‰ª•Êàë‰ªäÂ§©Á™ÅÁÑ∂ÂèëÁé∞Ëøô‰ª∂‰∫ãÊÉÖÔºåÊàëÊâçÂèëÁé∞ÔºåÂìéÔºåÂÖ∂ÂÆûÊàë‰πüÊòØÂ∞èÊó∂ÂÄôÂ∞±ÂºÄÂßãÂÅöËøô‰ª∂‰∫ãÊÉÖ„ÄÇÁé∞Âú®Âú®NFTÂ∏ÇÂú∫ÈáåÔºå‰πü‰æùÁÑ∂‰ºöÂØªÊâæÊÑüËßâÊúâÊÑèÊÄùÁöÑÔºåÂæàÂñúÊ¨¢ÂæàÊ¨£ËµèÁöÑÈÇ£ÁßçÁ±ªÂûãÔºåÂéªÈôÜÈôÜÁª≠Áª≠Êî∂ÈõÜ‰∏Ä‰∫õNFT„ÄÇ‰πüÈÉΩÊòØholdÁùÄÔºå‰πü‰∏ç‰ºöÁâπÂà´ÊÉ≥Âçñ„ÄÇ ÁõÆÂâç‰∏ÄÁõ¥Âú®ËØó‰∫∫Ë∑üÂïÜ‰∫∫‰πãÈó¥Á∫†ÁªìÔºåÂ∞±ÊòØËØ¥‰Ω†ÂÖ∂ÂÆûÂæàÊÉ≥Ë¶ÅÂÅö‰∏Ä‰∏™ËØó‰∫∫ÔºåÂÅö‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂæàÊºÇ‰∫ÆÁöÑÈ°πÁõÆÔºå‰ΩÜÊòØÊØïÁ´üNFTÂèàÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊäïËµÑÂïÜÂìÅÔºåÂ§ßÂÆ∂ÂÖ∂ÂÆûÂ∞±ÊòØË¶ÅÊù•ËµöÈí±ÁöÑÔºå‰∏çÂèØ‰ª•ÈÅøÂÖçÔºå‰∏çÁü•ÈÅìËØ•ÊÄé‰πàËØ¥ÔºåÊÉ≥Âê¨Âê¨Â§ßÂÆ∂ÁöÑÊÉ≥Ê≥ï„ÄÇ

**Eleven**ÔºöËÆ§‰∏∫ÁõÆÂâçÁé©NFT‰πüÂíåËøáÂéªÁé©Ââ™Êä•‰∏ÄÊ†∑ÔºåÁúãÂà∞‰∏Ä‰∫õÊØîËæÉÂ•ΩÁöÑÂ≠ó‰ΩìÊàñÁîªÔºåÊàñËÄÖÊòØÊéíÁâàÔºåÂÜçÊàñËÄÖÊòØÊèíÁîª‰ªÄ‰πàÁöÑÔºåÈÉΩ‰ºöÊî∂ÈõÜËµ∑Êù•Ôºå‰ΩÜÊòØÂÖ∂ÂÆûÁ∫ØÁ≤πÂ∞±ÊòØ‰∏∫‰∫ÜÊî∂ÈõÜÔºå‰πüÊ≤°ÊúâËØ¥ÊÉ≥Ë¶ÅÂêéÊúüÂÜçÂéªËΩ¨ÂçñÊàñËÄÖÂçïÁ∫ØÁõàÂà©ÔºåÂ∞±ÊòØÂõ†‰∏∫ÂñúÊ¨¢„ÄÇ

ÈÄöËøáDVTÔºåÁî®Êà∑ÂèØ‰ª•ÊääÈ™åËØÅËÄÖÁ≠æÂêçÁßÅÈí•Âä†ÂØÜÂêéÂàÜÊàêÂ§ö‰ªΩÔºåÂàÜÈÖçÁªô‰∏çÂêåÁöÑËäÇÁÇπËøêËê•ÂïÜ„ÄÇËøôÁßçÊÉÖÂÜµ‰∏ãÔºåÂΩìÊúâÂ∞èÈÉ®ÂàÜËäÇÁÇπËøêËê•ÂïÜÁ¶ªÁ∫øÊàñËÄÖÊúâÊÅ∂ÊÑèË°å‰∏∫Êó∂ÔºåÊï¥‰∏™È™åËØÅÁªìÊûú‰∏ç‰ºöÂèóÂà∞ÂΩ±ÂìçÔºåETH‰∏ç‰ºöË¢´ÁΩöÊ≤°„ÄÇËøô‰πüÂ∞ÜÂ∏¶Êù•Êõ¥Âä†Âéª‰∏≠ÂøÉÂåñÁöÑ‰ª•Â§™ÂùäÁΩëÁªú„ÄÇËøôÁßçÊÄùË∑Ø‰πüÂèØ‰ª•Ë¢´Â∫îÁî®Âà∞ÂÖ∂‰ªñÊúâSlashingÊú∫Âà∂ÁöÑPoSÁΩëÁªú„ÄÇ

title: Web3/Metaverse quick hits #5
body:
## #5 What‚Äôs good in NFT/Metaverse

Alright‚Ä¶ back in action after a week vacation, here is issue 5 packed with goodness. We‚Äôve got: VR headset prices going up, you can now be served a lawsuit as an NFT, Disney ramps up on web3, Chipotle launches ‚ÄòBuy the Dip‚Äô, get into the web3 mind of a top CMO, my podcast appearance, my tips & insights and research I‚Äôm following.

## News & Interesting Projects

**Starting in August, the best VR headset goes up by $100**

You‚Äôve got 4 days to grab an [Oculus Quest 2](https://store.facebook.com/quest/products/quest-2/?intern_source=blog&intern_content=meta-quest-2-pricing-changes) if you don‚Äôt own one before the price increases. The 128GB version is $USD299 bumping to $399 and the 256GB is bumping from $399 to $499. Here‚Äôs Meta‚Äôs [announcement](https://www.oculus.com/blog/meta-quest-2-pricing-changes/).

**MY TAKE:** Meta says this price hike is to help them continue to invest in the VR space they‚Äôre all-in on. Hands down this VR headset is your gateway to the immersive metaverse. This device is a must have for any brand or agency building creative / technology experiences. In fact, leaders should be throwing these at their teams and saying ‚Äògo and make stuff‚Äô for the reasons I listed here ‚Äú[Company leaders: Your teams need VR headsets, yesterday!](https://medium.com/@onlyjohnd/company-leaders-your-teams-need-vr-headsets-yesterday-9b7a152beba)‚Äù.

**Imagine getting hit with a lawsuit from an NFT. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôve been airdropped‚Äù. Yup.**

An exchange was hacked for about $8 million in crypto earlier this year and a judge ruled that an airdrop to the hackers web3 wallet as an NFT was a legit way to deliver pertinent legal documents. Woah. Here‚Äôs [how it went down](https://www.jdsupra.com/legalnews/us-law-firm-airdrops-court-order-nfts-9522277/). The UK also gives the ok to [sue from the blockchain](https://time.com/6196582/court-nft-litigation-blockchain/).

**MY TAKE:** With NFTs effectively gaining the status of legal documentation this is big news. With wallets still so new to so many, this will be an interesting way to serve notices. Don‚Äôt want to split your crypto 50/50 during a divorce? Check your wallet for those papers, you may have just been served!

**Disney‚Äôs accelerator program goes big on web3 companies**

‚ÄòTo empower innovative collaborations with the Walt Disney Company‚Äô is [the mission](https://sites.disney.com/accelerator/faq/) of the Accelerator program. This time round [six web3 companies](https://thewaltdisneycompany.com/2022-disney-accelerator-participants-announced/) made the cut and they offer an incredible mix of capabilities across augmented reality, NFTs, and AI.

**MY TAKE:** This is killer signal that the worlds best storytellers are cooking up some exciting experiences to say the least. Where‚Äôs those imagineers? With in-person attendance at parks and events ‚Äòalmost‚Äô back to normal expect impressive experiences across location-based and virtual with ties to more modern views of 21st century loyalty using NFTs.

**Chipotle launches ‚ÄòBuy the Dip‚Äô for National Avocado Day offering 200k in crypto.**

‚ÄòThe market never sleeps but we do‚Äô says the scrolling banner at [chipotlebuythedip.xyz](https://www.chipotlebuythedip.xyz/) pointing to the next play starting at 1p ET today. The game runs for a few more days to 7/31 on National Avocado Day. They‚Äôre giving out out crypto prizes to over 500 players in cash value from $1250 to $35k awarded in Bitcoin, Eth, Dogecoin etc deposited to verified Coinbase accounts. There‚Äôs also free food vouchers to 700,000 others.‚ÄúWe want to build the next generation of Chipotle fandom by connecting with the Web3 community,‚Äù Chris Brandt, Chipotle‚Äôs CMO said.

**MY TAKE**: Although without an NFT drop yet (despite much pressure from [influencers](https://twitter.com/NicoleBehnam/status/1513640196125777921?s=20&t=UwEnvhn2incI8mS2MK5qYQ)), Chipotle is making big moves into web3: last month they [started accepting crypto](https://www.restaurantbusinessonline.com/technology/chipotle-now-accepts-cryptocurrency-payment) as payment at nearly all 3,000 US stores, they launched their [second metaverse](https://newsroom.chipotle.com/2022-04-05-FANS-CAN-ROLL-BURRITOS-AT-CHIPOTLE-IN-THE-METAVERSE-TO-EARN-BURRITOS-IN-REAL-LIFE) experience in [Roblox with the Burrito Builder](https://www.roblox.com/games/7603178367/Chipotle-Burrito-Builder), and now they‚Äôre giving away crypto with the ‚ÄòBuy the Dip‚Äô promo. Love this cheeky play on the phrase ‚Äòbuy the dip‚Äô. The phrase originates from when crypto stocks are low many suggest it being the right time to buy in. Keep going, Chipotle, and let us know what you‚Äôre learning from these projects.

A reminder to big brands on how to prepare for web3: start accepting crypto like many are, buy some NFTs to work the muscle and set a strategic path. See tweet below for how:

[https://twitter.com/johnjduffield/status/1526560765259526145?s=20&t=5DL7dFxjEHeVXLKVTI2Mmw](https://twitter.com/johnjduffield/status/1526560765259526145?s=20&t=5DL7dFxjEHeVXLKVTI2Mmw)

## A few of my tips & insights

**I‚Äôm trying to bust the myth that metaverse is only VR.**

Here‚Äôs my list of killer [browser-based virtual spaces](https://www.linkedin.com/posts/johnjduffield_virtualreality-metaverse-brand-activity-6954814307616370688-2KCE/?utm_source=linkedin_share&utm_medium=member_desktop_web) you must check out. No headset needed.

**Technology, innovation & healthcare**

Hear me talk about these spaces and how I landed in the world of creative agencies. A fun chat with [Bruno Larvol](https://www.linkedin.com/in/brunolarvol?miniProfileUrn=urn%3Ali%3Afs_miniProfile%3AACoAAAAShgQB2s9M32db6M72jivQuKvei-l-T00) ([Linkedin live](https://www.linkedin.com/video/event/urn:li:ugcPost:6952340322202882048/) 20mins).

**4 simple lessons learned from hundreds of launches and millions of users.**

I‚Äôve spent 20 years pushing some of the biggest brands and smallest startups into new creative territories. I spent some time distilling my favorite learnings into the bite size bits below:

[https://twitter.com/johnjduffield/status/1552265071916732416?s=20&t=oVcC2IffVFMAZEdBlog7Yg](https://twitter.com/johnjduffield/status/1552265071916732416?s=20&t=oVcC2IffVFMAZEdBlog7Yg)

## Research I‚Äôm following

**Still wrestling with the concept of bitcoin & web3? This clip is the best overview yet.**

I love the clear, simple & relatable explanation on the power of Blockchain, Bitcoin & Decentralization from the Director of Research at [Coin Center](https://www.linkedin.com/company/coin-center/) the non-profit focused on the policy issues facing cryptocurrencies. [Please watch](https://www.linkedin.com/posts/johnjduffield_bitcoin-blockchain-decentralized-activity-6958170745193607168-EJJ7?utm_source=linkedin_share&utm_medium=member_desktop_web).

**MY TAKE:** This brings home the importance of removing full reliance on intermediaries, the problems with single points of failure and how blockchain offers banking to anyone anywhere. Likely a nightmare to banks & tech giants.

**60 top web3/metaverse resources & white papers in one place for you**

Deep dive into the list belowgraciously compiled by [Denis Dybsky](https://www.linkedin.com/in/dybskydenis?miniProfileUrn=urn%3Ali%3Afs_miniProfile%3AACoAAAtVdG4BBn_1e5fsZeGCr2VVyTtRMfp35mw) ‚Äî so much value here:

[https://twitter.com/johnjduffield/status/1551230407382818832?s=20&t=aPdbHa__zs-CU9ycH9uvow](https://twitter.com/johnjduffield/status/1551230407382818832?s=20&t=aPdbHa__zs-CU9ycH9uvow)

**Great thread on the value of Web3 from [PepsiCo](https://www.linkedin.com/company/pepsico/)** CMO **[Todd Kaplan](https://www.linkedin.com/in/toddkaplan?miniProfileUrn=urn%3Ali%3Afs_miniProfile%3AACoAAABaeu8BjWN7LPTmG1c05WCrr8yBbJrpJy4)**.

Not a fad. More than just collectibles. Not all headline grabs. Tidal wave of innovation. This post (and most interestingly the dialogue in the 240+ comments) is [a great read](https://www.linkedin.com/posts/toddkaplan_web3-nfts-technology-activity-6950860578089316352-0-jr?utm_source=linkedin_share&utm_medium=member_desktop_web) to see what goes on in the minds of top marketing figures. Todd leans into simplicity and examples delivered with empathy.

**That‚Äôs it.**

Thanks to my readers. Let me know if this was helpful and please share with 2 colleagues who would dig it üëç

**ELAINE**¬†ÔºöDream CapitalÁöÑÂØπÂ§ñ‰∏ªË¶ÅË¥üË¥£ÔºåWaterdrid fund‰∏∫2017Âπ¥ËÄÅÁâåVCÔºåÊú¨Ë∫´‰πüÊòØ‰∏ÄÂêçNFTÁà±Â•ΩËÄÖ

**‰∏ªÈ¢ò‰∏ÄÔºöWEB2‰∫ßÂìÅÂ¶Ç‰ΩïËøõÂÖ•WEB3ÔºåÂ∫îËØ•Ë¶ÅÈÅµÂæ™‰ªÄÈ∫ΩËßÑÂàôÂë¢Ôºü**

title: Final candidates for next UK prime minister have made pro-crypto statements
body:
Rishi Sunak, the former chancellor of the Exchequer, and Liz Truss, Secretary of State for Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Affairs, two of the final candidates to become the next prime minister for the United Kingdom, have both previously expressed pro-crypto views.

With Prime Minister Boris Johnson soon to be out of office, Sunak and Truss are competing to be the next leader of the Conservative Party and the country, with their views on digital assets likely to influence financial policy. Under Johnson, Sunak requested that the country‚Äôs Royal Mint [create a nonfungible token](https://cointelegraph.com/news/nifty-news-uk-royal-mint-nft-960k-billionaire-dog-rug-and-pudgy-penguins) as part of an effort to make the United Kingdom a global crypto hub.

A member of Parliament who [served as chancellor](https://cointelegraph.com/news/exodus-of-pro-crypto-financial-regulators-in-uk-amid-allegations-of-misconduct-in-pm-s-government) from 2020 until resigning in July, Sunak previously said the U.K. government would prioritize financial technology, including central bank digital currencies and stablecoins, aiming for the country to keep pace with innovation. He has also [been behind many proposed financial services reforms](https://cointelegraph.com/news/uk-chancellor-names-cbdc-on-list-of-financial-reforms-for-treasury) promoting the adoption of cryptocurrencies and stablecoins.

Truss, who has been the Secretary of State for Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Affairs since 2021 and Minister for Women and Equalities since 2019, serving under three prime ministers, called for an anti-regulatory approach to crypto in 2018 in an effort for the U.K. to embrace the technology. In her role as Secretary of State for International Trade, the MP [launched](https://www.gov.uk/government/news/liz-truss-launches-future-trade-strategy-for-uk-tech-industry) a digital trade network in 2020 whose measures included promoting fintech firms that ‚Äúenable\[d\] digitisation and resilience in priority export markets.‚Äù

***Related: [Majority of British crypto owners revealed to be hodlers: Survey](https://cointelegraph.com/news/majority-of-british-crypto-owners-revealed-to-be-hodlers-survey)***

Amid Johnson‚Äôs expected departure, policy decisions have continued to move forward in the United Kingdom. Nadhim Zahawi, who replaced Sunak as chancellor of the Exchequer, [introduced a Financial Services and Markets Bill](https://cointelegraph.com/news/uk-financial-markets-bill-authorizes-regulation-of-stablecoins-service-providers) on July 20, which contained a regulatory framework for stablecoins. The Treasury Committee of the House of Commons also [opened an inquiry allowing U.K. residents](https://cointelegraph.com/news/uk-treasury-committee-opens-inquiry-into-crypto-industry) to write in about the role of crypto assets in the country.

The Conservative Party is expected to decide between Sunak and Truss as the next leader by Sept. 5, at which point Johnson will officially step down. On Tuesday, the two candidates took part in a televised debate that was cut short after moderator Kate McCann [fainted](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2022/7/26/sunak-and-truss-debate-abandoned-after-host-faints) while on air.

Êú¨ÊñáÁ≥ª‰ª•Â§™ÂùäËÅîÂêàÂàõÂßã‰∫∫ Vitalik Buterin ‰∫é 7 Êúà 21 Êó•ÂèÇÂä†Âú®Â∑¥ÈªéÂè¨ÂºÄÁöÑ‰ª•Â§™ÂùäÁ§æÂå∫‰ºöËÆÆ ETHCC5 Âπ∂ÈíàÂØπ‰ª•Â§™ÂùäÂêàÂπ∂ËøõÂ∫¶‰ª•Âèä‰ª•Â§™ÂùäÊú™Êù•Ë∑ØÁ∫øÂõæÂèëË°®ÊºîËÆ≤„ÄÇÂå∫ÂùóÈìæÂºÄÂèëÂ∑•ÂÖ∑Êèê‰æõÂïÜ Biconomy CTO Sachin Tomar ÂíåÂä†ÂØÜÁ†îÁ©∂Âëò Miles Deutscher Âú® Twitter ‰∏äÂØπÊ≠§Ê¨°ÊºîËÆ≤ËøõË°å‰∫ÜÊÄªÁªìÔºå‰ª•‰∏ã‰∏∫Áõ∏ÂÖ≥ËØëÊñá„ÄÇ

Vitalik Ë°®Á§∫Ôºå‰ª•Â§™ÂùäÂú®ÂÆåÊàê 5 ‰∏™ÂÖ≥ÈîÆÈò∂ÊÆµÂêéÂèØÂÆûÁé∞ 10 ‰∏á TPS„ÄÇËøô 5 ‰∏™Èò∂ÊÆµÊòØÔºö

![VitalikÂú®ETHCCÁöÑÊºîËÆ≤Ôºö‰ª•Â§™ÂùäÂèëÂ±ïË∑ØÁ∫øÂõæÂíåÈïøÊúüÊú™Êù•ÁöÑÊÄùËÄÉ](https://cdn-img.panewslab.com//panews/2022/7/23/images/3f650cb024b547050ec178f3ad8ad981.png)

**01. The Merge (ÂêàÂπ∂) Èò∂ÊÆµ**

ÂêàÂπ∂ÊòØÊåá‰ª•Â§™ÂùäÊâßË°åÂ±Ç (ÂΩìÂâçÁöÑ‰ª•Â§™Âùä‰∏ªÁΩë) ‰∏é‰ø°Ê†áÈìæ (Êñ∞ÁöÑ POS Â±Ç) ÁöÑÂêàÂπ∂„ÄÇ

ÂØπ‰ª•Â§™ÂùäËÄåË®ÄÔºåËøôÊÑèÂë≥ÁùÄÔºö

1\. ETH Êàê‰∏∫ÈÄöÁº©ÊÄßËµÑ‰∫ß (ÂèëË°åÂáèÂ∞ëÈáè)Ôºõ

2\. ÂáèÂ∞ë‰∫Ü 99% ÁöÑËÉΩÊ∫êÊ∂àËÄó„ÄÇ

Êú¨Ê¨°ÂçáÁ∫ßÁõÆÂâçÊöÇÂÆö 2022Âπ¥9Êúà19Êó•„ÄÇ

**02. The Surge Èò∂ÊÆµ (2023)**

Êú¨Èò∂ÊÆµÊåáÂú®‰ª•Â§™Âùä‰∏äÂºïÂÖ•ÂàÜÁâá (Sharding)„ÄÇ

ÂàÜÁâáÊòØÂ∞Ü‰ª•Â§™ÂùäÂå∫ÂùóÈìæÁöÑÊï¥‰∏™ÁΩëÁªúÂàÜÊàêÊõ¥Â∞èÁöÑÂàÜÂå∫ (Áß∞‰∏∫‚ÄúÂàÜÁâáÈìæ‚Äù)„ÄÇËøôÂ∞ÜÊòæËëóÊèêÈ´ò‰ª•Â§™ÂùäÁΩëÁªúÁöÑÂèØÊâ©Â±ïÊÄß„ÄÇ

![VitalikÂú®ETHCCÁöÑÊºîËÆ≤Ôºö‰ª•Â§™ÂùäÂèëÂ±ïË∑ØÁ∫øÂõæÂíåÈïøÊúüÊú™Êù•ÁöÑÊÄùËÄÉ](https://cdn-img.panewslab.com//panews/2022/7/23/images/c6fb1330d4d2c63a379fd4adb88bd88b.png)

**03. The Verge Èò∂ÊÆµ**

Êú¨Èò∂ÊÆµÂ∞ÜÂºïÂÖ• Verkle Ê†ëÔºåËøôÊòØ‚ÄúÂØπ Merkle ËØÅÊòéÁöÑÂº∫Â§ßÂçáÁ∫ßÔºåÂÖÅËÆ∏ÂÆûÁé∞Êõ¥Â∞èÁöÑËØÅÊòéÂ§ßÂ∞è (proof sizes)‚Äù„ÄÇ

ËøôÂ∞Ü‰ºòÂåñ‰ª•Â§™Âùä‰∏äÁöÑÂ≠òÂÇ®ÔºåÂπ∂ÊúâÂä©‰∫éÂáèÂ∞ëËäÇÁÇπÂ§ßÂ∞è„ÄÇÊúÄÁªàÔºåËøôÂ∞ÜÂ∏ÆÂä©‰ª•Â§™ÂùäÂèòÂæóÊõ¥ÂÖ∑ÂèØÊâ©Â±ïÊÄß„ÄÇ

![VitalikÂú®ETHCCÁöÑÊºîËÆ≤Ôºö‰ª•Â§™ÂùäÂèëÂ±ïË∑ØÁ∫øÂõæÂíåÈïøÊúüÊú™Êù•ÁöÑÊÄùËÄÉ](https://cdn-img.panewslab.com//panews/2022/7/23/images/fca0c50566950857bcc0272469ac758d.png)

**04. The Purge Èò∂ÊÆµ**

Êú¨Èò∂ÊÆµÂ∞ÜÂáèÂ∞ëÈ™åËØÅËÄÖÊâÄÈúÄÁöÑÁ°¨ÁõòÁ©∫Èó¥ÔºåËøôÂ∞ÜÈÄöËøáÂâîÈô§ÂéÜÂè≤Êï∞ÊçÆÂíåÊ∂àÈô§ÊäÄÊúØÂÄ∫Âä°Êù•ÂÆûÁé∞„ÄÇ

ËøôÊÑèÂë≥ÁùÄÂ≠òÂÇ®ÁÆÄÂåñÔºå‰ªéËÄåÂáèÂ∞ëÁΩëÁªúÊã•Â°û„ÄÇ

![VitalikÂú®ETHCCÁöÑÊºîËÆ≤Ôºö‰ª•Â§™ÂùäÂèëÂ±ïË∑ØÁ∫øÂõæÂíåÈïøÊúüÊú™Êù•ÁöÑÊÄùËÄÉ](https://cdn-img.panewslab.com//panews/2022/7/23/images/f92c9f4c76ac1f657f7c484edd3e9e4b.png)

**05. The Splurge Èò∂ÊÆµ**

Êú¨Èò∂ÊÆµÂ∞ÜËøõË°å‰∏ÄÁ≥ªÂàóÊùÇ‰∏ÉÊùÇÂÖ´ÁöÑ\*ËæÉÂ∞è\*ÂçáÁ∫ßÔºåÁ°Æ‰øù‰ª•Â§™ÂùäÁΩëÁªúÂú®‰∏äËø∞ 4 ‰∏™Èò∂ÊÆµÂÆåÊàê‰πãÂêéÂπ≥Á®≥ËøêË°å„ÄÇ

Èô§‰∫ÜÊñ∞Ë∑ØÁ∫øÂõæÁöÑ 5 Â§ßÈò∂ÊÆµÔºåV Á•ûËøòÂØπ‰ª•Â§™ÂùäÂΩìÂâçÈóÆÈ¢òÂèäÊú™Êù•ÂèëÂ±ïËøõË°å‰∫ÜÂ±ïÊúõ„ÄÇSachin Tomar ÊÄªÁªìÂ¶Ç‰∏ãÔºö

1\. ËÆ∫ËØÅ L1 ‰∏é L2 ÁöÑÂÖ≥Á≥ª

![VitalikÂú®ETHCCÁöÑÊºîËÆ≤Ôºö‰ª•Â§™ÂùäÂèëÂ±ïË∑ØÁ∫øÂõæÂíåÈïøÊúüÊú™Êù•ÁöÑÊÄùËÄÉ](https://cdn-img.panewslab.com//panews/2022/7/23/images/acc98e51e5bb5d54600235af55b94b36.png)

Vitalik Ë°®Á§∫ÔºöÊàë‰ª¨Ê≠£Â§Ñ‰∫é‰∏Ä‰∏™ÈÄöËøáÂçèËÆÆÂø´ÈÄüÂèòÂåñ‰ªéËÄåÊèêÂçá‰ª•Â§™Âùä (L1) ËÉΩÂäõÁöÑÈò∂ÊÆµ„ÄÇ‰ΩÜÊúÄÁªàÊàë‰ª¨Â∞ÜÂÅúÊ≠¢ÂØπÂçèËÆÆËøõË°åÂø´ÈÄüÊõ¥ÊîπÔºåÂπ∂Âà©Áî® L2 (Á¨¨‰∫åÂ±ÇÁΩëÁªú) Á≠âÁ≥ªÁªü‰∏∫‰ª•Â§™ÂùäÁîüÊÄÅÁ≥ªÁªüÊ∑ªÂä†Êõ¥Â§öÂäüËÉΩ„ÄÇ

‰ª•Â§™Âùä L1 Â±ÇÁî®‰∫éÊèê‰æõÂÆâÂÖ®ÊÄßÂíåÂèØÈù†ÊÄßÔºåL2 Â±ÇÁî®‰∫éÂø´ÈÄüËø≠‰ª£Êìç‰Ωú„ÄÇ

‚ÄúÂäüËÉΩÈÄÉÈÄ∏ÈÄüÂ∫¶‚Äù (Functionality escape velocity) ÁêÜËÆ∫Ôºö‰∏ÄÊó¶ L1 Ë∂≥Â§üÂº∫Â§ßÔºåÂâ©‰∏ãÁöÑ‰∫§Áªô L2 Â∞±ÂèØ‰ª•‰∫Ü„ÄÇÂºÄÂèë‰∫∫ÂëòÈúÄË¶Å‰ºëÊÅØÔºåÊñ∞ÂäüËÉΩÈúÄË¶ÅÊó∂Èó¥Êù•Èôç‰ΩéÈ£éÈô©„ÄÇ

2\. Vitalik ÁöÑÊãÖÂøß

![VitalikÂú®ETHCCÁöÑÊºîËÆ≤Ôºö‰ª•Â§™ÂùäÂèëÂ±ïË∑ØÁ∫øÂõæÂíåÈïøÊúüÊú™Êù•ÁöÑÊÄùËÄÉ](https://cdn-img.panewslab.com//panews/2022/7/23/images/68a4649d0da6383091572fe6a99059fc.png)

Ê∑ªÂä†ÂØπÂ§ö‰∏™ËôöÊãüÊú∫ÁöÑÊîØÊåÅÂ∞Ü‰ºöÂ¢ûÂä†ÂÖ±ËØÜÂ§çÊùÇÊÄßÔºõ

Ëß£ÂÜ≥Âü∫Á°ÄÂ±Ç SNARKS ËÄå‰∏çÊòØÁ≠âÂæÖÊõ¥Â•ΩÁöÑË∑ØÂæÑËÆæËÆ°„ÄÇ

‰Ωø‰ª•Â§™ÂùäÂèòÂæóÂ¶ÇÊ≠§Â§çÊùÇÔºå‰ª•Ëá≥‰∫éÂè™ÊúâÂºÄÂèë‰∫∫ÂëòÊâçËÉΩÁêÜËß£ÂÆÉÁöÑËÆæËÆ°„ÄÇ

**3. ÈïøÊúüÁöÑÂõûÊä•ÈúÄË¶ÅÁü≠ÊúüÁöÑÁóõËã¶**

![VitalikÂú®ETHCCÁöÑÊºîËÆ≤Ôºö‰ª•Â§™ÂùäÂèëÂ±ïË∑ØÁ∫øÂõæÂíåÈïøÊúüÊú™Êù•ÁöÑÊÄùËÄÉ](https://cdn-img.panewslab.com//panews/2022/7/23/images/cefd1345afd5829cdfa9d526a5758f70.png)

Âõ¥Áªï child calls„ÄÅÂ≠òÂÇ®Á≠âÊîπÈù© Gas ÊàêÊú¨ËßÑÂàô„ÄÇ

ÂØπ‰∫é EIP-4444ÔºöÂÆ¢Êà∑Á´ØÂøÖÈ°ªÂÅúÊ≠¢Âú® p2p Â±Ç‰∏äÊèê‰æõË∂ÖËøá‰∏ÄÂπ¥ÁöÑÂéÜÂè≤ headers (Âå∫ÂùóÂ§¥)„ÄÅbodies (Âå∫Âùó‰Ωì) ÂíåÊî∂ÊçÆÔºåÂÆ¢Êà∑Á´ØÂèØ‰ª•Âú®Êú¨Âú∞Âà†Èô§Ëøô‰∫õÂéÜÂè≤Êï∞ÊçÆ„ÄÇ

EVM (‰ª•Â§™ÂùäËôöÊãüÊú∫) ÁöÑÊîπËøõ„ÄÇ

ÂàáÊç¢Âà∞ Verkle Ê†ë (Áî®Êõ¥Â∞ëÁöÑÁ©∫Èó¥Â≠òÂÇ®Êõ¥Â§öÁöÑÊï∞ÊçÆ)„ÄÇËøôÂèØËÉΩÊÑèÂë≥ÁùÄ‰ª•Â§™ÂùäÊ≤°ÊúâÂêëÂêéÂÖºÂÆπÊÄß„ÄÇ

**4. ‰∏ìÊ≥®‰∫é‰ª•Â§™ÂùäÁΩëÁªúÁöÑÂéª‰∏≠ÂøÉÂåñ**

![VitalikÂú®ETHCCÁöÑÊºîËÆ≤Ôºö‰ª•Â§™ÂùäÂèëÂ±ïË∑ØÁ∫øÂõæÂíåÈïøÊúüÊú™Êù•ÁöÑÊÄùËÄÉ](https://cdn-img.panewslab.com//panews/2022/7/23/images/8725da03ae172b6f67327cbf5d26f8f5.png)

ÂΩìÂâçÁöÑÂºÄÂèëÈáçÁÇπÂ∫îËØ•ËÅöÁÑ¶Âú®Êòì‰∫é‰ΩøÁî®ÁöÑËΩªÂÆ¢Êà∑Á´ØÔºåËÆ©‰ªª‰Ωï‰∫∫ÈÉΩÂèØ‰ª•ËøêË°åÂÆÉ‰ª¨„ÄÇ

Êõ¥Â•ΩÂú∞ÊîØÊåÅ‰∫∫‰ª¨Âú®ÂÆ∂Â∞±ËÉΩÂèÇ‰∏é‰ª•Â§™ÂùäË¥®ÊäºÔºåÂπ∂ÊîØÊåÅËæÉÂ∞èËßÑÊ®°ÁöÑÂéª‰∏≠ÂøÉÂåñË¥®ÊäºÊ±† (staking pools)„ÄÇ

**DCLÔºöÊÇ®ËÆ§‰∏∫‰ΩøÁî®Ê≠§Á±ªÊ¥ªÂä®Âíå‰ΩìÈ™åÊù•Êé®ÂπøÂìÅÁâåÊàñÁ§æÂå∫ÁöÑÊΩúÂäõÂíåÂ•ΩÂ§ÑÊòØ‰ªÄ‰πàÔºüÊÇ®ËÆ§‰∏∫ÂÆÉ‰∏é‰º†ÁªüÁöÑ‰øÉÈîÄÊñπÂºèÁõ∏ÊØîÂ¶Ç‰ΩïÔºü**

**PMÔºö**ÂÖÉÂÆáÂÆôÂºÄËæü‰∫ÜÂìÅÁâåÂèäÂÖ∂Á§æÂå∫‰πãÈó¥ÂèÇ‰∏éÁöÑÊñ∞ÊñπÂºè„ÄÇÂÆÉÊØîÂÖ∂‰ªñ‰º†ÁªüÁöÑÂπøÂëäÊñπÂºèÊõ¥ÂÖ∑Ê≤âÊµ∏ÊÑü„ÄÅÂê∏ÂºïÂäõÂíå‰πêË∂£„ÄÇÂ¶ÇÊûúÊàë‰ª¨Â∞ÜÂÖ∂‰∏éÂå∫ÂùóÈìæÁõ∏ÁªìÂêàÔºåÊàë‰ª¨Â∞ÜËé∑ÂæóÊõ¥Â§öÊñ∞ÁöÑÊñπÂºèÊù•‰∏éÊàë‰ª¨ÁöÑËßÇ‰ºó‰∫íÂä®ËÄåËææÂà∞‰∏Ä‰∏™Êñ∞ÁöÑÊ∞¥Âπ≥Ôºå‰ªñ‰ª¨‰∏çÂÜçË¢´ËßÜ‰∏∫‰∏™‰∫∫ÂÆ¢Êà∑ÔºåËÄåÊòØ‰Ωú‰∏∫‰∏Ä‰∏™Êï¥‰ΩìÁ§æÂå∫Ôºå‰∫∫‰ª¨ÂèØ‰ª•ÈÄöËøáÂ§öÁßçÊñπÂºèÂèÇ‰∏éÔºå‰æãÂ¶ÇÊäïÁ•®ÊàñÊã•ÊúâÂìÅÁâåÁöÑÊï∞Â≠ó‰∫ßÂìÅÂèØ‰ª•‰∏∫‰ªñ‰ª¨Â∏¶Êù•‰∏Ä‰∫õÂÖ∂ÂÆÉÊñπÂºèÊó†Ê≥ïËé∑ÂæóÁöÑÂ•ΩÂ§ÑÂíåÈ¢ùÂ§ñÂ•ñÂä±„ÄÇ

**DCLÔºö‰Ω†Âú® Decentraland ‰∏∫ÂìÅÁâåËÆæËÆ°ÂíåÂàõÈÄ†‰ªÄ‰πàÊ†∑ÁöÑ‰ΩìÈ™åÔºü**

**PMÔºö**ÂóØÔºåÂÉèËøôÊ†∑ÁöÑÈ°πÁõÆÊúâÂæàÂ§öÈò∂ÊÆµ„ÄÇÊ†πÊçÆÂÆ¢Êà∑ÂèäÂÖ∂ÂØπWeb3/ÂÖÉÂÆáÂÆôÁöÑ‰∫ÜËß£ÔºåÈ°πÁõÆÂú®È¢ÑÁîü‰∫ßÈò∂ÊÆµÂèØËÉΩÊØîÂÆûÈôÖÁîü‰∫ßÈò∂ÊÆµËä±Ë¥πÊõ¥Â§öÁöÑÊó∂Èó¥„ÄÇÊàë‰ª¨ÈÄöÂ∏∏‰ªé‰∏Ä‰∫õÂí®ËØ¢‰ºöËÆÆÂºÄÂßãÔºåÂú®ÈÇ£ÈáåÊàë‰ª¨ÂàÜ‰∫´Êàë‰ª¨ÂÖ≥‰∫é Web3 ÂíåÂÖÉÂÆáÂÆôÊøÄÊ¥ªÁöÑÁü•ËØÜÂíå‰∏ì‰∏öÁü•ËØÜÔºåÁÑ∂ÂêéÊàë‰ª¨ËøõÂÖ•È¢ÑÁîü‰∫ßÈò∂ÊÆµÔºåÊàë‰ª¨‰∏∫È°πÁõÆÂª∫Á´ãÊÑøÊôØÂíåÁõÆÊ†áÔºåÁ°Æ‰øùÊàë‰ª¨‰∏éÊàë‰ª¨ÁöÑÂêà‰Ωú‰ºô‰º¥ÂÆåÂÖ®‰∏ÄËá¥Ôºå‰∏ç‰ªÖÂú®Ëâ∫ÊúØ‰∏äÔºåËÄå‰∏î‰ªéËê•ÈîÄ/ÂïÜ‰∏öÁöÑËßíÂ∫¶Êù•Áúã‰πüÊòØÂ¶ÇÊ≠§„ÄÇÊúÄÂêéÊàë‰ª¨ËøõÂÖ•Áîü‰∫ßÈò∂ÊÆµÔºåÊàë‰ª¨‰∏çÊñ≠ÂàÜ‰∫´Êàë‰ª¨ÁöÑÂ∑•‰ΩúËøõÂ±ïÂπ∂Âú®ÂèëÂ∏ÉÂâçËÆ®ËÆ∫Ëê•ÈîÄÁ≠ñÁï•„ÄÇ

**PMÔºö**Êàë‰ª¨ÁöÑÁ¨¨‰∏ÄÊù°Âª∫ËÆÆÊòØÂú®ÂÅö‰ªª‰Ωï‰∫ãÊÉÖ‰πãÂâçÂÖàËä±Êó∂Èó¥Âú® Decentraland„ÄÇ‰ªéÂÖ∂‰ªñ‰∫∫Ê≠£Âú®ÂÅö‰ªÄ‰πàÔºå‰ªñ‰ª¨Â¶Ç‰Ωï‰ª•Âèä‰∏∫‰ªÄ‰πàËøôÊ†∑ÂÅö‰ª•Âèä‰∫∫‰ª¨Âú®Âπ≥Âè∞‰∏äÁöÑÊú¨Âú∞Ë°å‰∏∫‰∏≠Â≠¶‰π†„ÄÇÊàë‰ª¨Â∑≤ÁªèÁúãÂà∞ËÆ∏Â§öÊñ∞ËÆæËÆ°Â∏àÂ∞ÜÂ§ßÈáèÊó∂Èó¥ÊäïÂÖ•Âà∞ÂÆåÂÖ®ËÑ±ËäÇÁöÑ‰∫ãÁâ©‰∏äÔºåËÄåÁ§æÂå∫ÂèØ‰ª•ÂæàÂø´ÁúãÂà∞Ëøô‰∏ÄÁÇπ„ÄÇËá≥‰∫éÊäÄËÉΩÁªÑÂêàÔºåËøôÊõ¥ÈöæÂõûÁ≠î„ÄÇÂú®Ëøô‰∏ÄÁÇπ‰∏äÔºåÊàë‰ª¨ÁöÑÂ∑•‰ΩúÂÆ§‰∏™‰∫∫ÈúÄË¶ÅÂπøÊ≥õÁöÑÊäÄËÉΩÔºåÂõ†‰∏∫Êàë‰ª¨ÁöÑÁªèÈ™åÂèòÂæóÈùûÂ∏∏ËØ¶ÁªÜ„ÄÇÊàë‰ª¨ÈúÄË¶Å 3D Ëâ∫ÊúØÂÆ∂„ÄÅÊ∏∏ÊàèÂºÄÂèë‰∫∫Âëò„ÄÅÂå∫ÂùóÈìæÂºÄÂèë‰∫∫Âëò„ÄÅÂä®ÁîªÂ∏à„ÄÅWeb ÂºÄÂèë‰∫∫ÂëòÁ≠âÁ≠â‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‰ΩÜÂ¶ÇÊûú‰Ω†ÊâçÂàöÂºÄÂßãÔºå‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊúâÁ®ãÂ∫èÂëòÂíåËâ∫ÊúØÂÆ∂ÁöÑÂõ¢ÈòüÂ∞±Ë∂≥‰ª•Âú® Decentraland ‰∏≠Âà∂‰ΩúÂæàÈÖ∑ÁöÑ‰∏úË•ø„ÄÇ

**DCLÔºö‰Ω†ËÆ§‰∏∫Ëøô‰∫õÁ±ªÂûãÁöÑÊøÄÊ¥ªÂíå‰øÉÈîÄÊòØÊú™Êù•ÂêóÔºü‰Ω†ËÆ§‰∏∫ÂÆÉ‰ª¨Â∞ÜÂ¶Ç‰ΩïÈöèÁùÄÊó∂Èó¥ÁöÑÊé®ÁßªËÄåÂèòÂåñÂíåÂèëÂ±ïÔºü**

**PMÔºö**ÊòØÁöÑÔºÅ‰∏éÂ∏∏ËßÑÂπøÂëäÁõ∏ÊØîÔºåËøô‰∫õ‰∏æÊé™ÂØπÁî®Êà∑ËÄåË®ÄÊõ¥ÂÖ∑‰∫íÂä®ÊÄßÔºåÂÆÉ‰ª¨ËøòÂèØ‰ª•‰∏∫‰Ω†Êèê‰æõÊúâÂÖ≥Ë∞ÅÂØπ‰Ω†ÁöÑÂìÅÁâåÊÑüÂÖ¥Ë∂£‰ª•ÂèäÊÑüÂÖ¥Ë∂£Á®ãÂ∫¶ÁöÑÁõ¥Êé•‰ø°ÊÅØÔºÅËøôÊ†∑ÁöÑ‰∫ãÊÉÖÂæàÈöæÈ¢ÑËßÅÔºåÂ∞±Âú®‰∏ÄÂπ¥ÂâçÔºåÊàë‰ª¨‰∏∫ MTN DEW Âà∂‰ΩúÁöÑ‰∫ã‰ª∂ÊòØÂÆåÂÖ®Êó†Ê≥ïÊ¶ÇÂøµÂåñÁöÑ„ÄÇ Decentraland Âá†‰πéÊØèÂ§©ÈÉΩÂú®ÊäÄÊúØÂ±ÇÈù¢‰∏äÂèëÂ±ïÔºåÂêåÊó∂‰πüÂú®Á§æÂå∫Â±ÇÈù¢‰∏äÂèëÂ±ï„ÄÇÊñ∞Êù•ËÄÖÂ∏¶ÁùÄÊñ∞ÊÉ≥Ê≥ïËøõÂÖ•Âπ≥Âè∞Ôºå‰ΩøÊï¥‰∏™Âπ≥Âè∞ÊóãËΩ¨‰ª•ÈÄÇÂ∫î‰ªñ‰ª¨„ÄÇÂÆûÊó∂ÁúãÂà∞ÂèòÂåñÊòØÈùûÂ∏∏‰ª§‰∫∫ÂÖ¥Â•ãÁöÑ„ÄÇÊàë‰ª¨ÊúüÊúõÁöÑÊòØÊõ¥‰∏∞ÂØåÁöÑ‰ΩìÈ™åÔºåË¥®ÈáèËÉú‰∫éÊï∞Èáè„ÄÇ
